description:
Lets learn about how you can subsitude modern medicine for essential oils.


Modern Medicine 

These drugs are designed to manage symptoms and often they just mask them. •Prescription drugs are made from isolated synthetic agents designed to mimic natural substances.

 • All drugs have side effects and the misuse of prescription drugs has devastating consequences. Annually, $4.5 trillion dollars is spent globally on healthcare. • Are we healthier because of it? 

 • Nature’s medicine helps support the body by minimizing symptoms and addressing root causes. 

One of the most effective forms of natural medicine are essential oils. Essential oils are natural aromatic compounds found in plants. They are essential to the life of the plant and to the life of people on our planet. Plants are used in many different ways for helping and healing others but the most concentrated way to use them is in the form of essential oils. 

Essential oils are used safely and without harmful side effects. • Another benefit is that they cost pennies per dose. They also can be administered in the comfort of your own home,  reducing trips to the doctor, exposure to other illnesses, and co-pays.
name: Medicine Cabinet Makeover with ESSENTIAL OILS

Bangkok Art and Culture Centre proudly presents “Cinema Diverse: Director's Choice”. For the third Cinema Diverse, five international films, selected by five acclaimed Thai directors, will be shown bi-monthly from March – November 2015, followed by a talk with the director after each screening.

The first screening on Saturday 14 March 2015 will be a film from USA, Frances Ha (2012) directed by Noah Baumbach and chosen by Nawapol Thamrongrattanarit, the talented young Thai director of Mary Is Happy, Mary Is Happy, 36 and the Master.

Frances Ha has been screened in many international film festivals and was nominated for Best Actress (Comedy or Musical) at the Golden Globes (2014) and Best International Independent Film at British Independent Film Awards (2014)

*Free entry
*Screening in English with Thai subtitles
*Film screening starts at 17.30 hrs.
*The talk after the screening will be in Thai with English translation.
*The film is suitable for 15 years and over.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YBn5dgXFMis

description:
This course is great for Lightroom newcomers and post-processing beginners . .

Please bring the following:

A laptop with LR4, 5, or CC, plus Photoshop if you have it and any other software tools you want to incorporate.



Several raw images on a camera memory card and a drive or cable to download with.

A digital camera and hardware - what you normally use.

A copy of your current directories and/or catalogs of images, or whatever content you want to include in a Lightroom-managed environment.

If you’re already using Lightroom, be sure to bring both the catalog files and the actual image file folders. If images are in multiple folders or a system of hierarchical folders, copy the whole structure as-is to a portable or laptop drive.
name: The Lightroom Launchpad! Import, Process, and Edit Your Images

description:
Come along to the first Purposeful Life Meetup to meet others who are seeking a more meaningful life and share insights about where to begin the journey.

* What this Meetup Group is about.

This group is based on a 4 week structured group program I run that explores individual purpose, values and obstacles people face living a more authentic life. (see my website www.on-purpose.com.au for more info)


Research shows that the majority of employees have disengaged from their work due to a lack of connection with their job.

This will be an opportunity to share your own struggles, successes and strategies in leading a more purposeful life.

* Who should join.

Anyone who is dissatisfied with the quality of their lives and thirst for deeper contentment and meaning.


* What members can expect of the group, and what you expect of them.

Each meetup will have a component of sharing to the whole group based on a topic ( eg finding work that is purposeful ) by one of the members about where they are on this journey.
name: Purposeful Life First Meetup

description:
What up Black Professionals,

Spring is in the air !...Hopefully it will actually stay soon lol. On another note, the organizers in BPU-30 try to come up new and exciting events that are in contrast with the same ol, same ol. So with that being said, I just got the scoop that in a land not too far from ATL the world's tallest & fastest GigaCoaster will be opening in 3 weeks. So hopefully you understand what I'm about to say.......ROADTRIP !!!!!. That's right we're planning in getting in car(s) to head to Charlotte, NC for the day to hit the new and improved Carowinds amusement park to ride Fury 325...the biggest & baddest roller coaster in the USA. 


Charlotte is about 3.5 hours away for the people who do the speed limit. Yes, I do the speed limit for any law enforcement in the group lol. We'll leave ATL at 5:30 AM and get Charlotte around 8 or 9 AM. We'll have breakfast and then spend the day riding all the cool rides at Carowinds. The park closes at 10pm. 

Ticket prices online for admission are $41.99. If we carpool, tip in for gas, and of course have some money for food/refreshments at the park for the day. 

Fury 325 GigaCoaster

Fury 325 fully embodies this same aggressive power that, like a furious hornet, just won't let up. With heights reaching 325 feet, a staggering length of 6,602 feet and breathtaking speeds of 95 miles per hour, this 2,700-ton “hornet’s nest of rebellion” carries the same agility, bravery and passionate spirit of its hometown.



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lR2PIV1u3FU
name: Carowinds Charlotte, NC - Ride the World's Tallest & Fastest New GigaCoaster

description:
Organized by the Muscarelle Museum of Art, this unprecedented selection of more than twenty-five masterpiece drawings by Leonardo da Vinci and Michelangelo from Italian museums is the first exhibition to explore Leonardo’s philosophy of beauty as contrasted with his rival Michelangelo.  Also featured will be Leonardo’s renowned Codex on the Flight of Birds, containing a hidden self-portrait at age fifty-three, which has never previously been exhibited.

http://Muscarelle.org/leonardo-da-vinci-idea-beauty

Advance tickets are available at the museum webpage.  It is $15 for museum admission, which includes the DaVinci exhibit.  I am already going with a group of friends, and am inviting along anyone else who would like to join us.  If enough people are interested, I'll try to schedule a docent tour of the exhibit while we are there, so please RSVP by March 19, for at least a rough head count.
name: Leonardo DaVinci and the Idea of Beauty

description:
Please join us to share the experience of seeing my all-time favorite movie, for the first time on the big screen... This amazing and uplifting 1994 film is about two imprisoned men bonding over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency. 

At the time, it stirred something in me like no other film.  It premiered on Friday, October 14, 1994, but I didn't see it until it was released on video (VHS)! 

GROUP MEETING SPOT: 7:30PM at BIG donation box in the center lobby. SHOWTIME: 8PM. TICKETS are just $5 and can be purchase at the box office or online in July here: 

The Shawshank Redemption (1994) is an impressive, engrossing piece of film-making from director & screenwriter Frank Darabont who adapted horror master Stephen King's 1982 novella Rita Hayworth and Shawshank Redemption (originally published in 1982 in the collection Different Seasons) for his first feature film. It is an uplifting, deeply satisfying experience that connects us with its message of hope, perseverance and purpose in the face of life's struggles.

The Story: A prominent banker unjustly convicted of murder spends many years in the Shawshank prison. He is befriended by a convict who knows the ropes and helps him to cope with the frightening realities of prison life. 

Cast: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler, Clancy Brown, Gil Bellows and James Whitmore. 

20 Things You Didn’t Know About 'The Shawshank Redemption' 

"THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION' Review by the great Roger Ebert:

It is a strange comment to make about a film set inside a prison, but "The Shawshank Redemption" creates a warm hold on our feelings because it makes us a member of a family. Many movies offer us vicarious experiences and quick, superficial emotions. "Shawshank" slows down and looks. It uses the narrator's calm, observant voice to include us in the story of men who have formed a community behind bars. It is deeper than most films; about continuity in a lifetime, based on friendship and hope. See full review here.

Roger Ebert & Gene Siskel ecstatic review of The Shawshank Redemption 

PARKING at the Redford: The Redford Theatre is located at 17360 Lahser Road, Detroit, MI 48219. The theatre is on the east side of Lahser, just north of Grand River. 

Parking at the Redford: Parking is adjacent to the theater in a secured lot with security on staff.

"Fear can hold you prisoner. Hope can set you free."
name: The Shawshank Redemption @ The Redford (1994)

New Media Arts - the transgression of the practical and symbolic boundaries of art?


Asia Society Hong Kong Center and Art Central Education Program Series

EVENT DETAILS

14 March 2015
3:00pm - 4:00pm
Central Harbourfront Event Space, 9 Lung Wo Road

Click for Directions
Add to Google Calendar
Free admission; Registration not required

CLICK here 

http://asiasociety.org/hong-kong/events/new-media-arts-transgression-practical-and-symbolic-boundaries-art




Afternoon Discussion with Island Art Collective, Liu Dao; Kingsley Ng, Artist; Yang Yeung, Curator, and Isaac Leung, Moderator
Discussion at 3pm - 4pm

New technologies and production-distribution models have opened doors for many media artists and gallerists in recent years. New media has become an increasingly viable way for individuals to tell their personal stories and engage audiences. In a time when many first-generation artists are enjoying their successes far beyond their national borders, how do new media artists transgress the practical and symbolic boundaries within the hierarchy of their artistic, cultural and economic recognition? How do they imagine the world of new media art? This panel aims to explore the current trends of media arts, with the intention of uncovering how new modes of production, distribution, and exhibition have fundamentally changed the landscape of cultures.

Kingsley Ng received postgraduate training at Le Fresnoy – National Studio of Contemporary Arts in France, an MSc in Sustainable Design from University of Edinburgh in the UK. He has participated in “Agora Festival” (IRCAM, Centre Pompidou, Paris, France, 2006), “Echigo Tsumari Art Triennial” (Niigata, Japan, 2009), “Guangzhou Triennial” (Guangzhou, China, 2012), “Digital Life” (Mustum of Contemporary Arts, Rome, Italy, 2014). His awards include the Arts Development Council Best Artist Award in Media Arts 2014, the Asian Cultural Council Grant 2013, and Hong Kong Contemporary Art Biennial Awards 2009. He is currently a lecturer at the Hong Kong Baptist University Academy of Visual Arts.

Island 6 Art Collective (Liu Dao) is an innovative artist collective based in Shanghai. Driven by collaboration at every step, this diverse group of new media artists, technological talents, and creative thinkers have been active around the globe since Liu Dao’s founding in 2006. With members hailing from eclectic artistic, technical, and academic backgrounds, Liu Dao seeks to create unexpected media combinations that balance the delicate qualities of traditional art with the technical complexities of the contemporary. Liu Dao’s work often includes such unique pairings as high-definition photographs coupled with dynamic LED animations, and traditional Chinese paper cutting matched with cutting-edge video art. The acclaimed collective has been invited to exhibit their work in solo and group exhibitions around the world, including at the Louis Vuitton Cultural Spaces in Taipei and Macau, the Smithsonian Anacostia Museum, and the Rockbund Museum. Liu Dao’s work is included in the K11 Collection in Shanghai and the White Rabbit Collection in Sydney, among many others.

Yang Yeung is an independent curator, writer and university lecturer. Her curationincludes regarding lightness: On Life’s Way (currently showing at Oi! Hong Kong), Around sound art festival & retreat 2009, 2010, 2013, Burdening Representations – historical memory of China from Hong Kong (2009), and Art Responds to 14QK (2007). She is a regular contributor to AM Post. The dogs participating in our program have gentle dispositions but may not have received any special training. Therefore, guardians accompanying children or disabled adults are especially encouraged to seek advice from the pet owner before touching an animal. Read more...

Please note that all participants in this walk will be asked to sign a waiver releasing Vancouver Ecovillage from any responsibility in case of injury during this walk for any reason. This includes tripping and falling, dog bites, scratches, or other unforseen injuries.

Our dogs are excited about meeting you and so are we!

description:
Chi Gong has been a Chinese health practice for over three thousand years.  Used for health, martial arts, scholarly focus and spiritual reasons, it changes the body's chemistry and the mind's circuitry in short order.  We will be practicing medical Chi Gong, and Alzada Magdalena has taught this for 20 years.  She has seen profound changes in students - improvements in asthma, in heart palpitations, flexibility, mood, headache control, and many other elements of people's lives.  The best part of Chi Gong is that you can learn how to change your body and your experience so that you are in control.  And it feels great!  How can you beat that?  Come join us and enjoy!


Regular practice is best, and I love committed students, so ask about the monthly rates when you show up.  ($45 per month) 


 For those who like to really get cookin' with the Chi, check out the intensive on March 21 (look on the calendar).  All day.  Loads of sound and meditative Chi Gong.  YUM!
name: We will have a great time practicing Chi Gong! Beginners welcome

description:
New Media Arts - the transgression of the practical and symbolic boundaries of art?


Asia Society Hong Kong Center and Art Central Education Program Series

EVENT DETAILS

14 March 2015
3:00pm - 4:00pm
Central Harbourfront Event Space, 9 Lung Wo Road

Click for Directions
Add to Google Calendar
Free admission; Registration not required

CLICK here 

http://asiasociety.org/hong-kong/events/new-media-arts-transgression-practical-and-symbolic-boundaries-art




Afternoon Discussion with Island Art Collective, Liu Dao; Kingsley Ng, Artist; Yang Yeung, Curator, and Isaac Leung, Moderator
Discussion at 3pm - 4pm

New technologies and production-distribution models have opened doors for many media artists and gallerists in recent years. New media has become an increasingly viable way for individuals to tell their personal stories and engage audiences. In a time when many first-generation artists are enjoying their successes far beyond their national borders, how do new media artists transgress the practical and symbolic boundaries within the hierarchy of their artistic, cultural and economic recognition? How do they imagine the world of new media art? This panel aims to explore the current trends of media arts, with the intention of uncovering how new modes of production, distribution, and exhibition have fundamentally changed the landscape of cultures.

Kingsley Ng received postgraduate training at Le Fresnoy – National Studio of Contemporary Arts in France, an MSc in Sustainable Design from University of Edinburgh in the UK. He has participated in “Agora Festival” (IRCAM, Centre Pompidou, Paris, France, 2006), “Echigo Tsumari Art Triennial” (Niigata, Japan, 2009), “Guangzhou Triennial” (Guangzhou, China, 2012), “Digital Life” (Mustum of Contemporary Arts, Rome, Italy, 2014). His awards include the Arts Development Council Best Artist Award in Media Arts 2014, the Asian Cultural Council Grant 2013, and Hong Kong Contemporary Art Biennial Awards 2009. He is currently a lecturer at the Hong Kong Baptist University Academy of Visual Arts.

Island 6 Art Collective (Liu Dao) is an innovative artist collective based in Shanghai. Driven by collaboration at every step, this diverse group of new media artists, technological talents, and creative thinkers have been active around the globe since Liu Dao’s founding in 2006. With members hailing from eclectic artistic, technical, and academic backgrounds, Liu Dao seeks to create unexpected media combinations that balance the delicate qualities of traditional art with the technical complexities of the contemporary. Liu Dao’s work often includes such unique pairings as high-definition photographs coupled with dynamic LED animations, and traditional Chinese paper cutting matched with cutting-edge video art. The acclaimed collective has been invited to exhibit their work in solo and group exhibitions around the world, including at the Louis Vuitton Cultural Spaces in Taipei and Macau, the Smithsonian Anacostia Museum, and the Rockbund Museum. Liu Dao’s work is included in the K11 Collection in Shanghai and the White Rabbit Collection in Sydney, among many others.

Yang Yeung is an independent curator, writer and university lecturer. Her curationincludes regarding lightness: On Life’s Way (currently showing at Oi! Hong Kong), Around sound art festival & retreat 2009, 2010, 2013, Burdening Representations – historical memory of China from Hong Kong (2009), and Art Responds to 14QK (2007). She is a regular contributor to AM Post. Her recent publications include Hong Kong/China Photographers Series 7 - Alfred Ko (HK, 2012); and “Art education in the university itself – a perspective from general education” in What Do Artists Know? (Ed. James Elkins, Chicago 2012). She is editor of STAMPED: Project Glocal (Manila, HK, 2015), Ten Years After – sketches (MCCM, HK, 2013), Away from the Crowd - the art of Jaffa Lam (HK, 2013) andPocket 2: say, Listen (HK, 2013). She is member of AICAHK and Art Appraisal Club. She founded soundpocket in 2008 (www.soundpocket.org.hk). She was awarded the ACC Fellowship in 2013.

Isaac Leung is a practicing artist, curator and researcher in art and culture. Leung received an Honorary Fellowship of a Bachelor of Fine Arts at the New Media Art Department of the School of the Art Institute of Chicago and Central Saint Martins College of Art and Design, the University of the Arts London. His passion in exploring issues in contemporary art began during his time in college. During[masked], his artworks were exhibited in over 30 venues across the globe. In 2013, Leung was appointed as the Chairman of Videotage. During his tenure, he initiated and participated in projects that included exhibitions, workshops, lectures, publications, online projects and symposia.

description:
Have you ever felt that you have to follow formalities strictly with some complicated manners every time at CHA NO YU (a traditional style japanese tea ceremony)?

Of course, there is a variety of rules that depends on seasons, which parties and schools of tea etc...
but the bare essential is to Enjoy the Time, not a matter of form.

-Basic Process of CHA NO YU-
A Host create a atmospher of scilentness and peacefulness. Then he/she makes tea for guests forcusing on keeping up a good mind during that.
4GUEST(s)...thankfully enjoy tea feeling the host's mind in it.

Like these simple rules, let's have a tea ceremony!

10:30 ~13:00

include PRESENTATION, SWEETS,  introducing how to DRINK & TO MAKE A TEA (usucha), HANDOUTS IN ENGLISH

This course is great for Lightroom newcomers and post-processing beginners . .

Please bring the following:

A laptop with LR4, 5, or CC, plus Photoshop if you have it and any other software tools you want to incorporate.



Several raw images on a camera memory card and a drive or cable to download with.

A digital camera and hardware - what you normally use.

A copy of your current directories and/or catalogs of images, or whatever content you want to include in a Lightroom-managed environment.

If you’re already using Lightroom, be sure to bring both the catalog files and the actual image file folders. If images are in multiple folders or a system of hierarchical folders, copy the whole structure as-is to a portable or laptop drive.

description:
Stroller Strides® is a total fitness program that moms can do with their babies. It includes power walking and intervals of strength and body toning exercises using exercise tubing, the stroller and the environment. Taught by certified and specially trained fitness instructors, it is a great workout for any level of exerciser. Stroller Strides instructors weave songs and activities into the routine designed to entertain and engage baby, while moms are led through a series of exercises specific to her role as mom.

This unique program also provides moms with the opportunity to meet other moms, engage in playgroups with their babies, and to form lasting friendships. Stroller Strides is designed to give mothers the "Strength for Motherhood!"

Your First class is always FREE!! Register online at www.strollerstrides.net/millcreek.   Great class for working mothers and also to bring the husbands with you to get fit together!

description:
This meeting will be talking place on-line in Honolulu at 2:00 pm, the meeting can also be viewed during New York time at 7:00pm. Please click here to convert the time to your location: 

http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/meeting.html

About the Speaker:
• Adam Smith is a creative developer based in Minneapolis, MN. 

• He uses the abundance of cold days to stay in and craft interactive experiences for the web, desktop, and digital installations. 

• He has worked heavily with the Flash platform, but is also versed in PHP, MySQL, Coldfusion, HTML, CSS, Javascript, and several API’s. 

• His experience is mostly in advertising, having worked on such brands as adidas, American Eagle, American Express, CNN, Forever 21, Harley-Davidson, Porsche, Jack Link’s, Starz Channel, and many others. 

About the Presentation:
Adobe's Flash platform, specifically AIR, is an extremely powerful tool for creating rich experiences across devices. In February's Hawaii Flash User Group talk, Adam will share some background on his MosaicStudio product build in Flash and AIR, and present a case study of the La Mer campaign that licensed the technology for a global product launch. 

This talk will cover reusable application architecture, some 'gotchas' with the Apple App Store, usability considerations, and overall workflow.
name: Using Flash & AIR for Making Applications

The New Ink Generation: Young Artists on What the Classical Ink Painting Tradition Means to Them
Asia Society Hong Kong Center and Art Central Education Program Series


EVENT DETAILS

15 March 2015
3:00pm - 4:00pm
Central Harbourfront Event Space, 9 Lung Wo Road

Click for Directions
Add to Google Calendar
Free admission; Registration not required

Click link below
http://asiasociety.org/hong-kong/events/new-ink-generation-young-artists-what-classical-ink-painting-tradition-means-them



Afternoon Discussion with Artists Hung Fai, Hong Wai, Peng Wei, Ni Youyu, and Tiffany Beres (Moderator)
Discussion 3pm - 4pm

The Chinese tradition of “ink art” stretches far beyond brush-and-ink painting, to embrace a set of aesthetic principles centered on renewal and reinterpretation of the past. Today, while numerous contemporary artists allude to traditional Chinese pictorial and calligraphic concepts in their visual vocabulary, there are far fewer artists whose work suggests a conscientious effort to engage with and transform this ancient Chinese art form as a defining feature of their artistic vision. This forum will invite four emerging young artists whose artistic voice meaningfully reference the age-old “ink aesthetic” with the use of new artistic media and techniques. Representing different major modern ink art centers in Asia, and having all exhibited and/or worked abroad, these young globally conscious contemporary artists share background in traditional ink painting yet explore radically different methodologies in their new "ink" artwork to access a global audience. During the forum, these neo-traditionalist artists will discuss their artistic practice, and how they have been able to transform, extend and reconstruct the ink tradition in a postmodern context.

Hung Fai born in Hong Kong (1988), graduated from the Fine Arts department of The Chinese University of Hong Kong in 2013 and is currently working as a full-time artist in Hong Kong. Hung Fai’s creation focuses mainly on the field of contemporary Chinese ink art. Hung has developed unique expression and presentation techniques on both paper and canvas. Through deconstruction of elements in traditional Chinese ink paintings, his works are reconstructed conceptually with series of experimentation and transformation, and extended possibilities in ink painting. Hung Fai has exhibited in Hong Kong and held a solo exhibition “Movement - Hung Fai” in 2014. He has received awards including the Certificates of Merit - Hong Kong Art Prize 2013, Wucius Wong Creative Ink Painting Award (2013), among others. His works have been collected by M+ Museum for Visual Culture, Hong Kong and private collectors.

Hong Wai born in mainland China (1982) and raised in Macao is an ink transmedia artist based in Paris and Macao. She journeys with ink to a new frontier, that of the mysterious feminine, though the technique has been confined to a masculine universe for centuries. Her works have been exhibited worldwide, from Macao, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Taiwan, Singapore, Melbourne, Montreal, London, Paris, and featured in various exhibitions, art fairs and international publications. Her doctoral studies are on the deceased ink painter Wu Guangzhong. Hong’s latest joint exhibition was Like Thunder Out of China in Montreal/Toronto together with artists Gao Brothers, Hung Tunglu, Cang Xin , Zhang Huan, Chang Lei, Lu Feifei and Dai Guangyu.

Peng Wei born in Chengdu, China (1974) and lives and works in Beijing. She graduated from Nankai University with a BA in Fine Art in 1997, and earned a MPhil in Aesthetics in 2000. From 2000 to 2006 she was editor for ART Magazine. Peng Wei is a conservator of Chinese aesthetics, updating and revitalizing elements of classical Chinese painting and bringing her fresh perspective to ancient Chinese art forms. Paying particular attention to materials and iconography, Peng Wei is perhaps best known for her delicate ink color paintings on silk and paper which combine imagery of traditional literati painting with more modern forms and expressions from everyday life. Peng Wei’s works have been exhibited extensively around Asia and have been collected by the Boston Museum, the Brooklyn Museum, the Asian Art Museum of San Francisco, the National Art Museum of China, the Hong Kong Museum of Art, the M+ Museum, the Uli Sigg Collection, among others.

Ni Youyu (b. 1984) graduated from the department of Chinese Painting, College of Fine Arts, Shanghai University in 2007. He currently lives and works in Shanghai. Although trained in traditional Chinese landscape painting, today Ni Youyu’s art diverges from traditional media by embracing contemporary and more experimental practices or re-inventing traditional Chinese media. As a process of deconstructing art history, Ni Youyu often creates thought provoking multimedia works through processes of erasure and erosion. In 2014 Ni Youyu was awarded “Best Young Artist” at the Contemporary Chinese Art Awards (CCAA) and in 2012 he was also the youngest artist to be given a solo exhibition at the Shanghai Art Museum. His works have been exhibited extensively around the world and have been collected by several museums around the world.

Tiffany Wai-Ying Beres is an independent art curator, whose research focuses on modern and contemporary Chinese ink art. Born in San Francisco, California to a bi-racial family, Tiffany grew up practicing ink painting and calligraphy, stimulating her interest in Chinese art and art history. After graduating from Brown University and apprenticing in the Asian antiquities field, she moved to China on a Fulbright fellowship to explore ink art in its native milieu and to meet the artists revolutionizing the field. From 2007 to 2010, Tiffany served as international affairs officer and a Chinese ink painting specialist for China Guardian, China’s largest auction house, before returning to work directly with artists. Tiffany has conducted exhibitions in the USA, France, Singapore, Hong Kong, and Mainland China and is a frequent lecturer on the topic of Chinese art. In addition to working with celebrated ink art masters, Tiffany has a particular passion for discovering and exposing young ink artists.  

Please note: This is a non-host event but one that we think will interest the members of the Hong Kong Expats. Attendees can arrange to Meet Up beforehand by posting below.
name: [ART/PANEL] The New Ink Generation

description:
Upscale Soulmate Connections offers singles the chance to mingle, connect and network with people for business and personal requirements and invites sponsors for the same.

With a tight day to day schedule, many of us don’t get much time to get out a bit and socialize. From the start of the day to the end, we’re so booked with work, that we don’t get time for ourselves. In the process, we lose the golden opportunity to do one of the most important things in life- make friends, connect with people and have fun!

There are many ways for you to do this. You can always join a club, start yoga lessons in your free time, or simply create a profile on online dating or networking websites. But here’s the real challenge; how do you make time for these things when you’re too busy to even indulge in a proper breakfast most of the days?

It is precisely for this reason that Upscale Soulmate Connections is hosting the It’s a Love Thing Singles Mixer Night. The event has been organized to provide today’s chic singles with the opportunity to connect with each other for business, as well as personal requirements.

Organized by Gwendolyn Boatright, CEO and Founder of Upscale Soulmate Connections and a professional matchmaker herself, the event is anticipated to draw individuals in the 30 plus, 40 plus and 50 plus age bars for a fun, interactive night, and will expand to New Jersey, Florida, North Carolina, South Carolina and Texas.

The event aims to present an exciting opportunity for all guests to connect with others. Special Guests the talented singer Petawane. In addition a special guest DJ will keep guests in good spirits with his toe-tapping numbers at the event.

Come join us for a night of absolute fun and don’t miss out on the opportunity to meet someone special. This event is a must-attend if you’re looking to change all of that. Hurry and buy the tickets.

Price includes:

Prizes and AppetizersGreat Performers, Music and ConnectionsFree Database EntryIcebreakers With Chances To Win PrizesMix and Mingle

Ticket Price $25.00. ALL TICKET SALES ARE FINAL

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

description:
"Lewis published Surprised by Joy in 1955, eight years before his death. In April of the following year, he married Joy in a private civil ceremony to prevent her deportation.

It is merely coincidence that Lewis married a woman named Joy. The title of this book was not intended to be associated with her. Rather, the title comes from a Wordsworth poem:

Surprised by joy - impatient as the Wind

I wished to share the transport - Oh! with whom

But Thee, long buried in the silent Tomb,

That spot which no vicissitude can find?

The book is not a comprehensive autobiography, but rather contains only the people, events and ideas that were part of Lewis's journey toward faith. In the opinion of one reviewer, "the deliberate, methodical way in which Lewis narrates his life parallels the meticulous arguments with which he constructed scholarly treatise and theological brief alike." (Dr. Bruce Edwards, Bowling Green State University, "Surprised by Joy by C. S. Lewis: A Critical Summary and Overview" at

http://personal.bgsu.edu/-edwards/surprised.html.)

Susan Wise Bauer offers an excellent summary of Surprised by Joy in her guide to reading the classics:

Lewis's autobiography is partly the story of his intellectual and imaginative development, and partly the tale of his coming to grips with Christian faith. This double tale is haunted by the possibility that the two might conflict, perhaps fatally. The title of Lewis's story comes from his attempt to discover the source of Joy, a piercing experience that he is not entirely able to describe in words . . . . Lewis's pursuit of Joy turns out to be the thread that binds his intellect and his faith together. At first, he chases Joy with his intellect, studying Norse mythology and other subjects that have brought him that unexpected stab of Joy in the past. The middle section of the book traces Lewis's education, painting a delightfully vivid portrait of his life at school, the tutor who introduces him to Greek, and his delight in finding book after book that speaks directly to his longing for Joy.

But as Lewis's delight turns "imperceptibly into a scholars' interest," he realizes that Joy has flown. . . . Joy, imagination, and intellect do not come together until the story's end, when Lewis's will is finally converted in a way that is completely inaccessible to his reason . . . . Only then does Lewis again find himself able to experience Joy-not as an end in itself, but as a signpost pointing him to the divine. (Susan Wise Bauer, The Well-Educated Mind: A Guide to the Classical Education You Never Had, W. W. Norton & Company (2003), pp. 155-56.)

As you read, think about how God has shaped your life. What experiences influenced you? Which people? How did God weave all that together to draw you to himself? To form you into the person you are today?"
(Excerpt from http://cslbookclub.com/site/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=141&Itemid=163)
name: Surprised By Joy by C.S. Lewis.  Discuss ch 1-3

description:
Edit (Fri 3/6)

Sunday is almost here!

You are working on four pieces:

Ave Verum Corpus (Mozart)
Miniature for Brass Quartet (Lo Presti)
Dialogue for Trombone and Trumpet I (Borden)
Dry Bones (trad., arr. Buss)

Trombones, you also have some simple madrigals which we may have the opportunity to play through. Trumpets, I will bring a simple sight-read just for us, too, time permitting.

Bring: your instrument, printed sheet music parts, $5 cash, a positive attitude

Do not bring: music stand, guests, food, pets, bad vibes

Arrive on time, ready to play! It is essential that you be respectful of the space and your fellow players. 

If you cannot make it, please change your RSVP to NO so that wait-listers can jump on. Thanks!

Edit (Thu 2/26)

Here's a video of a brass ensemble playing Lo Presti's Miniature for Brass Quartet. NB I think they're cutting some of the note values a wee bit short, but it will give you a very good sense of how the piece works together.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b8uQIu3vjTs

Edit (Friday 2/21)

Sheet Music is Ready!

Thanks for your patience; sheet music is ready to go. On the MeetUp website menu (underneath our gold-colored title), click More--->Files. There are PDF downloads for trumpets, trombones, and baritone. Print your parts and bring them to the MeetUp. Oh -- and practice!

Our ensemble for March 8 is: 6 trumpets, 3 trombones, and a baritone horn. Not a very traditional arrangement, but we're gonna make it work. The music selections are varied: some Mozart, some modern "dialogues", a cheery etude, and an arrangement of Dry Bones. The trombones also have a hymn and some Renaissance madrigals; I'm going to dig up some trumpet-only selections and send those out in a few days.

If you can't make it...

Please change your RSVP to "no". We are booked out and you are taking a spot that someone else may want.

------

The first meeting of the NYC Brass Ensemble!

The purpose of this meet-up is to bring local amateur brass instrument players -- trumpet, cornet, french horn, tuba, euphonium, baritone, trombone -- together for a first meeting and run-through of simple material.

I will provide sheet music in advance for those who RSVP. If you have arrangements that you would like us to play, please contact the organizer directly.

We'll begin with some very basic arrangements. No runs of sixteenth notes, no crazy keys, just simple melodies where we can all focus on tone and playing musically as an ensemble. 

If you're a real novice, you'll have time to work on the pieces beforehand. Join us, and if you want to sit out some pieces, that's ok! If you're more experienced, you'll benefit from a true brass ensemble experience and an enjoyable classical repertoire.

We'll be meeting in a professional studio space with chairs and music stands around Herald Square, Manhattan. Just bring your instrument!

We are not professionals. We are amateurs, hobby players, and multi-instrumentalists looking to work on their brass chops. 

Your $5 admission covers (1) MeetUp.com fees, (2) studio rental, and (3) sheet music.

After we play, those who are inclined may join us for coffee or a casual bite to eat at a local venue.
name: Introduction and Beginners' Rehearsal

description:
This dinner has been organised by Paul Rhodes who has an amazing collection of mature Bordeaux. This time the focus will be Ste. Estephe one of the finest Left-Bank  communes of Bordeaux. The dinner will feature two different champagnes to start, then from Ste. Estephe two Cru Bourgeois from the outstanding 2000 vintage, four different vintages of Ch. Cos D'Estournel Cru Classse (one of the best two chateaux of this commune) including two from large format bottles, and to finish a single quinta port. The wines will be served in generous measures giving a bottle of fine wine per person.

Here is the full menu with the wines: 

APERITIF 

Champagne Martell N/V

Champagne Martell Rose N/V


STARTER

Duck liver pâté with toasted sourdough bread and pickled cucumber, onions and cornichons OR for the vegetarian option Wild mushroom and Stinking Bishop rarebit

Ch. Lillian Ladouys 2000

Ch. Lavillotte 2000


MAIN COURSE

Trio of Lamb, with Potato Gratin and Seasonal Vegetables OR a vegetarian option on request

Ch. Cos D'Estournel 1983 

Ch. Cos D'Estournel 1981


PUDDING/CHEESE

Sticky toffee pudding with icecream  OR Cheese and Biscuits

Ch. Cos D'Estournel 1979 from Magnum

Ch. Cos D'Estournel 1978 from Double Magnum

And to finish Cockburn Quinta dos Canais 1992 Port


The cost of the 3 course dinner including all of these wines is £69.50 + £4.50 paypal and Meetup fees = £74 and I have reserved 12 places for the group.

Please note that this dinner will suit those who like mature red Bordeaux wines. 

The champagne reception will start at 6.30 and we will sit down to dinner at 7.15

When booking please answer the 2 questions about the vegetarian option and pudding or cheese.

Cheers,

Christos
name: Ste. Estephe Dinner with Cos D'Estournel at Bangers

description:
Take a trip back and experience Pre-Code Hollywood where anything goes, no matter how racy or risque.  The Breen Code was implemented in Hollywood in in 1934, which tightened censorship restrictions in Hollywood movies.  But, before that, for a brief period, Hollywood pushed the envelope  on sex, violence, drug addiction, adultery and crime.  

There is another code, however.  A secret code that the film makers used to communicate information that was not allowed by the censors.  Film historian Christopher Perry will teach you how to "read" the code and understand what is really going on in these movies.

FOOTLIGHT PARADE is  Warner Bros. follow-up to 42ND STREET.  Busby Berkeley again directs the astounding musical numbers.  With James Cagney, Joan Blondell, Ruby Keeler and Dick Powell.   If you liked 42nd STREET, you'll love this flick.

Join us for an exploration of Censorship in the Cinema with this Pre-Code film artifact. 

WANT FREE ADMISSION???  Bring a cinema related book to the Bijou and donate it to the Bijou reference library and you will get in free.  Note: It has to be a book that the reference library currently does not have.

WANT ADMISSION FOR 25 CENTS???  Since movie tickets in the 1930's and 40's could be bought for 25 cents we will give you admission for 25 cents in change if the coins are silver(that means dated before 1965). 

 DIRECTIONS COMING FROM THE LOW DESERT:  From Hwy 10, take Hwy 62 north until you reach Yucca Valley.  Once you are in Yucca Valley take a right at the second stoplight(Kickapoo Trail) and go 2 blocks to the stop sign(Onaga Trail) where you take a left.  Go 2.8 miles and you are there.  You will see the Bijou sign in front.

The Desert Classic Film Society is a non-profit 501 (c) 3 organization.
name: Pre-Code Censorship FOOTLIGHT PARADE 1933 W/James Cagney

Afternoon Discussion with Artists Sim Chan, Movana Chen, South Ho, Stanley Siu, and Laure Raibut (Moderator)

Discussion 3pm - 4pm

This panel invites four native Hong Kong artists, with divergent yet complimentary practices to comment on how the urban context has inspired them as artists.

Sim Chan (b.1987) graduated from Hong Kong Art School, majoring in Painting. Sim’s work is a tangible expression of the desire to unlock and blur boundaries of forms within the city. He has worked on depictions of the local cityscape and the urban architecture intensively. His work is a compilation of his own observations, reminiscences and tactile senses towards the ever-changing city. Sim was awarded “40under40” global creative talent by Perspective Magazine in 2013. In the same year, he was commissioned to create a public art installation at Hong Kong Arts Centre. Sim’s work has been exhibited in different cities such as Hong Kong, Beijing, Shanghai, Taipei, Singapore, Tokyo, Thailand and Melbourne. His artworks have been collected by private collectors in Hong Kong and abroad.

Movana Chen is a Hong Kong-based artist who studied fashion design at the London College of Fashion and received a Bachelor of Fine Arts from the RMIT University in Hong Kong. Movana started her knitting projects in 2004, her work is a multi-disciplinary fusion of media, fashion, performance, installation and sculpture which has been presented at different exhibitions, art festivals and events globally, including those in Hong Kong, London, Paris, Seoul, Beijing, Shanghai, Sicily, Melbourne and Rotterdam. Her recent solo projects include at ArtisTree (Hong Kong, 2013), Chinart LaGalerie (Paris, 2011), Shin Hwa Gallery (Hong Kong, 2009), Pekin Fine Arts (Beijing, 2008). She has also participated in group exhibitions at Frankston arts center (Melbourne, 2015), Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen (Rotterdam, the Netherlands, 2014), CODA Museum (Apeldoorn, the Netherlands, 2013), MoA Museum of Art Seoul National University (Korea, 2012), Escape Louis Vuitton (Hong Kong and Singapore, 2012), Gyeonggi MoMA (Korea, 2009) and MoCA Shanghai Museum (Shanghai, 2008). Movana was one of the 30 finalists of the 2011 and 2012 Sovereign Asian Art Prize. Her art works have been collected by the Hong Kong Heritage Museum, Louis Vuitton and private collectors from Hong Kong, China and France.  

Ho Sui Nam South (South Ho) a Hong Kong-based photographer, explores the societal concerns of his native metropolis through the camera. While his earlier works were inspired by personal experiences and states of mind, the artist has gradually wandered into commenting on the society and era he lives in. Through his lens, he depicts the buildings containing the potential homes as beautiful, objects of desire, but also distant. They appear cold and the reflections of their lights in the dark waters are somehow unsettling. According to the artist, the focus of the image is “further than infinity,” a distant symbol of the unattainability of the buildings portrayed. His photos are displayed in light boxes, which allude to the neon lights and billboards used to advertise and create desire. To the artist, the pursuit of material goals is in vain and valuing money or real estate over self-fulfillment is superficial.

Stanley Siu grew up and studied in New Zealand, returning to Hong Kong after graduation. Since then he has practiced as an architect on a number of residential, commercial, master planning, cultural and sustainability projects in Hong Kong and China. Stanley’s professional activities and interests are split equally between architecture and contemporary art. In 2012 Stanley founded Daydreamers Design, an art &design collaboration constantly engaged in the art, design, and architectural scene locally and globally. Under his leadership, Daydreamers Design won the Gold Award for “Rising Moon” presented at the 2013 Lantern Wonderland competition organized by The Hong Kong Tourism Board. In 2014, Stanley became partner at100ft Park, an artist run space aiming to provide an open platform for the local young artists to share their creative thoughts. In the same year, Stanley received the Young Architect Awards 2013 organized by the Hong Kong Institute of Architects; a prestigious award that honours and acknowledges the talents and contribution of Stanley’s achievements in the field of Art and Architecture.

Laure Raibaut is an expert in Chinese Contemporary art. She was trained as an archaeologist of China and earned MA from SOAS (School of Oriental and African Studies) in London and the Sorbonne in Paris. She started her career after attending CAFA (Central Academy of Fine Arts) in Beijing and worked for Platform China Art Institute. In 2007, she opened Chinese Contemporary's New York space. As the art market shifted towards Asia, she joined Schoeni Art gallery in Hong Kong, another of the leading galleries in the world for Chinese contemporary art, established in 1992. Laure launched the Asian Contemporary art department for Bonhams, in Hong Kong in 2013 and has since joined Christie's where she is Vice-President, Senior Specialist and Head of Sale for Alexandra House, for the Asian contemporary art department. Her global experience allows her to develop relationships with artists, dealers, curators and collectors and to keep expanding her wide knowledge and ability to assess the market. A French national, Laure is fluent in English, Mandarin and Spanish. 

Please note: This is a non-host event but one that we think will interest the members of the Hong Kong Expats. Attendees can arrange to Meet Up beforehand by posting below.
name: [ART/PANEL] Hong Kong Redefined: The Urban Context in Art

description:
Distance: 17.00 miles
Pace: Moderate:
Terrain: Some hills
Regroup: Stay together
Weather Cancels?: Steady rain cancels
Route info: http://ridewithgps.com/routes/7026673 

Ride Description:
Please join us for a Midweek Outdoor Riding in Evening (MORE) ride to celebrate our long wait for DST in PNW! This is a weekly ride of about 20 miles with a few hills. For the month of March, we will keep the distance shorter and elevation gain to minimal until daylight gets longer and our fitness level catches up :-). It is a perfect way to add a little training for otherwise weekend riders without spending too much time. The start locations will be in North Seattle (Lower Woodland Park, Matthews Beach, View Ridge, etc.). We will ride on urban Seattle/Shoreline streets as well as some trails. We will regroup at top of every hill for a reasonable time, but if you are too fast/slow for the majority, it will become self-paced. It’s nice to bring your own cue sheet. Please pack water, snack, and tools/tubes to fix a flat as always. Even though the majority of ride will be in daylight, please have your lights (both front and back) just in case.

This week's MORE Hills ride starts at Lower Woodland Park. We will take Fremont Ave N (Greenway) and Interurban Trail to Shoreline and head back down south on Meridian Ave N.

There is no scheduled stop en route, but we can stop to refill bottles as necessary. 5:30pm is a roll out time, so please come early enough to get yourself ready and hear safety briefing/sign a waiver.
name: MORE Ride In N Seattle (Steady & Moderate 12-16mph, 17 miles)
Surprised By Joy by C.S. Lewis; ch 4-6

description:
What up Black Professionals,

Spring is in the air !...Hopefully it will actually stay soon lol. On another note, the organizers in BPU-30 try to come up new and exciting events that are in contrast with the same ol, same ol. So with that being said, I just got the scoop that in a land not too far from ATL the world's tallest & fastest GigaCoaster will be opening in 3 weeks. So hopefully you understand what I'm about to say.......ROADTRIP !!!!!. That's right we're planning on in the car(s) to head to Charlotte, NC for the day to hit the new and improved Carowinds amusement park to ride Fury 325...the biggest & baddest roller coaster in the USA. 


Charlotte is about 3.5 hours away for the people who do the speed limit. Yes, I do the speed limit for any law enforcement in the group lol. We'll leave ATL at 5:30 AM and get Charlotte around 8 or 9 AM. We'll have breakfast and then spend the day riding all the cool rides at Carowinds. The park closes at 10pm. 

Ticket prices online for admission are $41.99. If we carpool, tip in for gas, and of course have some money for food/refreshments at the park for the day. 

Fury 325 GigaCoaster

Fury 325 fully embodies this same aggressive power that, like a furious hornet, just won't let up. With heights reaching 325 feet, a staggering length of 6,602 feet and breathtaking speeds of 95 miles per hour, this 2,700-ton “hornet’s nest of rebellion” carries the same agility, bravery and passionate spirit of its hometown.



https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lR2PIV1u3FU
name: Carowinds Charlotte, NC - Ride the World's Tallest & Fastest New GigaCoaster

Nithyanandam! Eternal Bliss!

Come join us as Swamiji, Pramahamsa shares the truths of the Upanishads live via two-way video conferencing in SE Calgary this Sunday.

Satsang means sitting with the truth or gathering together for truth. Everyone welcome! Beyond the words spoken you can experience something else ... that something is your true essence- the space of bliss that is eternal- Nithyananda!

Discourse: 7:30pm-9:00pm

Pooja (devotional practice) begins at 6:30 pm and you are welcome to join us for that as well!

This is a free evening. Donations welcome to support our non profit organization, Nithyananda Meditation Academy (Calgary Life Bliss), which is entirely donation based and volunteer run. We have to pay for two-way each session.

description:
Lets spend the day in Noosa. We will start the day with a walk along the Coastal track in the Noosa National Park, this is a 5.4km track with a grade ranking of 4. At the end of the track we will walk a further 1.2km to the Sunshine Beach Surf Club for breakfast. Possible time is 2-3 hrs.

After breakfast we will catch the bus back to Hastings Street. Once back in Noosa we can enjoy of few hours of browsing the shops and or lunch before heading home. I expect we will be back at North Lakes mid to late afternoon.


We will all meet in the car park of North Lakes Masters hardware and car pool from there, $5p/p to the driver for fuel. In Noosa we will leave our cars in one of the car parks in Hastings Street and walk to the National Park (maybe another 1km or so).


We will meet in the South Eastern corner of Master's car park which is on the corner of North Lakes Dr and Prospect St (closest end to Westfield at the back) . Please meet at 5.50am to leave at 6am sharp!


Please wear comfortable shoes, bring a hat, sun screen and plenty of water.
Any questions please text me[masked] 251.
Meetup admin cost $2p/p
name: NOOSA NATIONAL PARK WALK

description:
Have you ever wanted to buy something but wondered about the ethical impact of the product you were considering? Its labor history? Pondered the gender policies of the company making it? What about political donation histories? Environmental concerns? Axiologue is a project that aims to put that ethical information in the hands of consumers, so we can make purchases that are in line with our beliefs. This meetup is for us to introduce ourselves and for you to learn more about the project! If you're interested in web activism or conscientious consumption, or just curious what we do, come check it out!

More info at axiologue.org!
name: Axiologue Introduction

description:
Come out and join us on the water at Marina Del Rey where the water will be our playground. We will be Kayaking in the harbor area where the water is calm & easy going. This is a great way to stay in shape & burn out the calories from the dinners that we’ve chowed down. On top of that we'll be having fun in the sun ! So anyone up for aqua activity? If so then mark down your calendar & see you on the water !

 

http://www.marinadelreyboatrentals.com/

 

RSVP Important Note:

This place doesn't take reservations. Please arrive at 9:30AM if possible . The shop opens at 10:00 AM on weekends and they normally have 11 Doubles & 10 Singles on hand. Based on what they said before 12:00 PM is OK to grab a bunch of kayaks as a group seeing how they said people start crowding in right after 12 PM. Well see how it goes =D  

 

Payment Process:

You will be required to leave your ID & Credit Card for a security deposit. In addition to that an individual contract will be assigned to who ever leaves the deposit for each kayak. So if you're doing a double kayak it best that you have "CASH" to make the payment process easy.

 

Price Break Down:

Single Kayak   - $15.00 Per. Hour

Double Kayak - $25.00 Per. Hour

 

* Life Jacket provided with rental

 Afterwards well do lunch here at Panera Bread. This place is super close as you drive out.

 http://www.yelp.com/biz/panera-bread-marina-del-rey

This is where we will meet !
name: Kayaking - Marina Del Rey

description:
Let's enjoy the Annual Boston Flower & Garden Show for 2015! This is an AWESOME Event to attend ---if you LOVE Flowers and Gardening! This year it is from March 11--15th.

Do NOT miss the Japanese Flower Arranging section!We will be able to see and enjoy different styles of Japanese Flower Arranging.

Let's try to go together as a group. The Venue opens everyday at 10am. Let's meet there after work and enjoy the show! It is open every nite until 9pm. Or go at your leisure any day and use the Promo Code below.

There will be numerous gorgeous displays of flowers and plants galore. PLUS lectures + demos by experts. AND a lively marketplace featuring hundreds of beautiful and useful things to buy.

Full Day Tickets are $20. Use Promo Code: FS15JFA for a $4 Discount. After 5pm Tickets cost $15. (must purchase at Box Office only) Go to: www.BostonFlowerShow.com to purchase your advance tickets. $4 Promo Code ONLY valid on advance online Full Day Tickets.

If you can't make it exactly at 6pm---don't worry---still come and join us! We will be there. It takes quite a while to see and appreciate everything...

We'll try to have a venue lined up by end of day Monday.
(Anyone want to volunteer one?)

If we don't have an announced program, feel free to come with a discussion topic or a presentation to make to us! (Or just come and join the conversation!)

Come and join us! We usually have between 15 and 25 Linux users, admins, and programmers show up. Good conversation and networking and, often, a great presentation or two.

We meet on the second Wednesday of each month. If we don't have an announced program, feel free to come with a discussion topic or a presentation to make to us! (Or just come and join the conversation!)

Keep up on the latest by subscribing to our KYOSS discussion list. Just send an email to [masked]

Register and log in to our web site at www.kyoss.org. Keep up on the very latest on our IRC channel: freenode/#kyoss

description:
Let's enjoy the Annual Boston Flower & Garden Show for 2015! This is an AWESOME Event to attend ---if you LOVE Flowers and Gardening! This year it is from March 11--15th.

Do NOT miss the Japanese Flower Arranging section!We will be able to see and enjoy different styles of Japanese Flower Arranging.

Let's try to go together as a group. The Venue opens everyday at 10am. Let's meet there after work and enjoy the show! It is open every nite until 9pm. Or go at your leisure any day and use the Promo Code below.

There will be numerous gorgeous displays of flowers and plants galore. PLUS lectures + demos by experts. AND a lively marketplace featuring hundreds of beautiful and useful things to buy.

Full Day Tickets are $20. Use Promo Code: FS15JFA for a $4 Discount. After 5pm Tickets cost $15. (must purchase at Box Office only) Go to: www.BostonFlowerShow.com to purchase your advance tickets. $4 Promo Code ONLY valid on advance online Full Day Tickets.

If you can't make it exactly at 6pm---don't worry---still come and join us! We will be there. It takes quite a while to see and appreciate everything...
name: Boston Flower & Garden Show/DISCOUNT Tix + Japanese Flower Arranging Exhibit

description:
*Please note time change and confirm with host- Merrilee

Nithyanandam! Eternal Bliss!

Come join us as Swamiji, Pramahamsa shares the truths of the Upanishads live via two-way video conferencing in SE Calgary this Sunday.

Satsang means sitting with the truth or gathering together for truth. Everyone welcome! Beyond the words spoken you can experience something else ... that something is your true essence- the space of bliss that is eternal- Nithyananda!

Discourse: 7:30pm-9:00pm

Pooja (devotional practice) begins at 6:30 pm and you are welcome to join us for that as well!

This is a free evening. Donations welcome to support our non profit organization, Nithyananda Meditation Academy (Calgary Life Bliss), which is entirely donation based and volunteer run. We have to pay for two-way each session.

* For the address: Please RSVP for address.
name: Satsang this Sunday in NE Calgary with Paramhamsa Nithyananda

description:
What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)  We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT
name: 90+ Pt Sonoma Patio Wine Party- Louis Foppiano@Warwick-Pl­ayboy Twist!

description: We will be meeting at Mary's place to learn how to make black salt. You are encouraged to bring your cauldron, iron is preferred. Sean will be supplying everyone with the herbs needed and Mary will bring the sea salt. Black salt is made by burning herbs till they are completely burnt. Then you would scrape your cauldron out with your athame and mix it with sea salt. The herbs selected must have protective properties and can be 1 type or multiple types. Black salt is used to rid yourself of negative energies, ward evil spirits, honoring the crone, helping souls to journey into the afterlife, honoring the dark moon, helping with exorcisms, help with your nightmares or bad dreams, casting a line near your doorways to keep evil out, binding work and more. If you would like to join us to watch us make this or make some for your own, please feel free to attend. Due to how potent of smell these herbs can project, this will be done outdoors.
name: Craft Night: Making Black Salt

description:
You can either take the 109 tram or a train towards Belgrave and get off at Box hill. Everyone is free to arrive a little later(or earlier) at their leisure :)

Location: Just a 5 minute walk from Box Hill station and out of the crowded shopping area for those of you who may not like shopping centers, we'll meet at the Bruce Street entrance, if people are coming late(or lost), my number is 0467350503.

The weather is a bit mellow and cool/cold lately so make sure you bring some warm layered clothing which you can remove when we go to Bounce(Which has lockers where you can throw your stuff in, or if someone drove there, maybe someone's car would work better).

What we'll be up to: Free to suggestions, we can have dinner if people would like after we go to Bounce but people are free to have a bite beforehand. We can sit in the park(possibly in the cold, so maybe not). We'll see what we come up with :)

You're free to have dinner with us after Bounce whether you're coming to Bounce or not, I'm sure there'll be people to keep everyone company for the hour.

P.S. For those of you going to bounce you'll need to book a ticket and as it starts on the hour, we'll have to make sure we're in place on time.

Also, feel free to break into smaller groups for chats, for a lot of us it's rather tiring to address large groups of people and it'll make for a more comfortable and interesting evening.
name: Meet in Box Hill prior to attending Bounce

Can't wait to meet you all!

description:
V Stars, March is a very special month. We are at the start of Autumn, and people around Australia gather for a Taste of Harmony – an initiative which celebrates the diversity of multicultural Australia. In the last picnic, we had dishes from South America to Italy and many nations in between. It was lovely to hear about different cultures and how their ancestors used to prepare wholefood. The 28th March is marks the near end of MeatFreeWeek - which is a global campaign to get you thinking about how much meat you eat, and the impact eating too much has on your health, animals and the environment. We're not just talking about red meat (beef, lamb and pork), but all meat, including poultry, processed meat (like ham, bacon, salami and packaged sandwich meats), fish and seafood. Why not share this campaign with your friends and family?

Let’s blend these initiatives for one BIG celebration and picnic at Botanical Gardens

Bring your favourite plant based dish to share with a beautiful picnic. The attendees loved the location with amazing views of Sydney. What to bring?
- Food enough to share with 3 more people
- A picnic rug to sit on
- Water/Drink for yourself to drink
- Your own plate and cutlery
- Frisbee/Football This time around we can dedicate one person to bring plates for the group. It saves each person bringing a plate. If you are stuck for ideas, the easiest thing to bring is simply a bowl of fruit or a salad.
The meeting point is at the Henry Lawson Gate on Mrs Macquarie Road. Botanical Gardens. As you enter Henry Lawson Gate, turn right and we'll be sitting about 50 metres away. Wet Weather Plans:
I live very close to the Botanical Gardens, so we'll have the party at my place. Getting there: As per the map, its a 20 min walk from Town Hall. Or 10 Minutes from St James Station. If you have any questions, please contact me Cheers, Bob
name: Celebrate Meat Free Week & Harmony Picnic @ Botanical Gardens

description:
All day field trip at Larabee State Park's new Geology Trail. Meet at the Everett Mall in back by LA Fitness next to the transit center at 8AM for carpooling. Address of the carpool location is 1402 SE Everett Mall Way, Everett, WA 98208. It takes about an hour drive to get to the park.

***A Discover Pass is required for vehicle access to state parks for day use.*** This park is equipped with an automated pay station for visitors to purchase a one-day or annual Discover Pass.

The trail is a four mile loop with 800 ft altitude gain and lots of stairs. Bring water, munchies for the trail, foul weather gear, and good hiking boots. Afterwards the group may stop for a little socializing over a late lunch at one of the nice cafe’s on Chuckanut Drive. Trip Leader is Jonathan Blubaugh and he can be reached[masked] or [masked].

Larrabee State Park is one of Whatcom County's best birding locations. It spans 2,683 acres, including 8,100 feet of saltwater shoreline on Samish Bay, tidelands, coves and two freshwater lakes. Established in 1915 as Washington’s first state park, Larrabee occupies most of the west side of Chuckanut Mountain and is connected to Bellingham city limits via the well-maintained Interurban Trail. The park’s topographic diversity from sea level to 1,940 feet elevation supports a variety of bird habitat. Great Horned, Western Screech, Northern Pygmy and Barred Owls are year-round residents. This is common territory for Pileated Woodpecker and Red-breasted Sapsuckers, as well as wintering Bald Eagles. Marine birds include Double-crested and Pelagic Cormorants, Great Blue Herons and colorful Harlequin Ducks. For more information about the park can be found at http://www.parks.wa.gov/536/Larrabee/.
name: Larabee State Park Hike (Everett Carpool)

description:
Event: Hike

Description:  In this class, you will get in the field practice on how to read trail markers, use a compass, understand maps, and measure distances. This loop hike at the southern end of Harriman State Park follows several picturesque streams and climbs to a viewpoint over Lake Sebago.

Attractions:

• Panoramic Scenery

• Ga-nua-Quah Rocks

• Wooden Bridges: Bridge was design by Picaso

• Pine Meadow Lake (bonus

• Stone Ruins (bonus)

• Abandon Cemetery (bonus): Looks Creepy

Maps:

Difficulty: Moderate

Distance: 6 miles

Duration: 5 Hours

Suggested Car Pool Cost: $15

Designated driver and passengers link:

Guide:

• From Reeves Meadow Information Center we are taking the red trail (Pine Meadow) east. 

• We will cross a Wooden Bridges over to white trail (Kakiat) heading east.

• Now, we are going north on the blue trail (Seven Hills) pass three scenic views.

• Once we reach Diamond Mountain Tower, we will head east to Pine Meadow Lake following red trail (Pine Meadow).

• If time permits we will check out the lake, ruins and the cemetery.

• On our way back, we will follow red trail (Pine Meadow) south and cross another wooden bridge.

• We take blue trail (Seven Hills) heading south pass three scenic view points until will see white trail (Reeves Brook).

 • We take white trail (Reeves Brook) north back to the parking lot.

Reference Link:

http://www.harrimanhiker.com

http://www.nynjtc.org

Disclaimer:

http://www.meetup.com/Asians-Meetup/pages/Disclaimer/

END

description:
The Tale of Rodney Ram

Free Storytelling Session by Sarah Brennan, Aurthor & Writer Ambassador for Room to Read
Registration at 1.45pm
Storytelling and quiz at 2pm
Close at 5pm
Suitable for children aged 7-10

EVENT DETAILS

21 March 2015
1:45pm - 5:00pm
9 Justice Drive, Admiralty, Hong Kong

Click for Directions
Add to Google Calendar
Free admission; Online registration required

Click here
http://asiasociety.org/hong-kong/events/tale-rodney-ram Rodney Ram is gorgeous, from his eartips to his toes. But there's just one problem – he doesn't want to lead his flock! Then famine grips Guangdong Province, and the sheep are in mortal danger. Will Rodney rise to the challenge, and save their woolly hides? Find out in this shaggy tale of shyness, sheep and an awful lot of luck!

As with all of the Chinese Calendar Tales, the story highlights some fantastic Chinese culture and history. This time, it's the famous Legend of the Five Rams of Guangzhou, as well as the history of rice cultivation in China. Not to mention the special characteristics of people born in the Year of the Ram (or Goat or Sheep depending on your fancy!). They're creative, romantic and charming, but they're also very shy, they hate confrontation and they really don't like standing out. The story is written in fast-paced rhyming verse, with lots of fun and hidden jokes included, and is once again brilliantly illustrated by Harry Harrison, Hong Kong's famous award-winning cartoonist. Join author Sarah Brennan for an interactive, fun-filled afternoon of storytelling, games, and more at Asia Society Hong Kong Center’s Landscape Terrace – conducted in English, suitable for children aged 7-10, casual attire recommended. The Tale of Rodney Ram will be available for sale at the program.

Sarah Brennan is a Hong Kong-based international author and publisher of Chinese Calendar Tales (The Tale of Chester Choi, The Tale of Run Run Rat, The Tale of Oswald Ox, The Tale of Temujin, The Tale of Rhonda Rabbit, The Tale of Pin Yin Panda, The Tale of Sybil Snake, The Tale of a Dark Horse and her latest title The Tale of Rodney Ram to date) as well as the hugely popular Dirty Story series. A featured author in Hong Kong, Shanghai and Beijing International Literary Festivals since 2004, Sarah conducts regular reading tours, workshops and weeks in residence in schools in Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Shanghai, Beijing, Singapore, Australia and the UK. Her books are now also distributed in the United States and Canada.

A committed Writer Ambassador for Room to Read, a global non-profit which seeks to transform the lives of millions of children in ten developing countries through its Literacy and Girls’ Education Programs, Sarah shares what “the great Horace Mann once said that “a house without books is like a room without windows”. Room To Read knocks windows through walls and lets the light come blazing in”. Sarah’s particular mission is to bring Chinese culture, history and landscape to young English speakers everywhere through the medium of humor, verse and funny illustrations, while at the same time giving children living in East Asia stories that relate to their own heritage. She also believes passionately in rich vocabulary and intelligent text for primary school children: “dumbing down” is her particular bête noir. As a result, her books can be read on many levels and are popular among children aged as young as 5 and as old as 12.
name: [MEET AUTHOR] The Tale of Rodney Ram

description:
Hello everyone!

Our next meet-up will take place on March 17th, same time, same place! This gathering is the opportunity for programmers to meet & get to know each other. We'll have three talks then we'll unwind with pizza and refreshments.

Please join us to share experiences and network with other developers as well as the Microsoft Gulf Developer Experience team.

Register here.

Check out our blog, subscribe to our newsletter, take some free online training and follow us on facebook or twitter.

#msdevgulf #meetup

Agenda:

6:00-6:30: Welcome and Keynote
Rami Sarieddine, Windows Technical Evangelist, Microsoft Gulf

6:30-7:00: Living the Game
Mamdouh Tarabishi, Instructor, New Horizons

Recently technology is blending digital content into our real world and integrate our increasingly digitalized lifestyle with our physical lives in a seamless, natural way to blur the line between what's real and what's computer-generated by enhancing what we see, hear, feel and smell. This session will cover: What is Augmented Reality (AR), difference between Augmented Reality & Virtual Reality, gadgets available, applications of AR, development tools, demo.

7:00-7:30: Understanding Open Web Interface for .NET (OWIN)
Ovais Mehboob, Senior Software Engineer, Hamdan Bin Mohammad Smart University 

In this session, we will cover: Why OWIN, OWIN architecture, OWIN specification, how to develop custom OWIN middleware and applications.

7:30 onwards: Pizza & Networking

description:
Priority for this hike will go to those who haven't done it before.  Sign onto the wait list and I'll move up the first timers.

• In order to get on the "going" list, you must read the entire hike description and indicate so by answering the question when signing up.

• If you have a recent no show on your record, you'll have to wait until the day of the hike to see if you're going.

• On Thursday, I'll open up the remaining spots to everybody based strictly on who signed up first.  So if you're not a first timer, you should still sign up as soon as you can.

This hike is a Green Tier/Tier 1 hike on my Scrambling Tiers list.

We'll be heading out from Red Springs picnic area into the small canyon that leads to the Calico I lookout.  It's usually an area that people just hike through on their way to something else, but it has its own beauty and charm.  I've seen rabbits, tortoises, chuckwallas and snakes in this little area.

This hike is meant for beginners who want to try something a little harder, but don't want to do any scrambling.  Of course, everybody can come along.  The hills on this hike may not be huge, but they'll give your lungs a workout.  It's going to be relatively short due to the lack of light, but it will have about 400 feet overall elevation gain.  It'll be about 2.5 miles and take about an hour and a half.  Slower hikers may take a little longer. 

This hike is good for scrambling beginners. It does not require any special techniques.  Along the hike we'll go over some basic skills that you can use on more difficult hikes.  There are also areas that can be used to improve the skills you already have.  But you must be in good enough condition to walk a couple of miles.

There is a limit of one guest on this hike, unless I approve more.  Send me an email.

YOU MUST BE ON THE "GOING" LIST IN ORDER TO GO ON THIS HIKE.  CRASHING WILL NOT BE ALLOWED.

We'll meet at the Red Springs Parking Lot in Calico Basin.  To get there, just head west on Charleston towards the park and make a right turn onto the well-marked Calico Basin turnoff.  It's 2 miles BEFORE the Park entrance.  Follow the road down to the Red Springs parking lot.

Frequently asked questions.

Distance: ~ 2.5 miles loop.

Elevation gain: 400 ft.

High point: ~ 3750

Low point: 3600

Difficulty: easy

Pace: ~ 2 mph.

Small Children: no.

Dogs: no.

Time: 2 hours max.

Bring: At least one liter of water. Snacks if you want. Some kind of light, just in case.

Please note the following:

• Meetup organizers are not tour guides and are not park rangers. Expect the same risks and take the same precautions you would take if you were hiking alone.  You are solely responsible for your own safety and well-being.

• By signing up for and/or attending this Meetup event, you acknowledge, understand, accept, and agree that hiking and other outdoor activities can be dangerous and can cause serious bodily injury and possibly death. The organizers of this group and current and former members cannot be held responsible or liable in any way for the actions of any participant - including you - at any event.

• All attendees participate at an event at their own risk and are solely responsible for any damage to their property, and/or any injury to themselves or their guests.

• By signing up for and/or attending this Meetup event, you affirm that you understand this disclaimer, and that you knowingly and voluntarily agree not to bring any type of claim arising out of or related to this Meetup event against the organizers of this Meetup group.
name: Easy Hike - Calico
