We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT

April's added event is a special surprise for the members, and for many outside the group. For this month, we will be at Aperture Studio at 2840 Chatham Street in Philadelphia, PA. We will have ample space to work in, allowing models and photographers to concentrate on a variety of creative ideas. Photographers are encouraged to bring items they need to be creative, keeping in mind to have any setups reasonable. Most props are encouraged (no weapon props or open flames) to help with adding originality. The model list will be updated as we get close to the event, so check back frequently for the latest additions.

Of special note for this event, we are EXTREMELY pleased to present a very cool music experience. Little War Twins (http://www.littlewartwins.com/) will be performing a killer set of music that will be sure to please everyone. Check out their site, listen to their music (buy their download!), and you will be excited to see them live. The band will be with us during the workshop portion to help as models, and then donning their inner rock star for a moving set of live music.

The Little War Twins are originally from Boston, and are touring the east coast over the next few months. They bring an original sound, with much energy and talent. Get to meet and work with them now, as they are no doubt on their way to the top.

For more on the Little War Twins:

Official Site: www.littlewartwins.com

Facebook: www.facebook.com/littlewartwins

Live Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1MJby5unBVw

One Bottle Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q3cm3EjA_ww

Mother Pulls Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YAUVTL8HAQI 

Important Event Details:

-Photographers looking to attend this event, please process your RSVP and Paypal portion, referencing "Audire, Videre, Lorem, Lux". There are many places to use in and around this facility. The workshop portion with models will wind down at 4:30, in order for the band to set up. You can keep shooting beyond that, but the show itself is an opportunity to photograph a most excellent band live.

-Models, if you are interested in attending as a model, please confirm by messaging your name, port url, an email address, and a contact phone #. Models must be 18+. If you want makeup artist services, you MUST bring a gratuity for your MUA.

Schedule for the Day:

9am: models arrive...photogs can arrive to set up and explore...

11am: official start time...introductions...make history...

4pm: winding down...

4:30pm: doors open for Little War Twins fans...PGPG/M&P members encouraged to stay...

5pm: Little War Twins live in concert! Band photography encouraged...make more history...

Attending Models:

And now for some back story...there is a neat prize for the first photographer that RSVP's in full for this event (both RSVP and Paypal) and answers the trivia question.

*****

The sounds of the city were a collage of auditory sensations to his ears, as thick as the night he was walking through. Each noise a voice in itself, telling a story whether he wanted to hear it nor not, cascading from above, or rolling in from below. From all angles it came at him, tugging at his purposeful walk. Despite the shouts of angry patrons, or the cooing of false promises from the beauties he passed by, his feet kept him moving forward. The street lamps blanketed the sidewalk with their own cadence, as if he was walking across a chessboard. Trash cans stood as squat sentries, some overflowing with the debris of convenience, some with fire playing above the rim for a few seeking warmth. Puddles from the days rain were splashed at times by transporters whose passengers did not want to stop, but were still in search of something unspoken. The moon struggled to peak out around the shadowed clouds, hinting that the night was soon to be bathed in her fullness, even if the chill of darkness kept the body moving.

He rounded the corner to find himself on Aramingo, or that's what it used to be called. His great-grandfather, affectionately called G-Papp, used to say that before the Great Change, the streets used to have metal signs that read with their name, and that people used cars or buses to get where they were going. His stories of traffic lights, pot holes, convenience stores, and the trappings of the Pre-Change culture seemed so far away. People used to walk and mingle on the streets as part of their daily lives, breathing the air without using a thelium tube. So strange to him! Breathing the air as it was, with no concern of a painful termination. To no such worries. It must have been quite an experience.

His thoughts ended as approached the alley he knew well. A nondescript, typical entry way between sub domes, that was often shrouded by shadows of curving roofs. He was sure that while some things from the past were kept, much was abandoned to embrace the symmetry of the Ones. But alleys seemed to be harbor secrets, and this one held a special secret that not many knew of. Dropping his spare thelium tube on purpose, he bent to pick it up, making the signal with his thumb and forefinger. Within moments, a flash of light pierced out from the shadows of the alley, giving him clearance. He gave a cursory glance around him, knowing that for the next few seconds, the millions of cameras watching his every move would be hit with a few seconds of static, giving him enough time to step into the darkness and through the faux door that was opened for him.

The only sound of the door closing was a faint bump, and then silence. The viso droids fluttered around him, scanning for any potential bugs or, as the old school term was called, a 'wire'. He wasn't worried, as he was a regular here, and they knew him. But familiarity did not mean access, and within moments he heard the beep of approval from the viso droids.

Light spilled out in front of him as a second door opened up. He passed through, stepping out of the darkness and into the light, hearing then the voices of others who came here for the same purpose. It was a big crowd today, not the usual handful of people using their credits for a brief escape. He made sure he had a few extra vrillars to spend before walking over, allowing himself the luxury of options, something that he seldom had the chance to do.

Placing his coat on a hook at his usual station, he sat before red screen he knew so well. He removed his thelium tube and placed it on the desk in front of him, and reamained still as the machine slowly encased him in what was affectionately called the pod.  He felt his feet become secured to the floor, soon followed by his arms being locked down onto the arm rest, and then his head to the rest. The computer's voice then said "Close your eyes, please," and he complied with out any fight. The machine felt a bit gruff to some, but he had long embraced the rigidity as a part of the process.

"Scanning thought waves," it said. A brief hum followed, which he called the tuning fork. It always reminded him of the nitrous gas one had to breath during implant process when he was young, when you didn't know enough to object to the mandated micro-chipping. You were old enough to know that something was going on, but too young to ask questions. But he learned to fix that problem later on, along with a few other things. He was one of the lucky ones.

When the tuning fork was done, the machine's voice continued.

"Destination?"

"Philadelphia," he responded. "2015, April."

"Stand by," it came back with. He could swear it sounded a slight bit agitated, but he often over thought such things.

"Pass code?" it asked, sounding pleasantly inhuman but predictable.

"Audire, Videre, Lorem, Lux," he responded, as he felt the system begin the transport process. G-Papp always talked about how it was a life changing time for him, because he didn't have toys like this when he was young. He knew his great-grandfather, were he alive today, would be amazed at the ability to thought travel. He owed him everything, as G-Papp's DNA was in his blood too. That gave him access to so many experiences that he would otherwise never have.  

"Does not compute. Repeat," came the response. Damn, this unit didn't have a translator installed, he thought. But it didn't matter which model he had, as they all did the same job. You work with what you got.

"Hear, See, Sexy, Light," he responded. And that was it. The machine took over, placing his body in the usual temp stasis, while his mind was then taken back to a date that made history.
name: Audire, Videre, Lorem, Lux

Suggestions

A. Listen to understand and suspend judgment. 

B. Make one point at a time and allow others to respond.  Speak from personal experience.

Note – Meetup nor the participants neither screens participants, nor supervises or controls meetings, and we have no involvement with any of the individuals who participate. Therefore, we suggest that participants exercise good judgment when attending.

What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)   We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing    TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines   http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

description:
Sunset Hikes offers year round beach oriented events that address your quest for an Endless Summer. Mike has asked that we make some of these fun hiking events available to you. If interested in attending, please join and RSVP as a Sunset Hikes and Outdoor Fun Meetup Member.  The following event repeats weekly on Sunday afternoons.

http://www.meetup.com/Sunset-Hikes-and-Outdoor-Fun-in-Orange-County/

Join your Meetup hiking friends for a relaxed Sunday evening walk around the beautiful Dana Point pleasure craft harbor. Following the hike, we will be enjoying a sunset potluck picnic in a lovely waterfront setting having both ocean and harbor views.

SUMMARY:
Walk rating - beginner
Distance - three miles round trip
Elevation gain/loss - mostly flat
Walking time - approximately 60-90 minutes
Picnic time - approximately 60 minutes

ABOUT THE WALK: This is a slow paced 3 mile round trip hike on sidewalks that over look the Dana Point Harbor and Pacific Ocean. The hike will begin at the Dana Point Harbor pier, next to the landmark Pilgrim tall ship and the Ocean Institute. We will proceed south along the marina to the bridge over the harbor turning right on Dana Drive north to the Yacht Club. We will then head south on the ocean side of Dana Drive to its terminus having a spectacular view of the harbor's ocean access. Again, reversing directions, we take the marina front side walk back over the bridge to the park area that is our point of beginning. This route is very popular with local residents and their four legged friends. We are taking this walk at a time of day that enjoys a brisk ocean breeze and setting sun. 

GENERAL RATING: Level One (beginner) for distance, elevation and pace. The slow paced walk is on a side walk with beautiful marina and ocean views that is mostly flat with a few stairs.

ABOUT THE PICNIC: Our picnic will be in a park setting with multiple picnic tables on the oceanfront side of the Ocean Institute overlooking the harbor turning basin - one of the premier places for a picnic in OC! BYOB (beverage) and potluck delectables to share. While our picnic area may be alcohol free, we will exercise adult discretion and our Fifth Amendment rights!

DRIVING DIRECTIONS: From Pacific Coast Highway in Dana Point, turn on to Dana Point Harbor Drive and follow it to the "end." There are multiple parking areas that serve the OC Marine Institute, Pilgrim tall ship and the Marine Institute. The Meetup location will be in front of the Dana Point Harbor pier adjacent to the Pilgrim tall ship and the Ocean Institute. The picture below is of the Meetup location.

ADDITIONAL NOTES: Regular walking shoes, not hiking boots, are appropriate as you will be walking on paved side walks. The walk is dog friendly for leashed animals. The picnic area is adjacent to the parking area so there will be no need to carry picnic items on our walk. You may wish to bring a camp chair for added comfort at our picnic. Given the ocean breeze and setting sun, a warm jacket is advisable for the picnic. While alcohol may not be allowed in the park, we will exercise adult discretion and fifth amendment rights for our picnic. 

DISCLAIMER: Group organizer and assistant organizers assume no liability; hike at your own risk. By being a member of this group you hereby agree to assume all risks and liability related to or resulting from any group functions. You agree that neither you nor any third party will hold any of the group's leaders, officers, or representatives liable for any injury, loss, or damage to your own person or any members of your family, friends, acquaintances, children, pets, or property, arising directly or as a consequence from a group activity. You also spree that your membership of this group is based on an "at will" basis.
name: SUNDAY WALK AROUND DANA POINT HARBOR TO A WATERFRONT SUNSET PICNIC

description:
Sunset Hikes offers year round beach oriented events that address your quest for an Endless Summer.  Mike has asked that we make some of these events available to you.  If interested in attending, please join and RSVP as a Sunset Hikes and Outdoor Fun Meetup Member.  The following event repeats weekly on Monday evenings.

http://www.meetup.com/Sunset-Hikes-and-Outdoor-Fun-in-Orange-County/

ABOUT THE HIKE: This hike provides what may be the best combination of both ocean and bay front walking experiences available in Orange County. From the American Legion Post, the hike takes the ocean front board walk north to the Newport Pier. At the pier, you have a choice.  You can take off shoes and take on a bare foot walk along the wet, hard pack sand and surf to Balboa Pier. Or you can walk the same 1.5 mile distance on the board walk to Balboa Pier.  We regroup at the Pier, having rest rooms and drinking fountains.  With a short walk through the Balboa Fun Zone and along Newport Harbor, we resume our walk along the ocean front board walk back to the American Legion Post. 

HIKING DISTANCE: 4.5 miles round trip on sand and/or boardwalk  
HIKING TIME: 90 Minutes  
HIKING DIFFICULTY: Advanced beginner hike with relaxed pace.  Flat, but the sand adds to the level of difficulty. 

FOLLOWING THE HIKE: The Post offers a six dollar burger with all the "fix ins" and three dollar house wine and draft beer! This American Legion Post is a membership facility that limits access to five guests per my membership.  For those hikers completing the walk and requesting entry, access will be provided on a space available basis. We generally have multiple Legion members on the hike to facilitate the group's access.  The Post's patio is both sand and marina bay front that enables Meetup friendships with a lovely dining experience. There will be no RSVP limits on the Pier to Pier hike with a multitude of dining alternatives available on the Peninsula.

DRIVING INSTRUCTIONS: The 55 Freeway turns into Newport Boulevard, which turns into Balboa Boulevard.  Within the City of Newport Beach, take Balboa Boulevard down Balboa Peninsula to 15th Street. Parking is street side, along 15th Street and Balboa Blvd. After 6 PM, the metered parking is free. Be at the Post around 6 PM to provide ample time to locate street parking and walk to the Post entry.

MEETING LOCATION: We meet at the American Legion Post entry that fronts on 15th Street on Balboa Peninsula in the city of Newport Beach. The Post entry is located on the north side of 15th Street approx. 100 yards bay side (not ocean side) of Balboa Blvd.

EVENT NOTES: If you wear shoes and long pants, they will probably get wet in the surf. Evenings on the bay can be cool, so be prepared to layer up. Dogs are welcome on the hike, but not allowed at the Post.

DISCLAIMER:  Group organizer and assistant organizers assume no liability; hike at your own risk.  By being a member of this group you hereby agree to assume all risks and liability related to or resulting from any group functions.  You agree that neither you nor any third party will hold any of the group's leaders, officers, or representatives liable for any injury, loss, or damage to your own person or any members of your family, friends, acquaintances, children, pets, or property, arising directly or as a consequence from a group activity.  You also agree that your membership of this group is based on an "at will" basis.
name: Hike Balboa Peninsula, Pier to Pier, with Bayside Dining

description:
Sunset Hikes offers year round, beach oriented events that address your quest for an Endless Summer. Mike has asked that we make some of these fun hiking events available to you. If interested in attending, please join and RSVP as a Sunset Hikes and Outdoor Fun Meetup Member. The following event repeats weekly on Tuesday evenings.

JOIN MEETUP FRIENDS FOR A RELAXED MIDWEEK EVENING WALK.... down the beautiful Salt Creek Trail to the magnificent Salt Creek Beach. We will return after the hike to Amber's Cantina for their TACO TUESDAY dinner special!

ABOUT THE HIKE: This is a moderate paced 5.2 mile round trip along a paved bike path with beautiful views of the fragrant sage dense Salt Creek wetlands and the sounds of singing frogs! The trail has a few small hills, but is mostly gently sloped -suitable for both beginner and advanced hikers. We take a short rest stop at Salt Creek Beach with rest room and drinking fountain facilities.... and return along the same route to our Meetup parking area. As an ongoing tradition of this event, many hikers following the hike enjoy the Taco Tuesday dinner special (two dollar tacos and two dollar Coronas) at Amber's Cantina located in our Meetup parking area. As another alternative during the summer months, other hikers may choose to extend the rest stop described above by bringing a potluck picnic to ocean front tables located in a park setting at Salt Creek Beach.

GENERAL RATING/DIFFICULTY: Advanced beginner (moderate) for distance, elevation and pace.

DRIVING DIRECTIONS: From the 5 Freeway, take the Crown Valley Parkway exit toward the coast. Approximately one mile south of the Laguna Niguel town center, turn left on Club House Drive. At the south west corner of Niguel Road and Club House Drive, turn into the retail center. Look for the Meetup gathering in the parking area that fronts Fratello's Restaurant and Amber's Cantina. Please plan to arrive ten minutes early to provide time for a brief orientation and introductions.

ADDITIONAL NOTES: Regular walking shoes, not hiking boots, are appropriate as this is a paved trail. As day light becomes shorter, a flashlight may be helpful. The Salt Creek trail is dog friendly.

DISCLAIMER: Group organizer and assistant organizers assume no liability; hike at your own risk. By being a member of this group you hereby agree to assume all risks and liability related to or resulting from any group functions. You agree that neither you nor any third party will hold any of the group's leaders, officers, or representatives liable for any injury, loss, or damage to your own person or any members of your family, friends, acquaintances, children, pets, or property, arising directly or as a consequence from a group activity. You also agree that your membership of this group is based on an "at will" basis.
name: Hike Salt Creek Trail to the Beach and Taco Tuesday

description:
What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)  We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT
name: 90+ Pt Sonoma Patio Wine Party: Louis Foppiano@Warwick-Pl­ayboy Twist!

description:
Join us for a tail wagging dog walk in glorious Stanley Park and meet some of the nicest dog people in Vancouver!

The dogs participating in our program have gentle dispositions but may not have received any special training. Therefore, guardians accompanying children or disabled adults are especially encouraged to seek advice from the pet owner before touching an animal. Read more...

Please note that all participants in this walk will be asked to sign a waiver releasing Vancouver Ecovillage from any responsibility in case of injury during this walk for any reason. This includes tripping and falling, dog bites, scratches, or other unforseen injuries.

What to wear: fully covered comfortable shoes like sneakers or trekking boots. Don't wear your Sunday Best because the dogs may dirty your clothes!

Our dogs are excited about meeting you and so are we!

description:
Event: Hike, Part of the Finger Lake Series.

Description: Watkins Glen State Park is one of the most famous of the New York State Parks, with a reputation for leaving visitors amazed. Within two miles, the glen's stream descends 400 feet past 200-foot cliffs, generating 19 waterfalls along its course. There are three main park trails: Indian, Gorge and Southern Rim. The Gorge and Southern Rim trails are closer to the waterfalls. The Indian trail takes you to the upper entrance, through the woods.

Cost: Free

Attractions:

• 19 waterfalls

• Rainbows

• River made Caverns

• Stone Walkways

• Spiral Tunnels under Waterfalls

Maps:

Difficulty:

• All Trails Runs Parallel

• Easy = Indian Trail

• Moderate = White Trail (South Rim)

• Difficult = Gorge Trail

Distance: 1.5 Miles

Duration: 3 Hours

Suggested Car Pool Cost: $0

Designated driver and passengers link:

Event Guide:

• Lets Take the indian trail, but you are welcome to take which ever trail you like as the Gorge Trail will give you a shower. We will loop back to the parking lot.

Reference Link:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jbuV3_iPZHc

http://cnyhiking.com/NYSP-WatkinsGlen.htm

http://nyfalls.com/waterfalls/watkins-glen/

Disclaimer:

http://www.meetup.com/Asians-Meetup/pages/Disclaimer/

END
name: Get Spellbound by Watkins Glen State Park

description:
Great Meetup last week so let's keep the momentum going. At the end of last weeks Meetup, we agreed that we should do a project as a group which will give us an opportunity to learn and keep to keep our more experienced members skills sharp. So for this Meetup, bring potential project ideas and we can discuss them and quite possibly get started on something. Feel free to pitch ideas in the comments.

For beginners, a great resource for web development is Udacity's Front End Web Developer Nanodegree program which is free to audit: https://www.udacity.com/course/nd001. It covers technologies every web dev should know such as basic HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Github, responsive web design and many more subjects.


For those who want to get into the software engineering aspect, a great resource is Udacity's Intro to Computer Science course: https://www.udacity.com/course/cs101. It's a gateway to a majority of Udacity's courses and it will give a solid Computer Science foundation to build off of. You also get the added bonus of learning Python if you don't already know it.

One last thing I have to mention is a link to our Google group: https://plus.sandbox.google.com/communities/116191971905298887211

Feel free to ask any questions.
name: East Bay Web Developers

description:
Most of the time, our minds are passing judgments, causing us to believe that there is something always wrong with what we see. This is the natural play of the mind, and the source of our suffering. 

Through this meditation, we will learn to drop the imaginary over-load of expectations and rediscover our true source of fulfillment. We will awaken the life force energy of the Muladhara Chakra, also known as the root center – located at the base of the spine, where 80% of our pure potential energy is locked! 


As enlightened Master, Paramahamsa Nithyananda says, “Whole creation is a gift to you from Existence. Receive it with grace and humility. When you do this the tremendous energy of the muladhara chakra is opened to you. To awaken this chakra is to touch a perennial source of energy. The tremendous energy that is now locked is imagination, expectation and greed can be made available for creativity, for business, for life and for reality!” Join us and learn how to access your true inner source of fulfillment! When: Sunday, March 8th, 2015

Start Time: 2:30 pm sharp 

Please be on time you do not miss any important instructions!

Where:
Mill Creek Meadows Condo Complex
Mill Valley 

Cost: This is a free workshop. 

Please RSVP, Spaces are Limited but bring a friend and enjoy this together! 


Important: Chairs are available, but if you prefer to sit on the floor, please bring a small cushion or blanket to sit on. 

Contact us with any questions at (509)[masked]
name: Awaken Your Life Force Energy & Source of Fulfillment‏!

So let's gather and share a bit about ourselves, where we currently are, where we want to go (our goals), some of the challenges we encounter and some of our successes.

Looking forward to seeing you there! 

For more information about Regenerate Your Health, and myself, please visit my website: www.RegenerateYourHealth.com

description:
Harp is a great workout and the rewards are spectacular. Be prepared to work hard as we'll gain about 3500 feet of elevation in a little over 2 miles-this hike is very steep, with a bit of easy rock scrambling near the top. I'm a slow steady hiker but you're welcome to go on out ahead, there is really only one way and that's up! I'm going to want to go as fast as I can to challenge myself.

This exposed ridgeline tends to be windy so dress accordingly with lots of layers and good windgear, warm mittens, hood, etc. Bring a pack with essentials, water, food. Good ice grippers will be needed as well as trekking poles or ice ax to self arrest if necessary.

 I'll be out on the trail all week and oblivious to the internet and weather forecast so check back Fri eve to make sure we're still on.

We can meet at the park-n-ride infront of the landfill at Hiland rd exit on the Glenn to carpool at 10AM. There is limited parking at the trailhead.
name: Harp Mountain

description:
How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other? Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we've created!

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or sports bar conversation.

We play three communication games that will challenge you to consider questions like 'What are your relationships like?' 'What does Orgasm mean to you?' and 'What's one secret desire you have?'

Questions like these encourage vulnerability. And, what happens when you get vulnerable? It creates intimacy... which is what we're all searching for!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real.

At OneTaste we teach a wellness practice known as Orgasmic Meditation (OM for short.) The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of OM, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!) - sort of like having the feeling of an incredible dessert without having consumed any of the calories.

You can play and participate at whatever level feels comfortable to you!

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions feel free to contact Phoebe at[masked]
name: TurnON Seattle!

description:
For many of our members, this is their favourite of the temples we visit each year. From their website: "Widely regarded as the most exquisite example of traditional Chinese architecture in Canada, the International Buddhist Temple is in many ways like a work of art taken straight out of Chinese history.

As a magnificent structural complex modeled after the Forbidden City in Beijing, China, the temple features Chinese imperial architecture in all its glory. Combining intricate stonework and symbolic carvings with the elements of nature, the tranquil grounds resemble a scholar's courtyard in ancient China."

Click here on ** virtual tour **to see a video of temple.

We're having the temple set menu for that week. It is all vegan. 

Cost $17/ person


N.B. By RSVPing Yes to this event, you agree to pay the cost of your meal if you cancel with less than 24 hours notice.
name: Lunch at International Buddhist Temple

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT

description:
Join us at Joli farm in Liberty Hill, to learn how to build a low cost, nice looking wicking bed. We will also discuss the use of compost tea as fertilizer and how to brew it.

Not sure about aquaponics, and just want to grow organic food without any fuss.. then wicking beds may be the answer!

These low cost, easy to build, soil gardens are incredibly productive and simple to maintain. 


At Joe and Lisa Schram's farm, you will be able to see several different examples of wicking beds and aquaponics in action.. and see the evolution of how we like to build them.. cheap and easy!

Attendees leave with a parts list and step by step instructions for building the wicking bed.

The cost is $30 / person or two for $50.
name: Wicking bed constructon and Compost tea Workshop

description:
Weight & Wellness Lecture Series: Advice from America's Doctor
Kane Hall 130

As “America’s Doctor,” 18th United States Surgeon General Regina Benjamin, M.D., M.B.A., focused her attention on wellness and prevention, and provided the public with the best scientific information available on how to improve their health. In this lecture, she speaks to her time creating a roadmap for the nation’s health, and discusses the past and future of public health policy in the United States. When: Thursday, April 30, 2015; 6:30 p.m.
Where: Kane Hall
Room 130
UW Campus
Cost: Free, but advance registration is required.

From her early days as the founder of a rural health clinic in Alabama — which she kept in operation despite destruction inflicted by hurricanes George and Katrina, as well as a devastating fire — to her leadership role in the worldwide advancement of preventive healthcare as the 18th United States Surgeon General, Dr. Benjamin has forged a career that has been recognized by a wide array of organizations and publications. She is the recipient of 22 honorary degrees and a member of the Institute of Medicine—the health arm of the National Academy of Sciences.
Register at:http://engage.washington.edu/site/Calendar/79004894?view=RSVP&id=123143
name: Weight and Wellness Series: Advice from America's Doctor

description:
WHAT:Lets  Go  to Eltham  market   along the Yarra and Diamond Creek trails for brunch . The market closes 12:30pm  hence an Earlier start. This ride should suit everyone see below 

BIKES: Road (would not recommend as there is long sections of gravel to ride on), Hybrid , if you come on MTB there is load of single track also                

MEET: Clifton hill station @ 9:30 take either the 9:09 (arrive 9:28) or 9:19 (arrive 9:38)  train platform one Flinders station   can use south morang or hustbridge lines

MEET: Eltham Station 11:15 From Flinders st platform 1 take 10:19 am train Hurstbridge Line

please check the train timetable a couple of days before

eltham station is only about 800m from the market

http://ridewithgps.com/routes/7059908 

More info on Eltham market  http://www.elthammarket.com.au/location/

Grade: Easy to Moderate (lots of hard packed gravel sections) 

Distance: 25 or 50km return (from market two choices can jump on train or ride back) (looking at averaging 10 to 20 km/h)

What To Bring: ,Your self, some friends ,2 full Water bottles , Spare Tube (best to bring two as not very close to train stations) Patch kit ,tools pump  etc oh and a sense of Adventure also:)  also a snack in case.

Before Ride. please check pressure in tyres (should be inflated to within recommended pressure which can be found on side wall of tyre)  and check for wear on the tread
name: Cycle to Eltham market 25-50km

description:
March is the month of new beginnings and Spring.  Come and celebrate with the energy of the Fairies as we move forward into new life with the rebirth of Spring.  

Whether you are an intuitive/medium or not you are welcome to play your craft with us or just enjoy the energy of like minded people.  See our facebook group Daughters of Delphi for more info. and know that this is not a women's only group.  Guys like us too and we do have some wonderful men who are members.

The Daughters of Delphi is a very special event for those who enjoy the art of divining the future through the use of Tarot, Oracle cards and other tools of forecast. This group originated from a close knit class of women who have been developing and practicing their talents for a number of years. We were brought together by Spirit and have continued to touch each other’s lives. When we first came together it had been predicted that each one of us would grow and advance in her talents and then continue expanding into the Universe. All were to be the light, teaching and guiding as she moved through this world. I am happy to say that I have personally watched as this prediction has come true. The talent that has been produced from this group has been truly amazing and the blessings for each one of us continues to grow. We have been there and supported each other through the worst and best of times and now have heard the message to share with others our gifts.
You have been invited to learn, practice and play your craft with us. All levels are welcomed. We offer you our friendship and support with like-minded people. Our plan is to meet once a month. Our favorite hang out for this fun get together is Fuzzy’s Taco Shop in Lewisville. Bring your favorite deck of cards or other divining tool for a fun and entertaining get together. This is an open group and we accept all levels of talent. Come and play and learn from some of the most talented intuitives and spiritual teachers in the DFW area!
name: Daughters of Delphi

description:
Hey Friends, this is a Media Event. If your interested in participating RSVP as usual. Nadia Stewart, Video Journalist with Global News will be present (like a fly on the wall). This is a free event. Thank you for contributing to Cuddle Party awareness and to the further benefit of others.

Cuddle Party is a fun and practical workshop about human connection and consensual non-sexual touch (think hand or shoulder massage, sharing hugs and snuggles, spooning). One decides with whom and how to cuddle, including to option to not cuddle at all. One may simply appreciate meeting others or having time to unwind.  Some people are comfortable with touch, right away. Others explore the communication skills. While others are openly curious. Whatever your reasons, Cuddle Party is a great playground for practicing being true to oneself and connecting with other cuddly souls. 

Curious? There's more . .

In the first forty-five minutes participants are led through a series of playful exercises by a trained facilitator which allow for getting acquainted, assertive communication, and to learn the Cuddle Party rules (for e.g., tears and laughter are both welcome). Then for the next couple of hours you may practice the skills you've just learned, fill your cuddle tank or simply chit-chat, journal, rest. There are no cuddle or social expectations, just a willingness to self-discover.

All genders are welcome and ratio varies (and participants cuddle in variety - women and men cuddle, women cuddle women, also men cuddle men - in pairs and often in clusters of three, four, five, six - whatever one's comfortable with). 

For those who feel most at ease in a smaller group, I keep it to 10-20 cuddlers (and for a variety of reasons, I keep a hard copy attendee list and overbook so the meetup RSVP total may vary from the true count). 

Bring along a friend. 

This is an alcohol-free/smoke-free event.

You must be 18+ to participate.

Wondering what to wear? It's easy - pajamas, yoga or sweat pants - think more drawstring, less lace.

Allergy alert! This a scent-free zone (minus perfumes, colognes). 

You are welcome to arrive early between 1:30-2:00 pm so you can get comfortable as we'll be starting on time.

If you're unable to attend, please unRSVP your spot so that another cuddler may attend.

If this event is full, feel free to waitlist as openings do become available.

You'll receive confirmation and details the week of the event. 

For your convenience I communicate two-way via email, checking-in often (and more frequent on event days). 

Before or after the event, friends will often venture to share food and conversation!  

Elevating benefits of a Cuddle Party may include:

belonging,

self-empowerment,

compassion,

insight,

clearing,

rejuvenation,

balance,

happiness,

serenity,

gratitude.


To learn about and register for Vancouver Cuddle Party facilitated by Jon Lehrer visit: vancuddle.eventbrite.ca 

YouTube: London 360 Cuddle Workshop and Cuddle Party Rules & Advice
name: CuddleParty@Karins - Media Event

description:
Strenuous 15-16 mile hike (This is not for beginners, really! This is not a hike to break in new boots. Advanced Intermediate to Advanced Only.) Elevation Gain 3500 ft.


 


Difficulty: STRENUOUS 15 mile, 3500 feet of elevation gain on trail and fire road. We must hike at a FAST PACE due to the early sunset. Must bring headlamp and ten essentials.

Highlights: Great views of the Bay Area and Pacific Ocean, Stinson Beach, Steep Ravine Trail (my favorite trail section anywhere) and Mt Tamalpais Peak.

Trailhead: Across from Mountain Home Inn. Take I-80 West to SR 37 West to US 101 South. From US 101 near Mill Valley, exit at Stinson Beach/Highway 1. After 0.6 mile, turn left at the traffic signal, staying on Highway 1. After 2.6 miles, bear right at the fork onto Panoramic Highway (a sign says "Mt. Tamalpais"). After about 1 mile, at a 4-way intersection, take the high road, Panoramic Highway (again, a sign says "Mt. Tamalpais"). After about 2 more miles, Mountain Home Inn is on your right. Park in the lot on your left, across the highway from the inn.

Trail Description: From the trailhead, follow Alice Eastwood Road downward. Turn right and upward onto Troop 80 Trail and follow it to Van Wyck Meadow. Follow Bootjack Trail towards Mountain Theater, then take Alpine Trail to Pantoll (rest rooms, water). From there, follow Old Mine Trail to Dipsea Trail, on which you travel down to Stinson Beach. We will have lunch at Stinson Beach.

After lunch we will start our long 2571+ foot climb to Mt. Tamalpais Peak. We will retrace our last mile on the Dipsea Trail, after crossing the Panoramic Highway, we will come to a stream and trail junction, turn right onto Steep Ravine Trail and follow it right back up to Pantoll. From there, cross Panoramic Highway and follow Old Stage Road to West Point Inn (rest rooms). Then take Old Railroad Grade up to the end of the public auto access road, then turn right and stay to the right on a gentle grade to the visitors center area (rest rooms, water, food), and continue up to Mt. Tamalpais East Peak. Return to the parking lot via Fern Creek Trail, a lower section of Old Railroad Grade, and Hogback Trail.

Park Brochure and Map: http://www.parks.ca.gov/pages/471/files/MtT...

 

Post Hike: TBD
name: Mt Tamalpais (2571 feet) Sea to Sky Peak Hike (Strenuous, Advanced Hike)

description:
IF YOU'RE NEW PLEASE REVIEW OUR POLICIES EXPLAINING HOW ONLINE PAYMENT AND THE WAITLIST WORKS. HERE’S A LINK TO OUR POLICIES: http://www.meetup.com/PUGSports/messages/boards/

Turf field with full size goals and stadium lighting; Bring turf shoes and a DARK (black, blue, red, orange) and WHITE (Solid White; no stripes) Shirt. Gray is NOT white or dark.

We have the field from 7 pm to 9 pm. We plan to play one regular sized game 90 minute game of up to 12 on 12, with full size goals.

There are no set teams; the game organizer divides the players into sides in an attempt to create roughly equal teams. Input from players in achieving this goal is encouraged. We welcome anyone over 18, both men and women; whether you're experienced or new to the game. All we ask is that you give it 100%; we value effort over ability.

We play two 45 minute halves, no slide tackling, call your own fouls and respect the call if someone calls a foul on you. In situations where the ball may be going out of bounds, it must be obvious; any doubt and the call will go to the offense.

Gentleman's offside; if someone is a foot or two ahead of you, that's not considered offside, what we don't want is someone cherry picking next to the goal.

Also, we call all hand balls, intentional or not, so a hand ball stops play.

If there are any disputes, the game organizer has the final say, period.

We rotate goalies so that everyone plays it once unless we have someone who wants to play goalie for the entire game. Goalie gloves are available if you wish to use a pair while playing goalie.

A goalie may slide in an attempt to stop a shot so it’s up to the offensive player to avoid contact.

We're looking for people who like to compete but do not go overboard about it. If you're the type of player who harps on other players inadequacies or has a negative attitude if the game doesn't go your way or you just generally think you're God's gift to Soccer, you may want to join a league and pass us by.

We want positive people who enjoy playing with other like-minded individuals.

If you have any questions please do not hesitate to ask.

°SO7A
name: Los Angeles Coed Outdoor Soccer

description:
Weight & Wellness Lecture Series: Advice from America's Doctor
Kane Hall 130

As “America’s Doctor,” 18th United States Surgeon General Regina Benjamin, M.D., M.B.A., focused her attention on wellness and prevention, and provided the public with the best scientific information available on how to improve their health. In this lecture, she speaks to her time creating a roadmap for the nation’s health, and discusses the past and future of public health policy in the United States. When: Thursday, April 30, 2015; 6:30 p.m.
Where: Kane Hall
Room 130
UW Campus
Cost: Free, but advance registration is required.

From her early days as the founder of a rural health clinic in Alabama — which she kept in operation despite destruction inflicted by hurricanes George and Katrina, as well as a devastating fire — to her leadership role in the worldwide advancement of preventive healthcare as the 18th United States Surgeon General, Dr. Benjamin has forged a career that has been recognized by a wide array of organizations and publications. She is the recipient of 22 honorary degrees and a member of the Institute of Medicine—the health arm of the National Academy of Sciences.
Register at:http://engage.washington.edu/site/Calendar/79004894?view=RSVP&id=123143

Location and Directions

Kane Hall is located on the north side of Red Square on the UW Seattle campus. View a map showing the location. Paid parking is available in the Central Plaza Garage below Kane Hall at $10; additional paid parking is available in several west campus lots (W6, W12, W14) for $5 (cash only at automated pay stations).

Driving Directions: From I-5, take the NE 45th Street exit (#169). Turn east onto NE 45th Street. Continue east about one quarter mile to 15th Avenue NE and turn right. Head south on 15th Avenue three blocks to NE 41st Street. Turn left at Gate #1 into the Central Plaza Garage. Stop at the gatehouse inside the garage for directions and a parking permit.

Transit Information: There are more than 60 bus routes from all over King and Snohomish counties serving the University District. For more information on taking a bus to the UW, visit the regional online trip planner provided by King County Metro.
name: Weight and Wellness Series: Advice from America's Doctor

description:
Being true to our personal values at work is critical to resilience, and performing at our best. Exploring the deep values that motivate us and bring us to work can be a hugely rewarding and enlightening experience.

Arrive from 5.30pm to collect your participant pack and join us in the cafe to socialise over tea and biscuits.

IN THIS SESSION WE WILL:

i) start with a ten minute mindful focussing exercise to get us in the right frame of mind - all our Brain Training sessions will start this way, for more details see the 'About Us' section.

ii) learn about what it means to be true to our values and what the research tells us how being our authentic selves can boost resilience, reduce stress, and enhance performance. 

iii) explore some simple techniques to help us get our 'values compass' calibrated and put it to work helping us be more authentically ourselves.
name: Getting in tune with your values at work (FREE introductory session)

group.name: Brain Train Tuesdays: blast stress & get inspired at work

description:
This is a free 10-week series to learn React.js. 

It's every Sun starting with this one and ends Sun, May 31st. Please only sign up if you can make ALL 10 Sunday workshops.

There's NO in-person instructor. We will be watching React.js videos and hacking on projects. The principles learned in day one will carry over to the rest of the weeks.

We'll learn not only React, but also how to build apps in React with the Flux architecture, React Router, Browserify, Gulp, and Firebase.

Suggested knowledge-level: 

You should have a solid understanding of JavaScript. 

Look into these before coming: 

• CommonJS/NPM (requiring packages) 
• Bootstrap (high level understanding)"
• Git/Github: All of the curriculum is on GitHub, so you'll need a GitHub account as well as basic understanding of how Git/GitHub work.

Installations:
These are the things you'll want installed before coming: 

• Node
• Webpack
• Git


FAQs:

Q: What should I bring?

A: Your laptop with your favorite IDE / text editor you use to code.

Q: How do I sign up for the future study groups in this series?

A: If you show up for the first one, you'll get automatically added to the 2nd one and so on. So you'll have to show up for the first one to be able to continue on. This is because typical meetup turnout rates are notoriously low for events that are free.


Got questions? Email [masked]
name: React.js Study Group (WEEK 1 OF 10)

Our next fun tournament will be at Crystal Springs. Tournament is limited to 32 players, so sign up now!

This event is for our NCGA Associate Club members only.  

If you are not (yet) a member of our Club, please join us.  Annual NCGA membership fee through us is $76.

This tournament will not be scheduled as a meetup, like we did for the February tournament, so please do not RSVP on this page.

If you're signing up for it, please do so through our eClubhouse site.  Click on this link: 

http://ghin.com/eClubhouse/events.aspx?cid=1945 to sign up.  

Entry fee is $73.00.  It will be a straight stroke play format.  Best net score wins.  

* Do not post your score from this tournament.  Our Tournament Director, Carl, will do that for us.

** Every single stroke must be counted during the tournament.  There is no "I'll take a max of 8 (or double-par) for this hole," etc.  If you end up with 14 strokes on a particular hole, you must write down 14 on your scorecard.

If you have any questions about this tournament or a golf rules question, please feel free to post your question below in the comment box.

description:
This is a free 10-week series to learn React.js. 

It's every Sun starting with this one and ends Sun, May 31st. Please only sign up if you can make ALL 10 Sunday workshops.

There's NO in-person instructor. We will be watching React.js videos and hacking on projects. The principles learned in day one will carry over to the rest of the weeks.

We'll learn not only React, but also how to build apps in React with the Flux architecture, React Router, Browserify, Gulp, and Firebase.

Suggested knowledge-level: 

You should have a solid understanding of JavaScript. 

Look into these before coming: 

• CommonJS/NPM (requiring packages) 
• Bootstrap (high level understanding)"
• Git/Github: All of the curriculum is on GitHub, so you'll need a GitHub account as well as basic understanding of how Git/GitHub work.

Installations:
These are the things you'll want installed before coming: 

• Node
• Webpack
• Git

FAQs:

Q: What should I bring?

A: Your laptop with your favorite IDE / text editor you use to code.

Q: How do I sign up for the future study groups in this series?

A: If you show up for the first one, you'll get automatically added to the 2nd one and so on. So you'll have to show up for the first one to be able to continue on. This is because typical meetup turnout rates are notoriously low for events that are free.


Got questions? Email [masked]
name: React.js Study Group (WEEK 1 OF 10)

description:
Event: Hike; Part of the Finger Lake Series.


Description: The main cataract of the falls is a 215-foot drop (66 m), making it 33 feet (10 m) taller than Niagara Falls. It is the tallest single-drop waterfall east of the Rocky Mountains. The water flows through a long gorge with cliffs up to 400 ft high (120 m), characteristic of the area's gorges that give rise to the common "Ithaca is Gorges" bumper stickers and t-shirts. The waterfall and gorge comprise an example of a hanging valley that developed in a very similar fashion to the one at nearby Watkins Glen State Park. None of the local gorges were "carved by glaciers." In fact all of the gorges are post-glacial valleys carved by the streams that still run through them. It is the valleys over which the waterfalls hang that were eroded (over-deepened) by the advance of the Pleistocene ice sheets.

Cost: Free

Attractions:

• Swimming is available only in designated life guarded area. 

• Bikes are not permitted on the hiking trails but there is a bike path just outside the park.

• Picnic areas have tables and fireplaces.

• Hot Showers and flush toilets are available.

• There is a concession stand.

• Picnic shelters are on the premises.

• Permitted activities are posted in park office.

• The park offers summer music concerts.

• There is Fishing in the creek and the lake.

• Boat rentals are available.

Maps:

Difficulty: Easy

Distance: 3.5 Miles

Duration: 5 Hours

Suggested Car Pool Cost: $30

Designated driver and passengers link:

Event Guide:

• At the parking lot we start our hike to Taughannock Falls using the north rim trail heading west for 1.5 miles.

• Now we head east using the south rim trail for 1.08 miles.

• Now we are down by the river using gorge trail heading west to Taughannock Falls.

Reference Link:

http://www.fingerlakes.com/parks/taughannock-falls-state-park

http://nysparks.com

http://taughannock.com/

Disclaimer:

http://www.meetup.com/Asians-Meetup/pages/Disclaimer/

END
name: Vibrant Embrace of Taughannock Falls

description:
Let's Meetup to see the world famous crooner duo that comprised the 70s-80s band Air Supply, whose beautiful love songs and amazing harmonies provided the soundtrack to every teenage girl's first love story! We'll meet early, have a few drinks, talk and socialize awhile, and then go into the theatre for the concert. Bring your best girl/guy, hold them close as you sway to the melodic notes, and fall in love all over again! (Was that way too corny? lol)

NOTE: I could use a volunteer AO for this event, even if it's just a one time deal, in case anything comes up and I'm unable to attend. All the AO needs to do is serve as the point of contact (via text) for people arriving at the casino and looking for our group. That way everyone can hang together before the concert and sit together inside the theatre. :)

http://www.riverwind.com/event/air-supply-concert/
name: Air Supply Concert

description:
The strength and quality of our connections at work and outside it are a cornerstone of our resilience and indeed our ability to add value in the workplace. Participants will explore and share learning about what it takes to create connections that work for us.

Arrive from 5.30pm to collect your participant pack and join us in the cafe to socialise over tea and biscuits. 


IN THIS SESSION WE WILL:

i) start with a ten minute mindful focussing exercise (for more details see the 'About Us' section).

ii) learn about makes a 'High Quality Connection' and the benefits, particularly drawing on the cutting-edge work of leading organisational researcher Prof. Jane E Dutton.  

iii) explore the simple techniques you can apply immediately to help build High Quality Connections.


PAYMENT DETAILS 

This workshop costs $25, please pay in advance so I can prepare your participant pack.

I also offer the following discounts  (please contact me): 
- FREE introductory session - if you haven't been to a Brain-Train Tuesday before, you are very welcome to join us for a complementary taster session, just sign up and let me know you're coming along.
- Become a subscriber - set up an easy monthly $20 automatic payment. 
- Complementary professions - If you work in one of the following I'm also happy to offer a 10% discount: creative professions, HR and Change Management professionals, Psychologists.

If you'd like to take advantage of the above just send me a message.
name: Building Quality Connections Quickly

group.name: Brain Train Tuesdays: blast stress & get inspired at work

description:
You've surely heard the buzz around 3D printing, but have you ever seen a 3D printer in action?

Are you an old hand in the game, and have a few skills to share?

The guys from Make-Create in Brunswick are hosting regular 3D@FML sessions, so come along and meet fellow makers at the cutting edge.  There will be an introduction to 3D printing technology, and you'll get to see it all happen right before your eyes.  We're keen to hear what you'd like to see happen in 3D printing at FML too, so come along for a chat.

If you've ever wondered about the world of 3D printing, we'd love to see you at the 3D@FML launch event.
name: 3D Printing @ FML

Our next fun tournament will be at Crystal Springs. Tournament is limited to 32 players, so sign up now!

This event is for our NCGA Associate Club members only.  

If you are not (yet) a member of our Club, please join us.  Annual NCGA membership fee through us is $76.

This tournament will not be scheduled as a meetup, like we did for the February tournament, so please do not RSVP on this page.

If you're signing up for it, please do so through our eClubhouse site.  Click on this link: 

http://ghin.com/eClubhouse/events.aspx?cid=1945 to sign up.  

Entry fee is $73.00.  It will be a straight stroke play format.  Best net score wins.  

* Do not post your score from this tournament.  Our Tournament Director, Carl, will do that for us.

** Every single stroke must be counted during the tournament.  There is no "I'll take a max of 8 (or double-par) for this hole," etc.  If you end up with 14 strokes on a particular hole, you must write down 14 on your scorecard.

If you have any questions about this tournament or a golf rules question, please feel free to post your question below in the comment box.

description:
Let's share the amazing energy of Reiki!

My door is open and you're welcome to arrive as early as 6pm. Meeting starts promptly at 6:30pm.

VERY IMPORTANT: The building management requires that the building entry doors be locked after hours in the evening. 

The entry is a glass door on the westside of the building (directly off the parking lot). I will check the door before we begin our meeting at 6:30p just in case one of the last tenants locked it on their way out.

After our meeting commences at 6:30pm, the doors will be locked so please be on time! Thank you!


Suggested donation: $5 to infinity (haha... it's just a suggestion!) but seriously... you're asked to give what you feel you've gotten from the event.

Looking forward to seeing you there! 

For more information about Regenerate Your Health, and myself, please visit my website: www.RegenerateYourHealth.com

description:
An exploration of the unique things each of us have to offer, and who we are when 'at our best'. Adopting a strengths-based focus at work helps build
capacity, confidence and helps us to more readily recognise opportunity.

Arrive from 5.30pm to collect your participant pack and join us in the cafe to socialise over tea and biscuits. 


IN THIS SESSION WE WILL:

i) start with a ten minute mindful focussing exercise (for more details see the 'About Us' section).

ii) dip into the significant body of research in understanding how personal strengths and character strengths play a role our wellbeing, resilience and performance.   

iii) learn and practice the simple technique of 'strength spotting' in understanding our own strengths as well as a tool in coaching colleagues and team members. 


PAYMENT DETAILS 

This workshop costs $25, please pay in advance so I can prepare your participant pack.

I also offer the following discounts  (please contact me): 
- FREE introductory session - if you haven't been to a Brain-Train Tuesday before, you are very welcome to join us for a complementary taster session, just sign up and let me know you're coming along.
- Become a subscriber - set up an easy monthly $20 automatic payment. 
- Complementary professions - If you work in one of the following I'm also happy to offer a 10% discount: creative professions, HR and Change Management professionals, Psychologists.

If you'd like to take advantage of the above just send me a message.
name: Why personal strengths matter

description:
LIVE LIVE LIVE!!! What’s up people?!?! The UFC will be just about as close as they can get to NYC with an awesome awesome card of fights. I don’t know about you guys/gals but I have been very interested in seeing a UFC fight live and up close and personal and this will be one of the best opportunities yet! On April 18th in Newark NJ we will be preparing to see a monster card of killers featuring Luke Rockhold Vs. Lyoto Machida headlining what looks to be a promising under and main card of fights. We got Souza vs. Romero, Felice Herrig Vs. new comer (and strawweight hated) Paige Vanzant, Ovince Saint Preux Vs. Pat Cummins, Jim Miller Vs. the Undefeated Paul Felder and so much more! This fight is on BIG FOX so you know it’s going to be crazy in and outside of the arena.

As it stands right now tickets are as low as $65 for nose bleed seats and go up to $1500+ for near cage side action. We would love to get everyone seated together if possible but we understand that everyone has a different price that they are willing to pay for this venue and card. I personally am willing to go as high as $200+ for this event but that may be too much for some to keep us all in a group together. I propose for those that are going to go to suggest a price that they are willing to pay in the comments. Look up the available seats in that range and let’s see if we can get a group of us to sit together. Even if we can’t sit together I would love to meet up at the event to say what’s up and share in the excitement of being there! Tickets are selling fast for this so if you are going I would say to make your suggestions and purchases ASAP. For those interested we can all try to meet and head to the event together if feasible.

To top all of this off we will also have a local event for the home team. Look out for that announcement coming soon and look for us on the TV screen in the crowd at the event. It will be a HELLOVATIME either way! So who’s in?!!!?!

• P.S. For those that are driving let us know in the comments. Perhaps we can create a few car pools with the non drivers chipping in for gas and tolls.

Luke Rockhold Vs. Lyoto Machida

Yoel Romero Vs. Ronaldo Souza

Cub Swanson Vs. Max Holloway

Jim Miller Vs. Paul Felder

Ovince St. Preux Vs. Patrick Cummins

Paige VanZant Vs. Felice Herrig

Corey Anderson Vs. Gian Villante

Kenny Robertson Vs. George Sullivan

Chris Dempsey Vs. Eddie Gordon

Takeya Mizugaki Vs. Aljamain Sterling

Nick Catone Vs. Vitor Miranda

• Map of loosely what's available as of 3/3

All Red & Blue seats are "available".

•  Sections we will be sitting in.




http://youtu.be/ITwF7gn4mng

• I think this video has changed my favorite for this event.

http://youtu.be/_MQS5BlT0tI

description:
Don't miss this opportunity to learn more about the translation and localization industry's leading humanitarian organization!

Translators without Borders board members, advisors, and staff from around the world will join us once again for this special evening, including Program Director Rebecca Petras (Amsterdam), board chairman Andrew Bredenkamp (Acrolinx, Switzerland), plus board members Renato Beninatto (Moravia, Brno, CR), Val Swisher (Content Rules), Salvo Giammarresi (PayPal), Iris Orriss (Facebook), Donna Parrish (Multilingual), and others.

Master of Ceremonies:
Scott Abel, "The Content Wrangler"

Speakers:
Andrew Bredenkamp, Chairman of the Board, Translators without Borders, and Chairman and Founder, Acrolinx,
Alolita Sharma, senior i18n, L10n, & NLP engineering manager at Twitter, previously with Wikimedia, and board member of the Software Freedom Law Center, the Open Source Initiative, and the Commons Initiative,
Paul Warambo, translator, Translators without Borders Kenya, via special video link,
and others to we hope to confirm soon!

Hors d'oeuvres, beer and wine will be served.*  The evening will also feature a silent auction and other ways to support this important organization. 

The entrance fee of $10 for members and non-members will be donated to Translators without Borders. You can RSVP for yourself and any guests via Meetup with a debit card, credit card, or PayPal account.  Credit cards, cash, and checks will also be accepted at the event, and donation receipts will be available from Translators without Borders upon request.

Many thanks to:
Salvo Giammarresi and PayPal for hosting, and
Renato Beninatto and Moravia IT for sponsoring the drinks!*

This is a fundraiser for the language industry's charity. Additional donations are welcome! Translators without Borders is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt nonprofit organization.

*Please drink responsibly, and arrange alternate transportation if necessary.
name: Special Event: An Evening with Translators without Borders

description:
How it works

Would you like to learn how to play tennis in a social friendly group? It's great exercise and fun.

If we have sufficient RSVPs we will have an instructor otherwise, I an not an instructor but I will show absolute beginners the basics and let more advanced beginners know where/how they may improve. 

When we do have a coach s/he will be experienced, qualified and exceptionally talented in their field.

Session will cost 10 euro per hour. We are likely to have the courts for 2 hours and you will have a minimum of one hour and a maximum of 2 hours on court training/playing. Mild cardio exercises may be interwoven. If you RSVP we really need you to come along. The first few mins may be devoted to warm-up exercises.

Types of technique practiced with a coach present

• Stance and split step

• Forehand cross court

• Back hand cross court

• Forehand down the line

• Backhand down the line

• Lobs

• Volleys

• Smashes

• Ground strokes

• Serves

Special Offer - you can get 20% off 1 to 1 lessons if you have a Dublin Tennis members card.

Note: As detailed in the notes issued to Dublin Tennis Members. If RSVPs are not sufficient (Decision made on Wednesday 12 midday) the session not have a coach. Reasoning: We have to pay a coach and give advance warning (coach is unlikely to travel across for only one session). 

Keep in touch we send out status messages via meetup and/or twitter. Follow us: 
https://twitter.com/hashtag/TennisDublin?src=hash

Kind Regards,

John

[masked]

Members ID and Discount Cards are now available 
http://www.gr8.events/dtm-card

description:
What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!) We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting. If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015 Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business. Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT
name: 90+ Pt Sonoma Patio Wine Party: Louis Foppiano@Warwick-Pl­­ayboy Twist!

description:
Event details are subject to change. Watch this space for updated details.

Admission is AED 20.

Discussion Topic: TBA

Member showcase (TBA)
At each biweekly, members show us about a dozen of their best shots, and answer questions about them. Want to try this yourself in the future? Talk to an organizer.

The Tuesday tip (Ashraf Jandali)
Want to improve your work using post-processing tools like Lightroom and Photoshop? Ashraf will tell you what you need to know.

Photo Competition (Theme: TBA)

Our sponsors FUJIFILM are giving away a camera to whoever submits the best photograph for our competition theme. Taking part is easy:


- You can submit up to two photos. Please rename the files so that they have your name in them, e.g. Ahmed1.JPG and Ahmed2.JPG.


- Email your shots to [masked] by 5 PM on the day of the event. Alternatively, bring them along on a USB thumb drive.


- Everyone votes on the photos during the event, and the photo with the most vote wins! Please note that if you are not around for the voting, you are not eligible to win.

We hope to see all of you soon - don't be shy about bringing your friends along. And join the conversation on Facebook and Twitter.

Venue
We will be meeting in Studio Attitude in Al Quoz, in the same series of warehouses as Botanica. The GPS coordinates  are[masked], 55.2301798251. Our location map includes landmarks. YouTube videos can show you the way down Sheikh Zayed Road from the direction of the World Trade Centre and Dubai Mall as well as from the direction of Abu Dhabi, the marina, and Al Barsha. More information on the venue can be found on the Studio Attitude website or at 04 3384114.

If you are really lost, you can also reach the EPyC hotline on[masked], but remember, we may not be able to answer your calls while the event is underway.

description:
LIVE LIVE LIVE!!! What’s up people?!?! The UFC will be just about as close as they can get to NYC with an awesome awesome card of fights. I don’t know about you guys/gals but I have been very interested in seeing a UFC fight live and up close and personal and this will be one of the best opportunities yet! On April 18th in Newark NJ we will be preparing to see a monster card of killers featuring Luke Rockhold Vs. Lyoto Machida headlining what looks to be a promising under and main card of fights. We got Souza vs. Romero, Felice Herrig Vs. new comer (and strawweight hated) Paige Vanzant, Ovince Saint Preux Vs. Pat Cummins, Jim Miller Vs. the Undefeated Paul Felder and so much more! This fight is on BIG FOX so you know it’s going to be crazy in and outside of the arena.

As it stands right now tickets are as low as $65 for nose bleed seats and go up to $1500+ for near cage side action. We would love to get everyone seated together if possible but we understand that everyone has a different price that they are willing to pay for this venue and card. I personally am willing to go as high as $200+ for this event but that may be too much for some to keep us all in a group together. I propose for those that are going to go to suggest a price that they are willing to pay in the comments. Look up the available seats in that range and let’s see if we can get a group of us to sit together. Even if we can’t sit together I would love to meet up at the event to say what’s up and share in the excitement of being there! Tickets are selling fast for this so if you are going I would say to make your suggestions and purchases ASAP. For those interested we can all try to meet and head to the event together if feasible.

To top all of this off we will also have a local event for the home team. Look out for that announcement coming soon and look for us on the TV screen in the crowd at the event. It will be a HELLOVATIME either way! So who’s in?!!!?!

• P.S. For those that are driving let us know in the comments. Perhaps we can create a few car pools with the non drivers chipping in for gas and tolls. 

Luke Rockhold Vs. Lyoto Machida

Yoel Romero Vs. Ronaldo Souza

Cub Swanson Vs. Max Holloway

Jim Miller Vs. Paul Felder

Ovince St. Preux Vs. Patrick Cummins

Paige VanZant Vs. Felice Herrig

Corey Anderson Vs. Gian Villante

Kenny Robertson Vs. George Sullivan

Chris Dempsey Vs. Eddie Gordon

Takeya Mizugaki Vs. Aljamain Sterling

Nick Catone Vs. Vitor Miranda

• Map of loosely what's available as of 3/3

All Red & Blue seats are "available".

•  Sections we will be sitting in.

http://youtu.be/ITwF7gn4mng

• I think this video has changed my favorite for this event.

http://youtu.be/_MQS5BlT0tI

description:
Being true to our personal values at work is critical to resilience, and performing at our best. Exploring the deep values that motivate us and bring us to work can be a hugely rewarding and enlightening experience.

Arrive from 5.30pm to collect your participant pack and join us in the cafe to socialise over tea and biscuits.

IN THIS SESSION WE WILL:

i) start with a ten minute mindful focussing exercise to get us in the right frame of mind - all our Brain Training sessions will start this way, for more details see the 'About Us' section.

ii) learn about what it means to be true to our values and what the research tells us how being our authentic selves can boost resilience, reduce stress, and enhance performance. 

iii) explore some simple techniques to help us get our 'values compass' calibrated and put it to work helping us be more authentically ourselves.
name: Getting in tune with your values at work (FREE introductory session)

description:
The strength and quality of our connections at work and outside it are a cornerstone of our resilience and indeed our ability to add value in the workplace. Participants will explore and share learning about what it takes to create connections that work for us.

Arrive from 5.30pm to collect your participant pack and join us in the cafe to socialise over tea and biscuits. 


IN THIS SESSION WE WILL:

i) start with a ten minute mindful focussing exercise (for more details see the 'About Us' section).

ii) learn about makes a 'High Quality Connection' and the benefits, particularly drawing on the cutting-edge work of leading organisational researcher Prof. Jane E Dutton.  

iii) explore the simple techniques you can apply immediately to help build High Quality Connections.


PAYMENT DETAILS 

This workshop costs $25, please pay in advance so I can prepare your participant pack.

I also offer the following discounts  (please contact me): 
- FREE introductory session - if you haven't been to a Brain-Train Tuesday before, you are very welcome to join us for a complementary taster session, just sign up and let me know you're coming along.
- Become a subscriber - set up an easy monthly $20 automatic payment. 
- Complementary professions - If you work in one of the following I'm also happy to offer a 10% discount: creative professions, HR and Change Management professionals, Psychologists.

If you'd like to take advantage of the above just send me a message.
name: Building Quality Connections Quickly
