description:
Mindful Movers,

March is a very special month. We are at the start of Autumn, and people around Australia gather for a Taste of Harmony – an initiative which celebrates the diversity of multicultural Australia. 




In the recent food discussion the consensus was that we need to be eating a truck load of more plants. The average Aussie eats about 111kg of meat per year. That's 5 times what the dietary guidlelines - crazy yeah!

So how about getting together for a plant based picnic. :) You can taste the worldly dishes from members.

description:
Join us for an awesome day to discover the township of Montville! We will start the day off by taking a walk thought Kondalilla National Park & than explorer the many unique/divine shops that Montville has to offer.

If you are going to attend this event I recommend that you do the following;

• Follow the comments to this event!

• Organize your own Transportation!

If anyone is willing to help out with transport, then please feel free to offer lifts in the comments below. If anyone needs a lift please feel free to ask in the comments below as well

Montville is a small town in the Sunshine Coast hinterland, on the Blackall Range in Queensland, Australia, around 400 metres above sea level. At the 2011 census, Montville and the surrounding area had a population of 886.

The Main Street Montville is home to over 100 boutique retail outlets, many housed in historic and unique buildings. Popular attractions include galleries, restaurants, wineries, cheese factories and craft and clothing shops. Find Out More…

Early settlement: The first white settlers arrived in the area in 1887 and the town was later named by Henry Smith. Read More…

Kondalilla Falls: The Picnic Creek circuit down the escarpment, past rock pools and a lookout with views of Kondalilla Falls. Walk through rainforest to the base of the waterfall and continue back up the ridge. Look for emergent bunya pines with their distinctive symmetrical dome shapes, dense stands of pica been palms and intriguing shapes of pink ash. What goes down must come back up! There are over 100 stair steps on the Kondalilla Falls circuit so you need to be reasonably fit. Find Out More…
name: Montville **Day Trip**

description:
Event: Hike; Part of the Finger Lake Series.


Description: The main cataract of the falls is a 215-foot drop (66 m), making it 33 feet (10 m) taller than Niagara Falls. It is the tallest single-drop waterfall east of the Rocky Mountains. The water flows through a long gorge with cliffs up to 400 ft high (120 m), characteristic of the area's gorges that give rise to the common "Ithaca is Gorges" bumper stickers and t-shirts. The waterfall and gorge comprise an example of a hanging valley that developed in a very similar fashion to the one at nearby Watkins Glen State Park. None of the local gorges were "carved by glaciers." In fact all of the gorges are post-glacial valleys carved by the streams that still run through them. It is the valleys over which the waterfalls hang that were eroded (over-deepened) by the advance of the Pleistocene ice sheets.

Cost: Free

Attractions:

• Swimming is available only in designated life guarded area. 

• Bikes are not permitted on the hiking trails but there is a bike path just outside the park.

• Picnic areas have tables and fireplaces.

• Hot Showers and flush toilets are available.

• There is a concession stand.

• Picnic shelters are on the premises.

• Permitted activities are posted in park office.

• The park offers summer music concerts.

• There is Fishing in the creek and the lake.

• Boat rentals are available.

Maps:

Difficulty: Easy

Distance: 3.5 Miles

Duration: 5 Hours

Suggested Car Pool Cost: TBA

Designated driver and passengers link:

Event Guide:

• At the parking lot we start our hike to Taughannock Falls using the north rim trail heading west for 1.5 miles.

• Now we head east using the south rim trail for 1.08 miles.

• Now we are down by the river using gorge trail heading west to Taughannock Falls.

Reference Link:

http://www.fingerlakes.com/parks/taughannock-falls-state-park

http://nysparks.com

http://taughannock.com/

Disclaimer:

http://www.meetup.com/Asians-Meetup/pages/Disclaimer/

END

description:
An exploration of the unique things each of us have to offer, and who we are when 'at our best'. Adopting a strengths-based focus at work helps build
capacity, confidence and helps us to more readily recognise opportunity.

Arrive from 5.30pm to collect your participant pack and join us in the cafe to socialise over tea and biscuits. 


IN THIS SESSION WE WILL:

i) start with a ten minute mindful focussing exercise (for more details see the 'About Us' section).

ii) dip into the significant body of research in understanding how personal strengths and character strengths play a role our wellbeing, resilience and performance.   

iii) learn and practice the simple technique of 'strength spotting' in understanding our own strengths as well as a tool in coaching colleagues and team members. 


PAYMENT DETAILS 

This workshop costs $25, please pay in advance so I can prepare your participant pack.

I also offer the following discounts  (please contact me): 
- FREE introductory session - if you haven't been to a Brain-Train Tuesday before, you are very welcome to join us for a complementary taster session, just sign up and let me know you're coming along.
- Become a subscriber - set up an easy monthly $20 automatic payment. 
- Complementary professions - If you work in one of the following I'm also happy to offer a 10% discount: creative professions, HR and Change Management professionals, Psychologists.

If you'd like to take advantage of the above just send me a message.
name: Why personal strengths matter

group.name: Brain Train Tuesdays: blast stress & get inspired at work

description:
Join us to learn to paint like an abstract art master with our series of new workshops on abstract and conceptual painting technique.

We are kicking off with this super fun and fool-proof liquid acrylic dripping technique. It enables you to produce artwork of intensely-rich colours, bold and expressive. It looks stunning and impressive. Like I always say, everyone can paint like a master if you have the knowhow! This is a very easy technique that can be picked up in no time.

Beginners would be able to able to bring home a piece of work that your friends would marvel at. For seasoned painter this would be something new and different for you to explore. Let's drop the paintbrushes and drip together!

All materials are provided. Just show up and paint!

 

 

 

 

Cost: $600 per person

Canvas size: 40x40cm

Painting Medium: Acrylic Paint

 

To Join

Step 1 : Please RSVP

Step 2: Please e-mail me your name and contact number [masked]

As a courtesy please update your RSVP if you cannot make it to the class.
name: Abstract & Conceptual Painting technique Series 1 - Liquid Acrylic Dripping

description:
We'll meet in the foyer of Verona, I'll post my exact location on arrival, and will head into the cinema soon thereafter as the movie starts at 6pm, will post where we are sitting in case you arrive later.  Tickets can be pre-purchased on this link in case it sells out.

' SAINT LAURENT' - Drama re the life of iconic fashion designer Yves St Laurent - 150 minutes

Saint Laurent is a spectacular celebration of the famous and flamboyant designer’s
artistry, drive and inspiration. This fascinating biopic focuses on Yves Saint Laurent
at the zenith of his celebrity and explores his relationships, neuroses, addictions and
insecurities. It is, appropriately, a true work of art and France’s entry in the 2015 Academy
Awards®.
The always charismatic Gaspard Ulliel delivers a compelling performance as the tortured
iconoclast, ably supported by Aymeline Valade and Léa Seydoux as his muses. However,
it is the performances of Louis Garrel as the preening model and Jérémie Renier as Pierre
Bergé that are the real stand-outs. Saint Laurent’s fall from grace and his subsequent
rise to fame are well known, but this fascinating film adds new layers to his story of
redemption.
The other stars of the film are the outstanding soundtrack, and, of course, the clothes –
be prepared for a continuous display of covetable garments that serve as a reminder of
the true genius behind the aloof façade of Saint Laurent.

“Bertrand Bonello’s glossily intuitive vision is pure haute couture” - Variety
name: French Film Festival drama - ' Saint Laurent' - Sunday March 8th 5.45pm - Verona

What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)  We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT
name: 90+ Pt Sonoma Patio Wine Party: Louis Foppiano@Warwick-Pl­­ayboy Twist!

description:
Mindful Movers,

March is a very special month. We are at the start of Autumn, and people around Australia gather for a Taste of Harmony – an initiative which celebrates the diversity of multicultural Australia. 




In the recent food discussion the consensus was that we need to be eating a truck load of more plants. The average Aussie eats about 111kg of meat per year. That's 5 times what the dietary guidlelines - crazy yeah!

So how about getting together for a plant based picnic. :) You can taste the worldly dishes from members. 

The 28th March is marks the near end of MeatFreeWeek - which is a global campaign to get you thinking about how much meat you eat, and the impact eating too much has on your health, animals and the environment. The big impact is meat. Check out their site for more info. 


Let’s blend these initiatives for one BIG celebration and picnic at Botanical Gardens

Bring your favourite plant based dish to share with a beautiful picnic. The attendees loved the location with amazing views of Sydney. What to bring? 

- Food enough to share with 3 more people ( because I eat a lot!)

- A picnic rug to sit on
- Water/Drink for yourself to drink
- Your own plate and cutlery
- Frisbee/Football This time around we can dedicate one person to bring plates for the group. It saves each person bringing a plate. If you are stuck for ideas, the easiest thing to bring is simply a bowl of fruit or a salad.

The meeting point is at the Henry Lawson Gate on Mrs Macquarie Road. Botanical Gardens. As you enter Henry Lawson Gate, turn right and we'll be sitting about 50 metres away.

Wet Weather Plans: I live very close to the Botanical Gardens, so we'll have the party at my place. Getting there: As per the map, its a 20 min walk from Town Hall. Or 10 Minutes from St James Station.

If you have any questions, please contact me

Cheers, Bob

ps: If you have any allergies, please comment on the page and let people know. Usually people make a variety of dishes including gluten free.
name: Taste a Plant based Picnic for our Health & Harmony @ Botanical Gardens

description:
Happy early Easter! Join Leia and her family for an EGG-cellent Easter themed family Stroller Strides class! Bring your whole family and get your body moving before the chocolate bunnies come hopping along. 

About Stroller Strides:

Stroller Strides® is a total fitness program that moms can do with their babies. It includes power walking and intervals of strength and body toning exercises using exercise tubing, the stroller and the environment. Taught by certified and specially trained fitness instructors, it is a great workout for any level of exerciser. Stroller Strides instructors weave songs and activities into the routine designed to entertain and engage baby, while moms are led through a series of exercises specific to her role as mom.

This unique program also provides moms with the opportunity to meet other moms, engage in playgroups with their babies, and to form lasting friendships. Stroller Strides is designed to give mothers the "Strength for Motherhood!"

Your First class is always FREE!! Register online at www.strollerstrides.net/millcreek.   Great class for working mothers and also to bring the husbands with you to get fit together!

description:
Welcome to the Free and Fun OC Fitness Bootcamp! We hope that you find this an enjoyable experience. To add to your comfort level, please feel free to ask any questions. We are friendly, inclusive and a melting pot!

Answers to Frequently Asked Questions:

How Much Does Bootcamp Cost?

Bootcamp sessions are FREE - even more reason to make this a regular part of your fitness regime. Donations to cover equipment costs/maintenance are always welcome!

What Should I bring?

There are no storage facilities in the park so you should come in workout clothes that you are fine with getting a little dirty. Water bottles are recommended, but keep in mind that you will have to carry everything with you as we run/move around the park.

How Fit Do I need to be? 

You should be at least average fitness.  As a test, you should be able to hold plank position for at least 1 minute, be able to do 20 pushups, and jog at least 1 mile.

What exercises do I do? 

The sessions last for about an hour and include aerobic fitness routines with running, sprints, circuits, weighted exercises, body-weight exercises, and yoga-like stretches.

How Do I Find You?

The address listed above.

How will this benefit me?

Improved core strength, stamina, endurance, being able to deal with life's highs and lows, improved sleep patterns and you will make great workout buddies!

Disclaimer:

Please accept that you are liable for yourselves and are only encouraged to go at your own pace and to rest whenever appropriate.

By RSVPing "Yes" to this event, you understand and agree that you are voluntarily participating in this fitness event at your own risk.  You acknowledge that you are aware of the risks inherent in participating in any physical activities and certify that you are physically fit, have not been otherwise informed by any physician and know of no restrictions imposed on you by any physician that would in any way prevent you from actively participating in this event.

In consideration for OCAP allowing your participating in this fitness event, you, on behalf of yourself, your successors in interest, heirs, assigns, and representatives hereby release and hold harmless the event organizer, successors, etc. of any and all liability claims, damages, actions and causes of action whatsoever on account of any loss, damage or injury to person (including death) or any other loss or inconvenience whatsoever, suffered by you at any time hereafter arising out of your voluntary participation in this fitness event whether resulting from the event organizer's negligence or otherwise collectively (liabilities).

You hereby grant permission to the event organizer to render preventative or first-aid assistance or seek treatment or medical care that seems reasonably necessary, including hospitalization for your health and well-being.

You give the event organizer permission to freely use your name, picture, and voice in any broadcast, telecast, print account, online or any other account in any medium of the fitness event (personal release).  You understand that this personal release is perpetual in time and that it encompasses without limitation any copyright or right of publicity or privacy that you may have in your name, picture and voice.

description:
Recently, our group visited Matheson Lake for a moss identification exercise and several participants expressed that the area was quite scenic.

This outing provides an opportunity to further explore the area by providing a loop outing, which:

> starts along Matheson Lake; 

> connects briefly with the Galloping Goose bike path; 

> uses the Cedar Ridge trail of the adjoining Roche Cove park; 

> reconnects with a small portion of the Goose;

> links to a trail which runs along Matheson Creek; and

> concludes with a hike along the remaining side of Matheson Lake - back to the parking lot.

I estimate that the distance is roughly 10 to 12 kilometres and the duration is about 3 to 4 hours.

Please be advised that despite some recent dry weather, there will be some "mucky" portions together with moderate "ups and downs".

The carpool fee is $4.00.

Mathewson Lake Park:

https://www.crd.bc.ca/docs/default-source/parks-pdf/maps/matheson-lake-regional-park.pdf?sfvrsn=6

Roche Cove Park:

https://www.crd.bc.ca/docs/default-source/parks-pdf/maps/roche-cove-regional-park.pdf?sfvrsn=4

Thank you

description:
Brazillian Night @ Guanabara

Come join London singles in a relaxed, non-pressurized environment.

EVENT INFO:

I have reserved tables/area for us at the luscious Guanabara Brazillian Nightclub (Nearest Tube Holborn). Join us for a night of great company, fabulous drinks and amazing entertainment.

We will be meeting & mingling from 7pm... (You should arrive by 8pm latest for this meet). After a couple of hours mingling/eating (food optional) drinking in our reserved area, we will be hitting the dancefloor for a night of brazillian beats & party entertainment.

If there is one thing that Brazillians do just as well as waxing, football, & coffee, its partying! This event will be lively, noisy and most of all fun! & great for Salsa lovers or fans of latin American music & dancing... or anyone who just wants to have a good time on a Saturday night! This is a very popular nightclub....... So please book early to avoid disappointment.

Ticket £6.00 each: http://www.fatsoma.com/brazillian-night-guanabara/116756

Meetup Price: £6 payable in ADVANCE ONLY.. 

Please note that meetup fee does not include club entry, its free before 8pm, but £10 after 8pm, so if you want to avoid, please arrive before 8pm.

The event is fully hosted between 7pm & 9 pm which means you will be meeted & greeted by myself, introduced to other Singles and encouraged to Mingle. We appreciate that meeting new people can be very nerve-wracking so myself and our members do everything they can to make you feel welcome and relaxed. If anyone is really nervous about attending, please email me in advance of the party. The party will goes on until the early hours so bring your dancing shoes! 

"The name Guanabara comes from the Tupi-Guarani language name for the famous bay in Rio de Janeiro, the gateway to Brazil and a home of blazing extremes. A cultural mix that embraces the playground of Copacabana beach, where the sidewalks are patterned swells of black and white marble, to the hillside favela rising behind; from famous Ipanema beach and its high rise apartments to the Sugar Loaf and Jurujuba beach. Guanabara is the environment where all come to eat, drink and play" 

EVENT INFO:

BASIL LIVE PERCUSSION

An uplifting session with our resident percussionist who will start of the night and get you into the right mood and prepare you to embrace the fun of your night ahead.

Rhythms of the City

Samara Reis & Co

DJ D-VYZOR creates a great warm-up atmosphere to the night spinning Brazilian Grooves, Bossa Nova, Samba Rock and some Classic Funk & Soul.

There will also be a live band on later on in the evening, details are not on the website yet but check back at a later date for further info:

HOW TO FIND US:

Nearest tube Holburn. Please ask for our reserved area upon club entry, which will be booked in the name of LONDON SINGLES CLUB. Please research your own way to find the place using Google maps or A-Z. I cannot be held responsible for people not being able to find places.

IMPORTANT INFO:

• Meetup Price: £6 payable in ADVANCE ONLY: Please bring photo ID for proof of age i.e. passport/driving licence for this meet - even if you look over 30/40 if you're lucky you may still be asked for ID, they are very strict on this

• VERY IMPORTANT - If you do not arrive before 8pm there will be a charge of £10 to enter the club. If you arrive after 8pm and there are queues, please go straight to the top as you will be able to queue jump if you say you are on LONDON SINGLES CLUB guest list.

• When you arrive, you should use the Guanabara cloakroom for your coats as at 9pm the chairs are removed. Its a FREE cloakroom for OUR MEETUP MEMBERS + GUESTS but you'll need to quote 'London Singles Club' at the door/cloakroom...

• Guests are welcome, but if you're going to bring a guest, sounds obvious but please make sure they are single! We do not guarantee M to F ratio for this event, but we will try. You can see who has said they are going to attend from the RSVP list. We normally get 75-80% of people who RSVP attending on the night and usually the ladies RSVP first and the gents much later on. 

• Price includes meetup site costs, admin costs, organizers fees, professional hosting and payment processing fees

• Please note that this is a PARTY! This means LOUD MUSIC and noisy busy atmosphere. If you do not like events with a lot of noise or busy, please join us at one of our quieter events!

• Dress code : SMART CASUAL, NO SPORTSWEAR, NO HATS, NO FLIP FLOPS
name: Brazillian Night @ Guanabara

description:
Please read below on how to pay for your ticket, what to bring, and which pickup place you want to be at. There will be more announcements of this event later on, such as time changes and how to get your parking pass at one of the places. One thing to remember, you need to be there on time,  for we are not waiting for anyone! 

Hear ye! Hear ye!

A great time will be had by all!!

The Cubs vs Brewers Tailgating Party is here once again!

The history of this event was started by yours truly over 13 years ago as a combined Parents without Partner Chapters from IL and WI.

During that time we car pooled it there, but it sure was a hassle keeping all the cars together when entering, and making sure everyone was safe to go home afterwards. All in all it was a blast and a great deal of fun was had by all!

Beginning five years ago, we made this trip into a luxury bus with a restroom affair. We had two different pick-up spots...one in Gurnee, and the other at the Brat Stop in Kenosha.

Last year, a few of us got together at three different parking spots. We are going to do this again this year. These are free parking so no worry there.

This is the last stop and the bus will be there at 2:00 PM sharp at Lot D Parking Lot at the Brat Stop in Kenosha. Please be ready to roll. More details about this stop later on.

Either case, please indicate where you will be picked up in the comment section

Ah, the fun we had that year! It was great! It was so great that we all wanted to tailgate more than we wanted to see the game! A few of us watched the game but then again a few of us went bar hopping in the Park. And we sat in the bleacher section by Bernie the Brewer!

This year we have better seats. We are in Section 430,  directly behind the 3rd base side facing the new Brewers High Def Scoreboard that cost $12 mil. Man o man, that screen was absoulutly fantastically sharp!

During the tailgating portion we had a great big picnic and games to play. The group next to us had a DJ and we did the Electric Slide out in the parking lot. The group on the other sides of us had games of dice going on for drinks.

What do you need to bring? A side dish, a lawn chair, your own special beverage, a lite jacket, and a great attitude, with the idea of having a great time.

We may also need a few card tables to bring along too.

The cost for this event includes the ticket to the game, brats, buns, charcoal, plasticwares, papergoods, bus, the driver, the gas, the gas surcharge, and parking.

C'mon and have a great time with us!

This event does sell out year in and year out. Rule#1 is that even if you do RSVP, it doesn't guarantee you a spot until I receive a payment, than your spot is guaranteed. I received a lot of hassle last year due to members reserving but not making a payment. Just want to clarify this.

Please note: To pay by check, it would be $65 to be mailed to Brian Kjos, 1410 Cimmaron Ct, Johnsburg IL 60051. 

Cancellation: You may cancel out on this event up to July 15th. You will get your full refund back. If you cancel after July 15th, all tickets needs to be sold first, and then if a replacement is found, you will receive your full refund.

33 out of 50 are Going: Yours Truly and 4 Guest, Mary and Ed Castelli, Ray, Heather M., Jerry F., Teresa S., Larry W., Diane S, Kim Carlysle (too many Kim C that are in the group), Kevin, Ruth and her 2 guests, Jean S., Patti D, Robyn L., Jen P., Doris C., Frank and Jayne, Mick and Terri, Kim Clauser, Jean C., Marie N., Beth R, Diane F., and John R and Janice L.

Durty Nellies Stop: Yours Truly, Mary & Ed Castelli, Heather M, Jerry F., Larry W., Patti D, Robyn L., Doris C., Frank and Jayne, Beth R., and John R and Janice L.

Gurnee Mills: Ray, Teresa S., Diane S, Kim Carlysle, Ruth and her 2 guests, and Jean S., Jen P., Mick and Terri, Kim Clauser, and Jean C.

Brat Stop: Kevin, Marie N, and Diane F.

I hope you can make it!

Brian
name: CUBS VS BREWERS TAILGATING PARTY! IT'S BACK! AND MORE FUN THAN EVER!

description:
What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)  We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT
name: 90+ Pt Sonoma Patio Wine Party: Louis Foppiano@Warwick-Pl­­ayboy Twist!

description:
Cerler is looking fantastic after all the snow that has been falling lately! Cerler, for snow connaisseurs is allegedly the best ski resort in the area. : High altitude (2.600 m), lack of crowds on the lifts and a very nicely designed ski domain :) The hotel is definitely classy, cozy and charming and the views from the room windows are prrrrretty!

• Very nice hotel accomodation (see details below) + breakfast included 

• Gear rental discounts (on demand)

• Ski/Snowboard lesson discounts (on demand)

• Cute old town with a handful of nice restaurants and bars for apreski dinner and drinks

THE SKI DOMAIN

Cerler is the highest ski resort in the Spanish Pyrenees and it's surrounded by peaks of more than 3.000 m, in the heart of the Benasque Valley.

Countless international ski awards, including the World Travel Awards, make Cerler one of the top 3 resorts on Spain, by those on the loop. It's varied, innovative, not crowded, VERY beautiful both on the slopes and in town, with a great customer service and modern lifts, . 

You will ski in runs between trees, explore an immense backcountry territory, go crazy on the snowpark or learn your first gliding moves on the beginners area. Theres enough to keep you busy for two days, and you still would need another weekend to actually feel satisfied!

Specs

Max altitude 2.630 m

Three valleys

79 km

68 runs

Endless backcountry slopes

Snowpark and boarder cross

THE RESORT

The town of Cerler is as picturesque as can get, an old pyrenean genuine town from the XVII centry. You won't have enough memory on your phone to capture its beauty. 

Although it's not party town. At the bottom of the slopes there's is Remáscaro (live outdoor apreski on Saturday) and in town, La Borda del Mastín has a downstairs bar underneath the restaurant that stays open till 3 am for drinks! 

THE LODGING 

We'll be staying in the nice looking HG Cerler Hotel in double shared rooms with breakfast included. 

We'll be right next to the town and about a 10 minute walk to the slopes. But, to make it even more convenient, there's a hotel private shuttle only for clients, that runs to and from the lifts. SWEET!  

The hotel is made of stone and wood, it has excellent views of the Benasque Valley, the rooms are new and with that cozy mountain touch and the whole building blends with the landscape and the typical Pyrenean traditional architecture. 

There's a restaurant, a bar with a fireplace, a terrace, a games room, free wifi in public areas, a “miniclub” for children and the best feature.... the free private transport to the slopes!

It also has a great SPA, HG Wellness Center, with awesome views of the mountain and all sorts of tratments and massages.

THE EXTRAS

If you wish to rent skis/snowboarding gear or take lessons only with your Sporty People mates, the prices are  good too (Check below)

HOW TO GET THERE

We'll organize the trip on shared cars. 

If we're more that 15 people, and everyone wishes to use it, we'll have a private bus for 100€/person. 

PRICE 

170€ - with your own equipment  (190€ - with rental equipment)

• 2 nights Lodging 

• 2 day breakfast 

• 2 day ski pass 

• 2 days ski insurance 

• 2 days rental equipment (if you wish)

OPTIONAL

Lessons ski/snowboard (6h/ 3 days) 70€ (minimum 4 people on the group)
name: SKI WEEKEND Mar 13-15 - Cerler -  Late season offer

description:
We're taking a break from our Mission Series; just like visiting all the California missions in one vacation is "too much," we'll look at other aspects of our state for a while.


Before Haight Ashbury and the hippies, Jack Kerouac, Allen Ginsberg, Neal and Carolyn Cassady and others were main figures among the Beat culture.  Though they spent time in New York and traveled a lot, they spent a lot of time in San Francisco.   Lawrence Ferlinghetti's "City Lights" bookstore reflects their influence and a Beat Museum is on Broadway in San Francisco.

We'll watch some of the following films:

Jack Kerouac  King of the Beats

New York in the 50s

Big Sur stream on Netflix

Amazon:  Howl

Destroy all Rational Thought

What Happened to Jack Kerouac 


PLEASE REMEMBER THAT MOVIE NIGHTS ARE OPEN ONLY TO MEMBERS WE HAVE MET BEFORE.

The dogs participating in our program have gentle dispositions but may not have received any special training. Therefore, guardians accompanying children or disabled adults are especially encouraged to seek advice from the pet owner before touching an animal. Read more...

Please note that all participants in this walk will be asked to sign a waiver releasing Vancouver Ecovillage from any responsibility in case of injury during this walk for any reason. This includes tripping and falling, dog bites, scratches, or other unforseen injuries.

What to wear: fully covered comfortable shoes like sneakers or trekking boots. Don't wear your Sunday Best because the dogs WILL dirty your clothes!

Our dogs are excited about meeting you and so are we!
name: Dog Walk in Stanley Park

description:
We are doing this in Webinar format 

Why meet your ancestors?  Many of us have taken guided journeys to meet Reiki Guides and other spiritual guides.  But one of your most powerful guides is quietly replicating and influencing your every breath - your DNA, handed down to you through a thousand lifetimes of ancestors.  Their triumphs and tragedies, through the wonders of epigenetics, have left echoes on the molecules of your own body.  You can access their wisdom through the energy of Reiki, listen to their counsel and benefit from their guidance.

In this special  event, you will take an abbreviated journey and have the opportunity to reflect energetically, emotionally and analytically on the experiences.  

This Meetup is free.  The full-featured webinar is scheduled for April 8th, for 2.5 hours, when we will do two full journeys, exploring biological and intuitive/spiritual ancestry.  Come enjoy the April 1st Meetup!  There will be a recorded version to enjoy if you can't make the 9:30 AM live event.

http://webinarjam.net/webinar/go/13472/a6bdb83893

What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)  We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT
name: 90+ Pt Sonoma Patio Wine Party: Louis Foppiano@Warwick-Pl­­ayboy Twist!

With nearly two decades of performances as a New Orleans artist under his belt, Tom assembled his own band of his closest musician friends. With the independent release of Spinnin’ My Wheels, Tom launched his blues & roots rock band to perform original songs. The self-produced album, released independently on CD and iTunes in 2013, features 10 original songs with influences from rock, blues and outlaw country, becoming core material for regular live performances by the Tom Leggett Band.

description:
Event details are subject to change. Watch this space for updated details.

Admission is AED 20.

Discussion Topic: Stock Photography (Samar Al Khudhairi)
This week, we will be joined by content edited Samar Al Khudhairi of Shutterstock, who will tell us about how to shoot stock. Samar will go into detail about specific types of content that people in the region are looking for. She will also explain how to sign up to become a Shutterstock contributor and how to submit images.

Samar will be sticking around after her presentation to help members sign up. If you'd like to make money with your photos, bring along a laptop with several photos (this link may be helpful in helping you choose) and a scanned passport copy, so that she can guide you through the submission process.


Member showcase (TBA)
At each biweekly, members show us about a dozen of their best shots, and answer questions about them. Want to try this yourself in the future? Talk to an organizer.

The Tuesday tip (Ashraf Jandali)
Want to improve your work using post-processing tools like Lightroom and Photoshop? Ashraf will tell you what you need to know.

Photo Competition (Theme: Catchlight)

Our sponsors FUJIFILM are giving away a camera to whoever submits the best photograph for our competition theme. Taking part is easy:

- You can submit up to two photos. Please rename the files so that they have your name in them, e.g. Ahmed1.JPG and Ahmed2.JPG.

- Email your shots to [masked] by 5 PM on the day of the event. Alternatively, bring them along on a USB thumb drive.

- Everyone votes on the photos during the event, and the photo with the most vote wins! Please note that if you are not around for the voting, you are not eligible to win.

We hope to see all of you soon - don't be shy about bringing your friends along. And join the conversation on Facebook and Twitter.

Venue
We will be meeting in Studio Attitude in Al Quoz, in the same series of warehouses as Botanica. The GPS coordinates  are[masked], 55.2301798251. Our location map includes landmarks. YouTube videos can show you the way down Sheikh Zayed Road from the direction of the World Trade Centre and Dubai Mall as well as from the direction of Abu Dhabi, the marina, and Al Barsha. More information on the venue can be found on the Studio Attitude website or at 04 3384114.

If you are really lost, you can also reach the EPyC hotline on[masked], but remember, we may not be able to answer your calls while the event is underway.
name: Taking Stock (EPyC Biweekly meetup sponsored by FujiFilm)

WHAT:Lets  Go  to Eltham  market   along the Yarra and Diamond Creek trails for brunch . The market closes 12:30pm  hence an Earlier start. This ride should suit everyone see below 

BIKES: Road (would not recommend as there is long sections of gravel to ride on), Hybrid , if you come on MTB there is load of single track also                

MEET: Clifton hill station @ 9:30 take either the 9:09 (arrive 9:28) or 9:19 (arrive 9:38)  train platform one Flinders station   can use south morang or hustbridge lines

MEET: Eltham Station 11:15 From Flinders st platform 1 take 10:19 am train Hurstbridge Line

please check the public transport website (timetable/disruptions) a couple of days before

eltham station is only about 800m from the market

http://ridewithgps.com/routes/7059908 

More info on Eltham market  http://www.elthammarket.com.au/location/

Grade: Easy to Moderate (lots of hard packed gravel sections) 

Distance: 25 or 50km return (from market two choices can jump on train or ride back) (looking at averaging 10 to 20 km/h)

What To Bring: ,Your self, some friends ,2 full Water bottles , Spare Tube (best to bring two as not very close to train stations) Patch kit ,tools pump  etc oh and a sense of Adventure also:)  also a snack in case.

Before Ride. please check pressure in tyres (should be inflated to within recommended pressure which can be found on side wall of tyre)  and check for wear on the tread
name: Cycle to Eltham market 25-50km

description:
In this lecture, University of California, Irvine professor Bruce Blumberg discusses the role his work has played in revealing that the causes of obesity extend far beyond the implications of diet and exercise, demonstrating that chemical exposure in diet and environment play a far more significant role than previously thought. When: Tuesday, May 5, 2015; 6:30 p.m.
Where: Kane Hall
Room 130
UW Campus
Cost: Free, but advance registration is required.

Register at: http://engage.washington.edu/site/Calendar/1024295584?view=RSVP&id=123144

more information: http://engage.washington.edu/site/Calendar/1024295584?view=RSVP&id=123144

Location and Directions
Kane Hall is located on the north side of Red Square on the UW Seattle campus. View a map showing the location. Paid parking is available in the Central Plaza Garage below Kane Hall at $10; additional paid parking is available in several west campus lots (W6, W12, W14) for $5 (cash only at automated pay stations).

Driving Directions: From I-5, take the NE 45th Street exit (#169). Turn east onto NE 45th Street. Continue east about one quarter mile to 15th Avenue NE and turn right. Head south on 15th Avenue three blocks to NE 41st Street. Turn left at Gate #1 into the Central Plaza Garage. Stop at the gatehouse inside the garage for directions and a parking permit.

Transit Information: There are more than 60 bus routes from all over King and Snohomish counties serving the University District. For more information on taking a bus to the UW, visit the regional online trip planner provided by King County Metro.
name: Weight & Wellness Lecture Series:Obesogens:Chemical Exposure May Cause Obesity

description:
An exploration of the unique things each of us have to offer, and who we are when 'at our best'. Adopting a strengths-based focus at work helps build
capacity, confidence and helps us to more readily recognise opportunity.

Arrive from 5.30pm to collect your participant pack and join us in the cafe to socialise over tea and biscuits. 


IN THIS SESSION WE WILL:

i) start with a ten minute mindful focussing exercise (for more details see the 'About Us' section).

ii) dip into the significant body of research in understanding how personal strengths and character strengths play a role our wellbeing, resilience and performance.   

iii) learn and practice the simple technique of 'strength spotting' in understanding our own strengths as well as a tool in coaching colleagues and team members. 


PAYMENT DETAILS 

This workshop costs $25, please pay in advance so I can prepare your participant pack.

I also offer the following discounts  (please contact me): 
- FREE introductory session - if you haven't been to a Brain-Train Tuesday before, you are very welcome to join us for a complementary taster session, just sign up and let me know you're coming along.
- Become a subscriber - set up an easy monthly $20 automatic payment. 
- Complementary professions - If you work in one of the following I'm also happy to offer a 10% discount: creative professions, HR and Change Management professionals, Psychologists.

If you'd like to take advantage of the above just send me a message.
name: Making personal strengths matter

group.name: Brain Train Tuesdays: blast stress & get inspired at work

description:
Our quiz evening for March is Movie Trivia. The question could be a famous quote, or a famous object from the movie, or a famous scene etc. The questions will cover movies from 1970 to the present day. So how well do you know your movies?

Start Time

We start gathering at 7:00 PM to mingle and chit chat and get to know some of the other members in a casual setting and so that we can get a drink and a bite to eat. The trivia starts a short time later.

Question Format

You will be assigned to a team of 4 or 5 people and your team will attempt to guess the answer. You write down your answers as a team on the answer sheets. Please don't worry that you will be put in an embarrassing position -- you are never asked a question directly. The intent of this evening is just to provide some fun and amusement and not to create stress.

As usual, there will be two rounds of questions. The teams are mixed up between rounds so that you get to meet a whole new group of people during the second round. At the end of the evening, the people with the highest scores will get a prize.

Venue

Our venue for this quiz is the St. Louis Bar & Grill on Mississauga Rd at the intersection with Erin Mills Parkway, just south of Hwy 401.

The restaurant has a nice special for Wednesdays. Angus burger & fries for $5 with the purchase of a beverage. Please note there are no substitutions on this special!

Joining us for the first time?

Our game evenings are a perfect event for new members so if you have never been out to one of our events before, this would be a good evening to come out for the first time.

I hope you will make it out to this fun evening and I look forward to seeing you there!

description:
Join us for an awesome day to discover the township of Montville! We will start the day off by taking a walk thought Kondalilla National Park & than explorer the many unique/divine shops that Montville has to offer.

If you are going to attend this event I recommend that you do the following;

• Follow the comments to this event!

• Organize your own Transportation!

If anyone is willing to help out with transport, then please feel free to offer lifts in the comments below. If anyone needs a lift please feel free to ask in the comments below as well

Montville is a small town in the Sunshine Coast hinterland, on the Blackall Range in Queensland, Australia, around 400 metres above sea level. At the 2011 census, Montville and the surrounding area had a population of 886.

The Main Street Montville is home to over 100 boutique retail outlets, many housed in historic and unique buildings. Popular attractions include galleries, restaurants, wineries, cheese factories and craft and clothing shops. Find Out More…

Early settlement: The first white settlers arrived in the area in 1887 and the town was later named by Henry Smith. Read More…

Kondalilla Falls: The Picnic Creek circuit down the escarpment, past rock pools and a lookout with views of Kondalilla Falls. Walk through rainforest to the base of the waterfall and continue back up the ridge. Look for emergent bunya pines with their distinctive symmetrical dome shapes, dense stands of pica been palms and intriguing shapes of pink ash. What goes down must come back up! There are over 100 stair steps on the Kondalilla Falls circuit so you need to be reasonably fit. Find Out More…



http://youtu.be/PU2wtCCCR4w
name: Montville **Day Trip**

Workshop is HandsOn

Equipment fee(Can get it yourself): 3500 Rs(RaspberryPi+Power supply+Ethernet wire(3m)+SDcard+Breadboard+LED(7)+resistors(1k )(7)+button+breadboard wires)
Transfer money via NEFT or IMPS or deposit money or pay directly[masked]) and mail the screenshot of your transfer or mail the receipt of account deposit

Kotak Mahindra bank(indiranagar)
Acc no:[masked]
IFSC code:KKBK[masked]
*********^^^^Workshop content^^^^*********
Session 1
1. Getting started with basics
1.1- Introduction to Internet of Things (IoT)
1.2 - Why IoT? How IoT is changing the world
Session 2
2. TheRaspberry Pi
2.1-Why Raspberry Pi Board for IoT
2.2-Interfacing the Internet via RJ45
2.3-Accessing the Pi
2.4-Few commands on Linux
Session 3
3. A bit of python and GPIOS
3.1-GPIO
3.2-GPIOs in Python
3.3-Interfacing an LED
Session 4
4. Arduino
4.1-Introduction to Arduino
4.2-Connecting RaspberryPi with Arduino
4.3-Sending serial commands to Arduino
4.4-Blinking an led with Arduino
Session 5
5. Webserver
5.1-Creating a webserver with pi
5.2-Setting a dynamic dns to pi
5.3-Accessing pi over internet
5.4-Blinking led over internet
5.5-Connecting relays to pi and automating the home
6. Android
6.1-Installing MIT app inventor
6.2-Creating a simple android app.
6.3-Looking forward :P

description:
I have developed a group training class using the energy of the pack to teach our dogs to be obedient in all sorts of situations including the sidewalk cafe, busy sidewalks, parks or hikes.

Whether you are just looking for an opportunity to improve your relations and control of your dog, raise a well balanced canine or pass the AKC Good Citizen Test, learn advanced obedience, you and your pup will be transformed by this clinic. 

This course combines the spirit of the AKC Canine Good Citizen certification and the power of the PACK.  Dogs need to belong to a pack and need a pack leader.  You will be amazed how quickly your dogs will learn from this approach when we harness the energy of pack leadership and other dogs in the pack clinic. 

During class, we work on beginner and advanced obedience.  We will also address mild aggressive or behavioral issues using the power of the Pack.  (This is not for doggies with high aggressive behavior.  I offer private sessions to address high aggression to enable you and your dog to participate in group classes.)

This clinic is cross posted and promoted on my different social media sites.  Don't worry if you don't see a lot of RSVPS.  This class always draws a nice pack of fun, friendly people and their pups.

Come if you want to become CGC Certified, just want your communication and control of your canine to improve or want to brush up on your skills along side other like minded friends.

I will be offering on going CGC testing which I will make available to you.

Cost $15 payable by cash or check, $50 for 4 classes (Save $10 bucks) or buy a yearly membership for $300 and attend any class offered by LGBT Greater LA Doggie Social Club. 

Bring water for you and your dog. There are no prerequisites necessary for this class. You and your dog will have fun, socialize and learn lots!

Please arrive a little before the class so that you and your dog have a little time to get acclimated.

I look forward to seeing you and your dog! Please call[masked] if you have any questions.

PLEASE WEAR COMFORTABLE CLOTHES AND ATHLETIC SHOES AS WE TYPICALLY WALK ABOUT ON UNEVEN GROUND.  :)
name: Group obedience class - canine good citizen training

description:
This is the picture we hv rooftop Yoga last Sat. Hope to see you soon. 

Rooftop Yoga

Date: 14/3 (Sat)



Time: 15:15 - 17:30



Place to meet: Causeway Bay station(Exit D1)



Fee: Donation (for continual supports on our traditional yoga)

Yogis, do you want to relax your body and synchronize your mind with friends after work?

Rooftop Yoga is the place you go. We believe that Yoga is a good life style. On Sat, we will let our work go. We will meet at Sogo around 15:15 and walk to our 5th -floor-rooftop.

We begin on "sukshma vyayama" , the 'subtle exercises'. It can develop our awareness of the body's movement. Then, we will practise Asanas with Pranayama, breath control, at the same time. Shavasana will be crusal to be an end so as to relax the whole psycho -physiological system.

We would love to meet new Yogis friends and share the wisdoms of yoga in the daily life.

Please note:



*please bring your mat/ big towel, and water



* no toilets or changing rooms provided



* please meet on time



* if rains, we will go to Victoria Peak (Lauging Corner) instead

Please come with your family members and  friends. Let's share the happy time after work !

Place to meet,cu there on 15:15pm

JoYoga ~ Joy and Peace

description:
Docker in Production: Reality, Not Hype

DramaFever has been running Docker in production since about October 2013 (well before it even went 1.0). Bridget will give an overview of how they use Docker to make development more consistent and deployment more repeatable. 

Bridget Kromhout is an operations engineer at DramaFever, the largest streaming video site for international content. Her CS degree emphasis was in theory, but she now deals with the concrete (if ‘cloud’ can be considered tangible). She co-hosts the Arrested DevOps podcast, helps wrangle speakers for the Twin Cities DevOps and AWS meetups, and co-organizes devopsdays Minneapolis.


Agenda

5:30-6:00: Networking/Food/Drink

6:00-7:00: Bridget Kromhout
name: Bridget Kromhout: Docker in Production - Reality, Not Hype

description:
This FREE talk is for any WOMAN who is dating. Seasoned pros, and novice alike, this event will change the way you date... it's the best thing you can do for yourself this year... BRING YOUR FRIENDS!!!!

If 2015 is the year to to 'Get the Guy' and get a ring, either on the phone or the finger you're going to love this event!

So why am I so keen to invite you?

Like many, many others, I applied Matthew Hussy's techniques and they helped me land the man of my dreams.

I value his input so much, that I wanted to help others discover the secrets to finding, and getting your dream man to obsess over you, instead of the other way around.

What should I expect?   It's funny, witty and sooooo insightful; basically, it's an intellectual comedy show equivalent to an instructional manual for men!!

NOTE: this Meetup is for ladies only. 

Cost? FREE!!! Tickets are normally £29, but because I’m part of the family (and soon you will be too) they’re letting my MEETUP MEMBERS ATTEND FOR FREE!

HOW COOL IS THAT?

How do I get a free ticket? Just RSVP for this event, here on meetup, and your name will go onto the guest list as my guest. 

You may already 'think you know' But trust me, you will learn more about yourself and what's going wrong with your dates. 

With just a few simple ideas and tweaks you can finally have the love life you want.

Here’s what you’ll learn at the talk:

•  How to take control of your love life - women CAN take the driving seat

• Simple techniques to get the guy you like to notice you

• Myths on dating

• Why you should NEVER settle for anything

• How to make things happen when you meet a guy you like

GetTheGuy is the world’s leading authority on attraction. They've studied over 10,000 men, and analysed over 5,000 dates, all to bring you the truth about how men really think and how you can attract the best among them. 50,000 women worldwide have attended the GetTheGuy events to hear these insights. 

You'll get the answers to some of the questions women are dying to ask, and that men won’t answer

http://player.vimeo.com/video/61460593



Here's some of the feedback from the ladies who came last time: 

‘Absolutely brilliant, loved it!! ‘Teresa 

‘I got there very sceptical about what a guy could teach me concretely about my love life...but for 4 hours and a half I didn’t even unfocus my attention from all they he said. His talk is smart, practical, full of very helpful insights, probably golden-value to most women. I can’t wait to apply all that I’ve learnt from him! If 2015 is the year to to 'Get the Guy' and get a ring, either on the phone or the finger you're going to love this event!

So why am I so keen to invite you?

Like many, many others, I applied Matthew Hussy's techniques and they helped me land the man of my dreams.

I value his input so much, that I wanted to help others discover the secrets to finding, and getting your dream man to obsess over you, instead of the other way around.

What should I expect?   It's funny, witty and sooooo insightful; basically, it's an intellectual comedy show equivalent to an instructional manual for men!!

NOTE: this Meetup is for ladies only. 

Cost? FREE!!! Tickets are normally £29, but because I’m part of the family (and soon you will be too) they’re letting my MEETUP MEMBERS ATTEND FOR FREE!

HOW COOL IS THAT?

How do I get a free ticket? Just RSVP for this event, here on meetup, and your name will go onto the guest list as my guest.

You'll get the answers to some of the questions women are dying to ask, and that men won’t answer

Here's some of the feedback from the ladies who came last time:

If we find this ideal to be an event for all then we will open one for future. For now, we want two fun hikers who can join in the fun.

Proposed Itinerary for hikes: (subject to change and not in any specific order)

Day 1: Drive to Death Valley

Day 2: Funeral Mountain 1800' climb, 10 miles.

Day 3: Mosaic Canyon 1800', 5 miles.

Day 4: Dante's view, Telescope Peak at 11,049 ft, 1000' climb

Day 5: Titus Canyon - descend 5,000' - Thimble Peak at 6,381 '

Day 6: Open or return.

We have checked lodging and they are going fassssttttt! This is spring break. So contact me for additional details by Wednesday, Jan 28th.


Hurry, we are waiting for you!!!!!!!!!!!

description:
A not-to-be-missed evening of colourful Armenian music, featuring brilliant Armenian guest artists. The programme includes a new suite from Oscar-winning Canadian composer Mychael Danna’s score for Atom Egoyan’s film Ararat, and a collection of exquisite songs by composer Gomidas, arranged by Serouj Kradjian.

We will be attending this concert in partnership with our sister group, the TSG Toronto Social Group.

Performers

• Peter Oundjian, conductor

• Isabel Bayrakdarian, soprano

• Sergey Khachatryan, violin

• Serouj Kradjian, piano 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mUiZomzTs-Q

Click on the video above to get an idea of a typical performance. 

Our Seats 

As usual, we have reserved seats in the balcony in section R8 & L8. Every seat at the Roy Thompson Hall is a good seat. We are especially close to the orchestra stage sitting above it. 

Price

Our special group discounted ticket price is $40.50 ea. All taxes and ticket/box office fees are included. 

Payment

Payment is required when you RSVP. Please note that payment is required to reserve a ticket for you. Payment can be made with all major credit cards or Paypal. A Paypal account is not required. If you wish to use an alternate payment method, I can also accept cash or email money transfer. Please contact me for further details. 

Ticket Pickup & Meeting Point 

I will be standing next to the box office window from 7:30 to 7:55 PM, wearing a large yellow name tag with my name on it. At 7:55 PM, I will go inside and get seated. If you arrive after 7:55 PM, please identify yourself to the staff at the customer service desk and they will give you your ticket.

description:
IImagine if you could design your relationships exactly the way you wanted.

…It probably wouldn’t make them any easier, but you would certainly learn what you’re made of.

Here at OneTaste Santa Cruz we approach relationship like an extreme sport. The most exalted form of research in to who we really are. A crucible for awakening in which you play for each others freedom and always aim for a state of flow – the state in which we feel best, perform best, manifest what we desire and deep connection is alway available.

In this 4-week class series, join OneTaste Santa Cruz instructors and masters of relationship for a deep experience of what it means to be in relationship and how people can design their relationships to foster the deepest connection, the hottest sex, and the most exhilarating sense of play.

Learn How To:
-Design the hottest r

elationship based on feeling rather than formula
-Speak your truths & desires, no matter how taboo
-Set up mini research projects to explore new facets of relating
-Go into your aversions and discover turn on
-Deconstruct overt and covert agreements in every relationship
-Get the sex you want, whether in open or monogamous relationship This course is open to men and women (couples and singles). If you attend this class single, you will choose another member of the class for the relationship research component.

The course will include weekly in person classes with lecture, dialog and exercises. Experiential homework of relationship exploration. And online community for ongoing discussion and sharing. 4 week series (3/26, 4/2, 4/9, 4/16)
Thursdays, 8-9:30pm
Tuition: $295/person
Contact Bez at (831)[masked] or Register here online
name: RxD: Relationship By Design

description:
“ ‘MISSING. Karla Richter, 24. Was last seen before she left for the supermarket. Four days ago.’

Pizza night. Karla runs to the shop, and doesn't come home. Three friends begin a desperate search that takes them into the darkness of their past, where every trace of the missing girl tests their loyalties, loves and lies.

This exhilarating new play is a poetic thriller, a touching love story, and a powerful drama about exile, friendship and loss. Maria Milisavljevic won the prestigious German Kleist Award for Young Dramatists in 2013 for Abyss. This is its UK première.

‘An emotionally powerful thriller that rustles and whispers about loss’ – Der Spiegel” – from the Arcola website

Please book your own seat direct with the theatre. Seating is unallocated. I’ve placed a limit of 16 attendees on this event, to keep numbers manageable. Because of the limit, it’s essential that the people who RSVP do come – otherwise they’re excluding people who would have come.

For that reason, don’t RSVP until you’ve bought a ticket (after first checking that this Meetup event isn’t already fully subscribed) and you’re certain you will be coming. You will need to make a note in your RSVP with your order number. If you forget to do that at the time, you will need add the missing details by re-RSVPing and entering them as soon as possible. If you don’t let me know, I’ll assume that you haven’t bought a ticket and aren’t yet sure if you’ll attend, and I will remove you from the RSVP list.

The performance is about 2 hours and 30 minutes long, with an interval. We will stay on to have drinks in the theatre cafe-bar after the performance. This event is for people who will be staying for drinks afterward. If you won’t be joining drinks, please don’t RSVP. Please contribute £1 on arrival (to help defray the approx. £120 per annum that Meetup charges to run a group) – thanks in advance.

In the days immediately prior, I’ll circulate details of arrangements to meet before the performance.
name: Abyss – at the Arcola Theatre

description:
Join us for our very first GFN meetup event. This is open to anyone who wants to connect with other Filipinos in the Bay Area.  This kick-off event will be in the  East Bay and our venue  sponsor is the Adobo Connection USA in Union City. 

New in the US? This will be a great way for you to find your new friends as you establish your new life in your new adopted land. 

Wanted to practice your Filipino language? Absolutely the place where you can start practicing your Tagalog.

Looking for a place to network?  Well come on down and join us, as we continue to build the Pinoy community.

For more information about some of the other events we have other than the meetup groups, you can visit http://events.globalfilipinonetwork.org.

Thank you and looking forward to see you at the event.

description:
UW Professor Ellen Schur expands on her extensive body of work, including her research on the brain’s regulation of appetite funded by the National Institutes of Health and the American Diabetes Association, bringing clarity and understanding to the perennial question that pervades so many parts of our health, self-image and culture: why is it so hard to lose weight?

When: Wednesday, May 13, 2015; 6:30 p.m.
Where: Kane Hall
Room 130
UW Campus
Cost: Free, but advance registration is required.

Register at http://engage.washington.edu/site/Calendar/173739369?view=RSVP&id=123145

more information http://engage.washington.edu/site/Calendar?id=123145&view=Detail

Location and Directions
Kane Hall is located on the north side of Red Square on the UW Seattle campus. View a map showing the location. Paid parking is available in the Central Plaza Garage below Kane Hall at $10; additional paid parking is available in several west campus lots (W6, W12, W14) for $5 (cash only at automated pay stations).

Driving Directions: From I-5, take the NE 45th Street exit (#169). Turn east onto NE 45th Street. Continue east about one quarter mile to 15th Avenue NE and turn right. Head south on 15th Avenue three blocks to NE 41st Street. Turn left at Gate #1 into the Central Plaza Garage. Stop at the gatehouse inside the garage for directions and a parking permit.

Transit Information: There are more than 60 bus routes from all over King and Snohomish counties serving the University District. For more information on taking a bus to the UW, visit the regional online trip planner provided by King County Metro.
name: Weight & Wellness Lecture Series: Why Is It So Hard to Lose Weight?

If you appreciate art, this is a good opportunity to relax and chill with the locals. description:
“I have drunk and seen the spider.”  As winter sets in, The Tavern is proud to bring this rarely produced play to stage. Watch as a man’s unfounded jealousy loses him his wife, children, and best friend. Yet, in this mellowest and least cynical of the mature Shakespearean masterpieces, love, Arcadian innocence, and magic are triumphant in the end.

Meet me in the lobby a little after 6. Doors open/seating/dining begins at 6:15. I will go in then to get us a good spot. We hope to be in our regular box seats. Check in at the box office to pick up your ticket under CRAP and your name as it appears on the Meetup site.  I have red hair and lots of freckles...you can't miss me.  Tell the hostess you are sitting with us when you enter the theater (they know my name and "CRAP Meetup").

The New American Shakespeare Tavern is unlike other theaters. It is a place out of time; a place of live music, hand-crafted period costumes, outrageous sword fights with the entire experience centered on the passion and poetry of the spoken word. With an authentic British Pub Menu and a broad selection of Irish ales, premium brews, and liquor, the Shakespeare Tavern is a place to eat, drink, and nourish the soul.

You will need to pay for your own dinner if you will be dining at the Tavern with is.  The show begins at 7:30  Please contact me if you are running late or can't make it. Sometimes I can find someone to use your ticket with advanced notice.

PARKING: There is a parking deck across Peachtree Street from the tavern for Emory Crawford Long Hospital.  It is only $4 with your ticket stub!  It's safer than some of the surrounding surface lots and they take credit cards.
name: The Winter's Tale at The Shakespeare Tavern

description:
“In the opulent grandeur of a European city, a renowned singer abandons the opera house for the truth of the streets. A gorgeous prostitute. A tough-talking taxi driver. A global trader. A teenage dreamer. Everyone’s looking for something.

Simon Stephens’ strange and beautiful new play reimagines Bizet’s opera Carmen and the possibility of love in a fractured urban world.

Directed by Michael Longhurst (Constellations), the UK première of this play marks the Almeida debut of internationally-renowned writer Simon Stephens (The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time, Birdland).” – from the Almeida website

“One of the most important and exciting British playwrights working today” – Karen Fricker, Variety

We will stay on to have drinks in the theatre cafe-bar after the performance.

Please book your own seat direct with the theatre. Also, if you’re open to sitting next to another member, feel free to mention your seat number (and whether stalls or circle) in the comments below, for group members who may want to book a neighbouring seat. My seat is stalls G19.

This event is for people who will be staying for drinks afterward, because this is about meeting people. If you won’t be joining drinks, or if you only have time to stop briefly, please don’t RSVP. 

I've placed a limit of 20 attendees on this event, to keep numbers manageable. Because of the limit, it’s important that the people who RSVP do come – otherwise they’re excluding people who would have come. For that reason, don’t RSVP until you’ve bought a ticket (after first checking that this Meetup event isn’t already fully subscribed) and you’re certain you will be coming. You will need to make a note in your RSVP with your seat number. If you forget to do that at the time, you can add the missing details at any time by re-RSVPing and entering them when you do. If you don’t let me know, I’ll assume that you haven’t bought a ticket and aren’t yet sure if you’ll attend, and I will remove you from the RSVP list.

Please contribute £1 on arrival (to help defray the approx. £120 per annum that Meetup charges to run a group) – thanks in advance.

In the days immediately prior, I’ll circulate details of arrangements to meet before the performance.

description:
Hi, I am sorry but I have to cancel this meet up, unless members want to go without me and do there own group ride. Crashed my bike on my very steep driveway yesterday (March 6th). I am not sure how much it is going to cost me to get it fixed and I am on a very limited income. Thankfully I am just very sore and cracked my helmet. Heidi has seen my driveway, we won't even park the cars on it be cause it is so steep. Must have hit a rock because i have to go full speed to climb the hill and slam on brakes when I get in. Veered to the left and stopped before I went through closed garage doors. Hurt my ego for sure and still in learning mode which is driving me crazy as this bike is so much heavier and stronger than my good old University bike. Sorry about this. we can get together after Easter Weekend. 

Please try and promote the group. We seem to have a really great base of 5 of us and I really enjoy their philosophy and they are great women. I would really love this to be a success; a place for women riders who can enjoy the ride and not just the speed. 

I am looking into buying a head set for lead and back rider. I would like to get a really good one so if you have any connections let me know. I don't have the cash on me now but if I had an estimate of a great pair, I have no experience with brands so I have to rely on you and your connections to purchase a good one at a reasonable rate.

description:
Hi Everyone, 

I can't set a time and day for this one yet but I know it's coming to the California Theater soon.  It's about rape on college campuses and how the colleges are covering it up.  I think it's an important film.  I'll schedule it when they say they have it.

THE HUNTING GROUND(PG13)1 hrs, 43 minsRELEASE:02/27/2015CAST:Diane RosenfeldDIRECTOR:Kirby Dick

The Hunting Ground takes audiences straight to the heart of a shocking epidemic of violence and institutional cover-ups sweeping college campuses across America. The team behind the Oscar-nominated The Invisible War presents a scorching exposé of the startling prevalence of sexual assault at bastions of higher learning and of the powerful interests that re-victimize vulnerable students while shielding perpetrators. Using vérité footage, expert insights, first-person testimonies and a bombshell interview sure to make headlines, The Hunting Grounddelivers a devastating indictment of campus “rape culture.” Directed by Kirby Dick and produced by Amy Ziering.
name: THE HUNTING GROUND

description:
This meet serves three purpose; to connect with nature feeling the warmth of the rising golden sun while getting healthy exercise and having a great chat all at same time. 

The sun, now a days, rises around 7:10 so 7:00 would be a great time to see its beauty from the start. There are other people already enjoying the walks by this time so we wouldn't be the only early birds out. (Don't forget to set clock ahead one hour tonight)

Our walks will mostly be medium paced of approx 15 minutes per mile at 4mph on flat ground. We'll usually walk 4 miles with the group but individual can do more or less. We'll give 10 min to assemble and then proceed on to encouraging one another to walk. 

We'll tryout different parks or trails each Sunday. Your suggestions will help determine the next week's location.

This is a fitness meet for better health so come regardless of rsvp status. It is kids and pets friendly as long as cared for by you.

description:
What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)  We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT
name: 90+ Pt Sonoma Patio Wine Party with Louis Foppiano@Warwick-Pl­ayboy Twist!

description:
******Please suggest a place for minimum price, It should basically accomodate 30-40 people*******

Workshop is HandsOn
Regestration fee: 1500 Rs
Equipment fee(Can get it yourself): 3500 (Approx) Rs(RaspberryPi+Power supply+Ethernet wire(3m)+SDcard+Breadboard+LED(7)+resistors(1k )(7)+button+breadboard wires)

*********^^^^Workshop content^^^^*********
Session 1
1. Getting started with basics
1.1- Introduction to Internet of Things (IoT)
1.2 - Why IoT? How IoT is changing the world
Session 2
2. TheRaspberry Pi
2.1-Why Raspberry Pi Board for IoT
2.2-Interfacing the Internet via RJ45
2.3-Accessing the Pi
2.4-Few commands on Linux
Session 3
3. A bit of python and GPIOS
3.1-GPIO
3.2-GPIOs in Python
3.3-Interfacing an LED
Session 4
4. Arduino
4.1-Introduction to Arduino
4.2-Connecting RaspberryPi with Arduino
4.3-Sending serial commands to Arduino
4.4-Blinking an led with Arduino
Session 5
5. Webserver
5.1-Creating a webserver with pi
5.2-Setting a dynamic dns to pi
5.3-Accessing pi over internet
5.4-Blinking led over internet
5.5-Connecting relays to pi and automating the home
6. Android
6.1-Installing MIT app inventor
6.2-Creating a simple android app. 

6.3-controlling raspberrypi with android app
6.4-Looking forward :P
name: Getting HandsON with RaspberryPi and IoT

description:
Come and try out a trail run! This is a great loop with 2 distance options: 2.5 or 5 mile route that runs along the Carson River. The terrain is mostly flat. You can choose to do the 5 mile loop or the shorter loop which is 2.5 miles. There are a few obstacles to get over along the trail, but for the most part, the trail is good to go. This is a perfect trail for beginning trail running. The trail does not allow dogs, so just wanted to give you all a head's up about that.

Map of the trail: http://carsonvalleytrails.org/docs/BentlyKirman/KirmanTrail_map.pdf

Directions to the trail head:

1. Take Hwy 395 North if you are coming from Gardnerville/Minden area or take it South if you are coming from Carson City area.

2. Turn on Stephanie Way

3. Turn left on Heybourne Road

4. Go about 1/2 mile down the road and you will see a small sign on the left hand side that directs you to the trail head.

5. Go down to the end of the road and park anywhere along the side of the road. You will see the entrance to the trail head.

 

"To get to the finish line, you'll have to try lots of different paths."
- Amby Burfoot

 

Happy Running,

Jessica
name: Bently-Kirman Tract Trail Run

We specialize in growing a full range of landscape plants—from flowering ground cover to full sized trees and palms. We are environmentally friendly using no harmful fungicides or insecticides on our plants. We also grow and sell organic fruits and vegetables that are available seasonally.
