description:
לכבוד שבוע האשה הבינלאומי , פרוייקט וייזירושלים ו
She codes;
מזמינים אתכן להרצאה חגיגית של רות פולצ'ק, במייק'ס פלייס ירושלים, המפגישה בין הדברים שכולנו אוהבות: יזמות, נשים ובירה.

יום שני,[masked], פתיחת שערים ב 19:00, ההרצאה תתחיל ב 20:00.
הכניסה חופשית כמו תמיד ויש האפי האוור, מומלץ להגיע מוקדם בכדי לשמור מקום!

==== על she codes; ====

;she codes
היא קהילת מפתחות התכנה הישראלית, בה חברות מעל 5,000 משתתפות מכל האוניברסיטאות, בגוגל ובחברות הייטק נוספות.
מטרת הארגון להגיע ל50% מפתחות תוכנה בתעשיית ההייטק הישראלית בתוך עשור, לשפר את אפשרויות הקריירה של הנשים בתחום. כמו כן, להקנות מיומנויות טכנולוגיות בפיתוח תכנה לנשים ונערות ללא ניסיון קודם בתחום.

==== על ההרצאה ====


הדרכה ליזם או יזמית המתחיליםרות תדבר על כלים כיצד להצליח ביזמות ובנוסף תדבר גם על ההבדלים בין נשים לגברים בתחום.

יש כיום פחות מ5% יזמיות, בהרצאה נגלה איך לשנות את הסטטיסטיקה וכיצד להצליח כיזם או כיזמית.

==== על המרצה ====

רות פולצ'ק היא מייסדת ויו״ר קהילת מפתחות התכנה הישראלית. ראש האקסלרטור ליזמים, סיטיבנק.
רות בעלת נסיון של יותר משבע שנים בתור מנכלית ומקימה של סטארט אפים שונים בתחומי ההייטק והטכנולוגיה.
כרגע היא עומדת בראש
SW ventures
וייסדה את מועדון היזמים בוגרי האוניברסיטה העברית בירושלים.
ואם כל זה לא מספיק, בשנת 2008 נבחרה על ידי דה מרקר לאחת מ 40 הצעירים והצעירות המבטיחים ביותר, 7 שנים לאחר מכן, היא בהחלט מוכיחה מדוע.

Description: Watkins Glen State Park is one of the most famous of the New York State Parks, with a reputation for leaving visitors amazed. Within two miles, the glen's stream descends 400 feet past 200-foot cliffs, generating 19 waterfalls along its course. There are three main park trails: Indian, Gorge and Southern Rim. The Gorge and Southern Rim trails are closer to the waterfalls. The Indian trail takes you to the upper entrance, through the woods.

Cost: Free

Attractions:

• 19 waterfalls

• Rainbows

• River made Caverns

• Stone Walkways

• Spiral Tunnels under Waterfalls

Maps:

Difficulty:

• All Trails Runs Parallel

• Easy = Indian Trail

• Moderate = White Trail (South Rim)

• Difficult = Gorge Trail

Distance: 1.5 Miles

Duration: 3 Hours

Suggested Car Pool Cost: $0

Designated driver and passengers link:

description:
“ ‘MISSING. Karla Richter, 24. Was last seen before she left for the supermarket. Four days ago.’

Pizza night. Karla runs to the shop, and doesn't come home. Three friends begin a desperate search that takes them into the darkness of their past, where every trace of the missing girl tests their loyalties, loves and lies.

This exhilarating new play is a poetic thriller, a touching love story, and a powerful drama about exile, friendship and loss. Maria Milisavljevic won the prestigious German Kleist Award for Young Dramatists in 2013 for Abyss. This is its UK première.

‘An emotionally powerful thriller that rustles and whispers about loss’ – Der Spiegel” – from the Arcola website

Please book your own seat direct with the theatre. Seating is unallocated. I’ve placed a limit of 16 attendees on this event, to keep numbers manageable. Because of the limit, it’s essential that the people who RSVP do come – otherwise they’re excluding people who would have come.

For that reason, don’t RSVP until you’ve bought a ticket (after first checking that this Meetup event isn’t already fully subscribed) and you’re certain you will be coming. You will need to make a note in your RSVP with your order number. If you forget to do that at the time, you will need add the missing details by re-RSVPing and entering them as soon as possible. If you don’t let me know, I’ll assume that you haven’t bought a ticket and aren’t yet sure if you’ll attend, and I will remove you from the RSVP list.

The performance is about 2 hours and 30 minutes long, with an interval. We will stay on to have drinks in the theatre cafe-bar after the performance. This event is for people who will be staying for drinks afterward. If you won’t be joining drinks, please don’t RSVP. Please contribute £1 on arrival (to help defray the approx. £120 per annum that Meetup charges to run a group) – thanks in advance.

In the days immediately prior, I’ll circulate details of arrangements to meet before the performance.
name: Abyss – at the Arcola Theatre

description:
Let's hit the trails for a run of any distance you choose! The Fay-Luther Trail System is an amazing network of trails that allow for many different scenic experiences as well as various distances.

Map of the trail: http://carsonvalleytrails.org/docs/FayLuther/FL_Panel_MapSMALL.pdf

Here is some basic trail information regarding Fay-Luther:

The Fay-Luther Trail System is an 8.9 mile network of linear and loop trails with a connection to the Jobs Peak Ranch Trailhead. These trails are open to mountain bikes and equestrians except for the trail section between Valley View Loop and the Jobs Peak Ranch Trailhead. A majority of these trails have sandy soils, making it difficult for mountain bikes. Dogs are allowed year-round and must be leashed October 15 through March 30 to protect wintering mule deer. There is no trail access to Jobs Peak. Please stay on designated trails only and respect neighboring private property.

These trails travel through both high desert and forested habitats. Some common vegetation includes Big Sagebrush, Rabbitbrush, Bitterbrush, Curlleaf Mountain-Mahogany, Jeffrey Pine, Singleleaf Pinyon and White Alder.

The Interpretive Loop Trail has interpretive signs about the areas human histories, fauna and flora, and landscape forces.

 

Directions: From the intersection of Hwy 395 and Hwy 88 in Minden, drive south on Hwy 88 for 6.5 miles. Turn right on Fairview Lane and drive 1.7 miles (Fairview Lane becomes Foothill Road). The signed Fay-Luther Trailhead is located on the left side of the road. Horse trailer parking is available.

From the intersection of Hwy 207 and Foothill Road at the base of Kingsbury Grade, drive south on Foothill Road for 4.5 miles. The signed Fay-Luther Trailhead is located on the right side of the road. The Jobs Peak Ranch Trailhead is located 2.0 miles north of the Fay-Luther Trailhead on Foothill Road.

 

"A course never quite looks the same way twice. The combinations of weather, season, light, feelings and thoughts that you find there are ever-changing."
--Joe Henderson

 

Happy Running,

Jessica
name: Fay-Luther Trail Run

PS: Please read updated FAQ below before coming to my event to have answers to your doubts/worries and to avoid any misunderstanding

FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions)

Question: Hello! I would like to go to this event. But I am very new to the group. Is it okay to go this event by myself? Thanks!

Yes, most of the newbies come by themselves. But after attending my event; they go back with a big circle of new friends.

If you are attending the event for the first time, it is only natural you get a bit nervous. Do not worry, meet me or Guest Host and inform that you want to be introduced .We will be very much pleased to help you.

How to identify me? I am an Indian with a name tag “FRANCIS ORGANISER"

Question: Hmm..i was there outside but too shy to go inside by myself. Prolly just go somewhere in the area. Next time hopefully. More guts

Hi, sorry to hear that you outside my meetup but too shy to come inside. Being newbie, I can understand your fear and anxiety. Few years back, I was also a shy newbie like you.

Next time, please go to registration counter at the venue and request staff to meet organiser. The staff will inform me. I will come, personally welcome you and introduce to others.

Question: We register when we come that night at Venue?

Yes, you have to register again at the venue.

Members who do not register at the event, arguing that they have already RSVPed in the Meetup website, will be asked to leave the venue

Question: This is my first time joining such event. How do I register again at the venue?

Hi , welcome to my event. When you reach the venue, you will see Registration Table, with a signage “Francis Meetup Event” on the table. Please tell the staff that you are coming for Francis Meetup Event. Pay in cash, registration fees and get a drink coupon and a blank name tag.

Question: Can I bring my friend who is not in the group?

Sure, you can bring your friend, who is not in the group. Please register for your friend also at the registration table

Question: we are very new to this group :) who do we look for when we get there?

You can always look for me (Francis Organiser) when you reach venue. C u in the event

Question:I'm newbie and do not know anybody. How to start a conversation?

My group members are very friendly. So don't be shy and say "hello" or address them by names in their name tags  You never know where the conversation might lead to! friendship or may be relationship.

Question:What is the best time to make more friends?

Please come between 7-8pm. During the period, members will go around, mingle, make new friends and form small groups based on work, hobby, interest, etc

Question:How to identify the venue of this Meetup?

Most of the time, we will have our own signage. Hence please look for signage with words “FRANCIS MEETUP EVENT” at Registration Counter and at the entrance of the venue

Question: hello! am new and haven't exactly tried such meetups so cld I ask how do we recognise each other?

It is very easy to recognize other members since all my members will have name tags. Most of my events are private events. Hence you can mingle with others freely

Question: Is it mandatory for everyone to wear nametag? Im not comfortable doing thar in a public event

If you are not comfortable to write your real name in name tag, you can have any other name or blank name tag. If you are not having name tag, other members will think that you are not from Meetup group and you may not able to mingle with others in the event

Question:My work will end late ... Can I get there by 8pm 

Yes, but my only worry is that if you come late, you may lose the golden opportunity to meet most of the interesting members.

Question:I will be bringing guests with me.. I hope it’s not too late to inform.

Sure, please bring your friends, colleagues and business associates who  want to go to a party that is really happening. 

If there are any other questions/doubts, please feel free to post them in the comments section below
----------------------------------

By joining this Meetup, you accept the following terms and conditions:

1.The group or the organiser shall not be held responsible nor liable for any of the guests’ incidents during any meetup organised.

2.Promotion of other groups or their events is NOT allowed during this meetup

3.The Organiser and Assistant Organiser reserve the right to refuse entry, expel from the event or ban any member from the group without assigning any reasons thereof
name: Friday Social Networking & Chill Out In A Nice Bistro Near Sommerset MRT

venue.address_1: 杭州西湖文化广场南侧，省科技馆二楼圆球内（2nd Floor, South Facade, Zhejiang Museum of Science and Technology, West Lake Cultural Plaza) ）

description:
You must bring your own laptop and have your own Arduino or Raspberry Pi Board. Other common ordinary  tools will be provided by the facility.

During the meetup time, please select one from your projects to share with the group. You may decide to communicate in English or Chinese.

I would like for everyone to think of a project we can do together as a group over the year while continuing to work on your personal projects.

I will offer drinks and snakes.

Arduino and Raspberry Pi are micro-processors based on open source concept. This means you are part of a world wide community who are willing to share their knowledge altruistically so one day we will be the master mind of things.

Do not think that you can be part if because you have no knowledge of micro-controllers. With some willingness and persistence you will learn in no time. It is easier than you write an article to write a "sketch" the computer will understand. Come to join us and get your hands on for a try anytime.

The group has taken home at a the AST Space (科技馆科学院）for its events. The runners of the Space is intend to make it not only the first public open community lab in China for Hangzhou but also a cozy and artistic  lounge for its members.
name: Sharing Projects

description: We learn and practice public speaking in English, and share a few Cantonese words here and there. Come to SF Bilingual Cantonese-English Toastmasters. description:
Want to be able to walk down the street with your dog without your dog lunging, barking or snapping at another dog? Want to be able to carry on a conversation in the park with your pal while your dog relaxes by your side? Want to know what to do when an excited dog approaches and you don't know what is 'going to happen'?! This is a class designed for people who want to learn HOW to socialize their dogs on leash. Want to learn how to introduce your dog to other dogs on leash. How to read their body language. Deal with mild aggression. Dealing with a fearful or timid dog.

This is a STRUCTURED GROUP CLASS where I will work with you and your dog in a MINDFUL, SUPPORTIVE environment.

Cost: $15/class payable before class by check or cash. This class is NOT for highly aggressive dogs - a dog that has bitten a human or dog.  I offer private classes for high aggression dogs.

PLEASE WEAR COMFORTABLE CLOTHES AND ATHLETIC SHOES AS WE TYPICALLY WALK ABOUT ON UNEVEN GROUND.  :)
name: Mindful Dog Socialization 101

description:
Want to know more about how an MBA can help you with your business and career, and want to expand your network with like-minded professionals? Come to our MBA event, talk with top business schools and network with like-minded professionals. For more information and register for the event http://topmba.mobi/event/32?pt=35.

QS runs the world’s largest MBA events and Is a very well-known and trusted name within the business education industry globally. Our events provide the opportunity for attendees to speak face to face with MBA admissions directors from top local and international business schools, such as IMD, York-Schulich, Ivey, IE, RSM Rotterdam, Macquarie, Queen’s, Durham, ESMT, Fudan, SMU and many others.

For those who don’t know much about MBA yet, this is your perfect chance to discover how an MBA degree can help your accelerate your career as well as provide the entrepreneurial skills and network you need to achieve your ambition in the world of business. For those of you who have already decided to pursuit an MBA, this is the best chance to discover your best programme and impress admission directors. There’ll also be exclusive scholarships (worth $1.7 million in total) available for event attendees and free GMAT seminars help your exam preparation.

Plus, at the end of the event, there’ll be a networking sessions with free drinks. So either you want to expand your professional network or just make some friends with like-minded young professionals and entrepreneurs, this is also and unmissable opportunity.

Event details:
Event: QS Word MBA Tour Connect Shanghai Event
Time: 12:00 – 17:00, Saturday, 25 April 2015
Venue: Grand Hyatt 

Event agenda:
12:00 – 13:00 Snapshot presentations (mini info sessions by each attending school)
13:00 - 13:30 Getting in to business School Panel
13:30 - 16:30 Meeting with business school admission directors
16:30 - 17.00 Networking drinks

Please note:
To attend the event, you need to register via the link http://topmba.mobi/event/32?pt=35. RSVP only on this Meetup page doesn’t automatically register you. You can come to the event without pre-registering online, but you’ll need to register your detail on the day which may cost time and you might need to queue. So we strongly advise to register in advance. You can also get more information about the event from this page.

I look forward to seeing you all there! Don't forget to register for the event at: http://topmba.mobi/event/32?pt=35

Best regards
Xi from QS

description:
You are invited to join us for a
Native American Gratitude Ritual

Sunday 15th March @4 - 6 pm

Lead by Ian Peric, this Native American Gratitude Ceremony, mostly performed at a New Moon, uses the same core practice made popular by ‘The Secret’. 

Along with Sacred Prayer we use Song, Intention Setting and Meditation to feel the Gratitude for receiving the things we are manifesting. We use this ceremony to give us a platform to realise, cultivate and hold strong feelings of Gratitude, while aligning our vibe with what we are calling in. 


Fee: $30

 Concession: $20 

($10 reserves your space).


You are invited to bring a plate to share at the completion of the ritual.
Ian Peric, Shaman and Author of “13 Weeks to Awakening’, is currently sharing some of his knowledge with us at Oracle Wisdom. 

ORACLE WISDOM is a New Age shop located in McKinnon.                                      Opens from 11 am -5.30 daily  

[masked] or[masked]

IF YOU HAVE NOT RESERVED YOUR SPACE IN TIME, JUST text me to check if we have room AND arrive by 3.50 PM

See our page on FB.
name: NATIVE AMERICAN GRATITUDE CEREMONY

"This month the board meeting of the Peninsula Trails Coalition will be held in Port Townsend at the PT Senior Center, 620 Tyler St. at 7:00 PM on Wednesday, Mar. 11th.  This is a PUBLIC MEETING. The PTC encourages you to come, meet with your Jeff. Co. (and all) board members and hear and weigh in on the latest issues regarding the progress of the ODT in both counties.  We're making some great progress toward our ultimate dream of a "Pathway to the Pacific".  See you there!"

Good times! Maybe there will be free coffee and doughnuts. Or Cliff bars or something.

3/11: PTC Board Meeting, 7 p.m. PUBLIC WELCOME! Meet the board members and find out what’s happening on the Olympic Discovery Trail. Port Townsend Community Center, 620 Tyler St. (cross street Lawrence)

The North Sydney Council is having an exhibition of sculptures, mixed media, photography at the Coal Loader Centre for Sustainability, which is just a 10 minute walk from Waverton Station. 

From 7th March to 22nd March, you can wander about the Coal Loader and its surrounding areas to view the exhibits. If you appreciate art, this is a good opportunity to relax and chill with the locals. 

There is a newly opened cafe offering a small menu of refreshments if you are keen to have a quick bite or drink after walking around.

If you are happy to pick up people around Crows Nest, please discuss in the comments below.

description:
I am going to bring you something different on March 18th.  I am offering an opportunity to join with our Reiki community without having to be stressed out driving across town. 

This Reiki Share will be a full live video class. 

Topic of discussion will be a deeper look at The Reiki Precepts. 

• What did Usui Sensi mean by:

"The Secret of Inviting Happiness through Many Blessings
The Spiritual Medicine for All Illness"?

• How can I integrate the Precepts into my daily life and why is this important? 

•We will close with a Reiki Blessing and Reiju.  

To join us in this Live Video Share, send me an e-mail RSVP no later than 6:00 pm to my  e-mail address:  [masked]  When I get your RSVP I will send you a live link to your e-mail so you can join the meeting.  I will open the video feed at 7:15 and we will begin our class at 7:30. Sign in early, so you to make sure the connection works for you.  The Zoom Meeting format works with  PC, Mac, iOS or Android. Or join by phone:  +1 (415)[masked] or +1 (646)[masked] US Toll  Meeting ID:[masked]

I’m excited to bring this Live Video format to our community so that we can easily connect from where ever you are.  Pay Pal $10.00 donation to help pay for Zoom and Meet Up costs  is appreciated.  Join us!



Up coming dates for Reiki Share


  (1st Wednesday most months,  W2nd Wed some months.... so check the calendar.)
name: Reiki Share

description:
BACC, 5th floor auditorium

Bangkok Art and Culture Centre proudly presents “Cinema Diverse: Director's Choice”. For the third Cinema Diverse, five international films, selected by five acclaimed Thai directors, will be shown bi-monthly from March – November 2015, followed by a talk with the director after each screening.

The first screening on Saturday 14 March 2015 will be a film from USA, Frances Ha (2012) directed by Noah Baumbach and chosen by Nawapol Thamrongrattanarit, the talented young Thai director of Mary Is Happy, Mary Is Happy, 36 and the Master.

Frances Ha has been screened in many international film festivals and was nominated for Best Actress (Comedy or Musical) at the Golden Globes (2014) and Best International Independent Film at British Independent Film Awards (2014)

*Free entry
*Screening in English with Thai subtitles
*Film screening starts at 17.30 hrs.
*The talk after the screening will be in Thai with English translation.
*The film is suitable for 15 years and over.

Film review: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/film/filmreviews/10199717/Frances-Ha-review.html
Trailer:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YBn5dgXFMis
name: Cinema Diverse: Director's Choice (Film: Frances Ha, USA)

description:
A not-to-be-missed evening of colourful Armenian music, featuring brilliant Armenian guest artists. The programme includes a new suite from Oscar-winning Canadian composer Mychael Danna’s score for Atom Egoyan’s film Ararat, and a collection of exquisite songs by composer Gomidas, arranged by Serouj Kradjian.

We will be attending this concert in partnership with our sister group, the TSG Toronto Social Group.

Performers

• Peter Oundjian, conductor

• Isabel Bayrakdarian, soprano

• Sergey Khachatryan, violin

• Serouj Kradjian, piano 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mUiZomzTs-Q

Click on the video above to get an idea of a typical performance. 

Our Seats 

As usual, we have reserved seats in the balcony in section R8 & L8. Every seat at the Roy Thompson Hall is a good seat. We are especially close to the orchestra stage sitting above it. 

Price

Our special group discounted ticket price is $40.50 ea. All taxes and ticket/box office fees are included. 

Payment

Payment is required when you RSVP. Please note that payment is required to reserve a ticket for you. Payment can be made with all major credit cards or Paypal. A Paypal account is not required. If you wish to use an alternate payment method, I can also accept cash or email money transfer. Please contact me for further details. 

Ticket Pickup & Meeting Point 

I will be standing next to the box office window from 7:30 to 7:55 PM, wearing a large yellow name tag with my name on it. At 7:55 PM, I will go inside and get seated. If you arrive after 7:55 PM, please identify yourself to the staff at the customer service desk and they will give you your ticket.
name: Toronto Symphony Orchestra's Ararat: Music Of Armenia with Isabel Bayrakdarian

description:
Elon offers 2 courses in one. You can either play "The Angry Beaver" or "The Eager Beaver." The Eager Beaver is a great beginner course!! I suggest you play that one first.

Here's a link to it's description - http://www.dgcoursereview.com/course.php?id=3036

I'm going to start setting up Meetups on the weekend, whether I can make it or not. You guys feel free to sign up and meetup. I'll leave it up to you to find out what the weather will be like. If you do sign up, please make every effort to attend. If for any reason you have to back out, please do so at least 24 hours prior.

If you have any suggestions for parks you would like to throw at just shoot me a message and I try and get it posted.

Thanks!

PS. You may want to try and touch base with the other attendees if you decide to throw. Just shoot them a message, introduce yourself, and maybe even discuss what you might be wearing to find each other more easily.
name: Let's throw at Elon "The Eager Beaver" - Sat. 2/21 @ 2PM - Beginner Course

QS runs the world’s largest MBA events and Is a very well-known and trusted name within the business education industry globally. Our events provide the opportunity for attendees to speak face to face with MBA admissions directors from top local and international business schools, such as IMD, York-Schulich, Ivey, IE, RSM Rotterdam, Macquarie, Queen’s, Durham, ESMT, Fudan, SMU and many others.

For those who don’t know much about MBA yet, this is your perfect chance to discover how an MBA degree can help your accelerate your career as well as provide the entrepreneurial skills and network you need to achieve your ambition in the world of business. For those of you who have already decided to pursuit an MBA, this is the best chance to discover your best programme and impress admission directors. There’ll also be exclusive scholarships (worth $1.7 million in total) available for event attendees and free GMAT seminars help your exam preparation.

Plus, at the end of the event, there’ll be a networking sessions with free drinks. So either you want to expand your professional network or just make some friends with like-minded young professionals and entrepreneurs, this is also and unmissable opportunity.

description:
Before I list an outing for us to go out on, I sometimes go and check it out myself, so I can see what the environment is like; if there is place for us to picnic, etc .. this is one of those.

Located in Logan, it's 1-HOUR OF CABLE SKIING and sounds like a fun activity, in a safe environment.

I am unsure, but I think we need to hire a skiboard ($15 for one hour) as equipment is not included. I guess we will find out on the day.

So we cable ski for one hour, check the place out .. and have a great time !!

We can visit midweek (preferred) and tickets are normally $30, however I have a discount ticket for $25 if you would care to join me in the "fun test"

Must be under 95kg and able to swim.

Once the ticket is purchased, we can organise a booking date which is convenient to both of us.
name: WHO WANTS TO CABLE SKI WITH ME ???

What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)  We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)   Ticket Link:  http://uncorkeddenver-foppiano-warwick.eventbrite.com

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT
name: 90+ Pt Sonoma Patio Wine Party with Louis Foppiano@Warwick-Pl­ayboy Twist!

description:
Puppy training begins the moment you bring your new puppy home. I want to teach new puppy parents how they can influence and shape the behavior of their growing puppy in a positive and fun atmosphere. Whether or not you are enrolled in formal training, you are still teaching your puppy through your behavior in everyday life. By not consciously teaching or not setting limits for your puppy, you are setting up conditioning that may lead to future behavior problems. Puppy preschool is designed to teach parents to better understand their puppy’s needs, establish effective communication, curb behavior problems, and to show parents how to properly socialize their new puppy.

 

My puppy preschool program places a heavy emphasis on setting limits that your puppy can understand and on proper socialization to assist your puppy in the transition into your home and lifestyle. It is the first 4 months of a puppy’s life that is most critical. It is in this period that most puppies develop up to 90 percent of their attitudes toward people, other animals, and their environment. My program also addresses your individual puppy allowing you the one-on-one opportunity to ask questions that apply specifically to your puppy.

 

We cover the following topics in class: Problem-solving ideas for house training, chewing, play biting, proper dog play, greeting a stranger and more.

 


Puppy Age Requirements - 5 months and under.

 

Bring treats and a favorite non noisy making or tugging toy.

 

Vaccinations as recommended by your veterinarian at least 7 days prior to class
and/or at least one Distemper and one Parvo. (the D & P in DHLLP).
Had it's first veterinarian health check 7 days prior to class.

 

Cost: For $20.00, payable in cash or check before class.

PLEASE WEAR COMFORTABLE CLOTHES AND ATHLETIC SHOES AS WE TYPICALLY WALK ABOUT ON UNEVEN GROUND.  :)
name: Puppy Preschool - 5 months and under

description:
An Afterwork drink for working professionals is a refreshing opportunity to see who is out there. It's nice to have this chance to go out, have fun and meet people, It's a wonderful way to network and socialise.

After a busy day at work, let's Meet, Mingle, Network, Party, Dance, and have some fun with other working professionals. Let us make some new personal and professional connections.

“Camels or working professionals cannot go for a week without a drink”

So if you are looking to destress, socialise and rejuvenate, here is what is happening in my event on Friday You will always find the busiest and most happening crowd on a Friday Nite in my event

Registration fees (payable in cash only) at the regn table@venue

LADIES: SS$10/- per pax for a glass of wine(Red/White) or soft drink

GENTLEMEN: S$15/- per pax for a glass of wine(Red/White) or soft drink

Ladies safety is my top priority.

Hence, ladies, please feel free to contact me if anyone breaks this rule

======

Venue:  MITZO RESTAURANT & BAR,

Level 4 Grand Park Orchard,
270 Orchard Road Singapore[masked]
T [masked]

The best seats in the house are arguably those at the Cocktail Atelier. With a 3 metre long jellyfish tank as backdrop, and illumination from the glittering bar top, the space is truly a vision to behold. This coveted space seats up to 6 and allows one to watch our cocktail craftsmen in action as they whip up delectable concoctions.

The 82-seat restaurant at the Grand Park Orchard hotel, which opened in Dec 2014, offers contemporary Cantonese restaurant as well as artisan cocktails. The restaurant is headed by chef Nicky Ng, former executive chef of modern Chinese restaurant Hakkasan in New York, while behind the bar is Jacek Piasecki, who runs Sling In, a top bar in Helsinki.

Chill out, wind down, or warm up to a night out.

Register for event at the registration counter of the venue and receive a drink coupon (redeemable at the bar counter) and a name tag. Please wear the name tag always during the event with a name (real or not). The Bar and/or Organiser reserve the right to ask any person, not having a name tag to leave without assigning any reasons thereof

Dress code:
Smart casual attire . No flip-flops or slippers allowed

I will be there to meet and greet personally everyone of you

Francis

Founder and Main Organiser

https://www.facebook.com/francis.organiser

Please like my face book page with more than 5,600 likes 
https://www.facebook.com/singapore.friendsclub

PS: Please read updated FAQ below before coming to my event to have answers to your doubts/worries and to avoid any misunderstanding

FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions)

Question: Hello! I would like to go to this event. But I am very new to the group. Is it okay to go this event by myself? Thanks!

Yes, most of the newbies come by themselves. But after attending my event; they go back with a big circle of new friends.

If you are attending the event for the first time, it is only natural you get a bit nervous. Do not worry, meet me or Guest Host and inform that you want to be introduced .We will be very much pleased to help you.

How to identify me? I am an Indian with a name tag “FRANCIS ORGANISER"

Question: Hmm..i was there outside but too shy to go inside by myself. Prolly just go somewhere in the area. Next time hopefully. More guts

Hi, sorry to hear that you outside my meetup but too shy to come inside. Being newbie, I can understand your fear and anxiety. Few years back, I was also a shy newbie like you.

Next time, please go to registration counter at the venue and request staff to meet organiser. The staff will inform me. I will come, personally welcome you and introduce to others.

Question: We register when we come that night at Venue?

Yes, you have to register again at the venue.

Members who do not register at the event, arguing that they have already RSVPed in the Meetup website, will be asked to leave the venue

Question: This is my first time joining such event. How do I register again at the venue?

Hi , welcome to my event. When you reach the venue, you will see Registration Table, with a signage “Francis Meetup Event” on the table. Please tell the staff that you are coming for Francis Meetup Event. Pay in cash, registration fees and get a drink coupon and a blank name tag.

Question: Can I bring my friend who is not in the group?

Sure, you can bring your friend, who is not in the group. Please register for your friend also at the registration table

Question: we are very new to this group :) who do we look for when we get there?

You can always look for me (Francis Organiser) when you reach venue. C u in the event

Question:I'm newbie and do not know anybody. How to start a conversation?

My group members are very friendly. So don't be shy and say "hello" or address them by names in their name tags  You never know where the conversation might lead to! friendship or may be relationship.

Question:What is the best time to make more friends?

Please come between 7-8pm. During the period, members will go around, mingle, make new friends and form small groups based on work, hobby, interest, etc

Question:How to identify the venue of this Meetup?

Most of the time, we will have our own signage. Hence please look for signage with words “FRANCIS MEETUP EVENT” at Registration Counter and at the entrance of the venue

Question: hello! am new and haven't exactly tried such meetups so cld I ask how do we recognise each other?

It is very easy to recognize other members since all my members will have name tags. Most of my events are private events. Hence you can mingle with others freely

Question: Is it mandatory for everyone to wear nametag? Im not comfortable doing thar in a public event

If you are not comfortable to write your real name in name tag, you can have any other name or blank name tag. If you are not having name tag, other members will think that you are not from Meetup group and you may not able to mingle with others in the event

Question:My work will end late ... Can I get there by 8pm 

Yes, but my only worry is that if you come late, you may lose the golden opportunity to meet most of the interesting members.

Question:I will be bringing guests with me.. I hope it’s not too late to inform.

Sure, please bring your friends, colleagues and business associates who  want to go to a party that is really happening.
----------------------------------
The group or the organiser shall not be held responsible nor liable for any of the guests’ incidents during any meetup organised.

Promotion of other groups or their events is NOT allowed during this meetup

The Organiser and Assistant Organiser reserve the right to refuse entry, expel from the event or ban any member from the group without assigning any reasons thereof
name: Friday Afterwork Drinks For Networking In A New And Cozy Hotel Bar @ Orchard

description:
Too Much Light Makes the Baby Go Blind is Chicago's longest continually-running show. At it's core, it's an attempt to perform 30 plays in 60 minutes. The plays themselves are not related to one another, change weekly, and include pieces that are dramatic, comedic, political, etc. The audience selects the order they're performed, and sometimes directly participates (note: the entire theater is considered "splash zone" for whatever the cast feels like doing).

There's a ton more by way of quirks to the show, and if you aren't familiar with it you should DEFINITELY check it out in advance. I've never been myself, but I'm super excited to go!

Also, since alcohol is not sold inside, we may want to pregame at a nearby bar a little in advance...
name: Too Much Light Makes the Baby Go Blind

description:
For information on trip price, itinerary, pickup locations and all other details, please click here. Please note that you MUST book your seat and pay for it through the ShortTrips.ca website.

Please join us on this terrific once a year opportunity for an extra long 5-hour spring time cruise aboard the MS Chi Cheemaun on Georgian Bay along the coast of the spectacular Bruce Peninsula.

As many of you know, the Chi-Cheemaun ferry normally transports passengers every day in the summer months between Tobermory and Manitoulin Island. It's winter home however is Owen Sound! Today we will be boarding the ferry on its very first sailing of the year as it moves from Owen Sound to Tobermory. Our bus will drop us off at the dock in Owen Sound and pick us up at the end of the cruise in Tobermory.

A lovely hot & cold lunch buffet is included with the tour price. The cash bar will be open for refreshments. Music will be playing throughout the boat. What better way to enjoy the spring breezes than from the deck of a boat on Georgian Bay while sipping your favourite brew!

What's Included?

• Round trip transportation from the Toronto area on deluxe highway motor coach.

• One way 5-hour cruise ticket aboard the MS Chi-Cheemaun included.

• Hot & Cold buffet on board the boat included. Cash bar is available for soft drinks and alcoholic beverages.

• Complimentary water and snacks on the bus included. 

• All tips included. HST extra.

I hope you will join us on this fun day out and I hope to see you on the trip! 

- Sash

This trip is being arranged by:

Marville Travel Ltd.  
(905)[masked]  
TICO #[masked]

For information on trip price, itinerary, pickup locations and all other details, please click here. Please note that you MUST book your seat and pay for it through the ShortTrips.ca website.
name: Bruce Peninsula & Georgian Bay 5-Hour Spring Time Cruise

description:
Everyone’s invited to celebrate St Patrick's Day in Trafalgar Square on Sunday 15 March. Come along and experience the best of Irish music, song dance, culture and arts – all for free!

In Trafalgar Square there’ll be an Irish food market, children’s activities and lots of Irish community organisations. You can also enjoy the best of Irish music, song and dance on the main stage.

Come and join the craic of the St Patrick’s Day Parade, with its crazy giant creatures, fun community floats, vibrant dance groups and Irish bands.

Shamrocks are encouraged but not compulsory!

The 2015 Parade will form up from 10am for floats and 11am for walkers on Sunday 15 March from outside Green Park Station.

At 12 noon the flamboyant line-up will set off at a jig, crawl, roll and walk to thread its way up Piccadilly, along Lower Regent, the Mall and Cockspur Street, rounding Trafalgar Square and finishing up in Whitehall.

Everyone is welcome to participate, Irish or not, so sign up now for your chance to be part of the fun, or line the route to enjoy this family friendly spectacle. 

The event is organised by the Mayor, with support from many Irish businesses, cultural organisations, musicians and artists.....

Trafalgar Square

Trafalgar Square

St Patrick’s Day Parade and Festival 2015

Sunday, 15 March 2015 - 12:00pm to 6:00pm
name: St Patrick’s Day Parade + Sunday Lunch :)

description:
After the winter we've had, a tropical getaway is sounding pretty good. I've found a home in old Puerto Vallarta, poised on the hill overlooking the famous Playa Los Muertos (of Night of the Iguana fame). We can have the place for nine nights, Friday April 10 through Sunday Apriel 19... airport pick up, drop off is included, along with maid service, breakfast fixings and food staples.

The casa is traditional in design, with painted tile and stucco. It features a private garden, large patio, pool and a balcony for optimal sunset viewing. The home backs up to the jungle and is reached by funicular from street level. It has four bedrooms and 3.5 baths. The large master has an en suite bath, available for an extra $250.

The kitchen is great, and will be stocked with wine, water, breakfast fixings and other food staples. We'll have the maid come in every other day or so.

This vacation is all about convenience and lazy, sunny days... It's going to be a pretty unstructured trip. Though I'm thinking of primarily of the beach and pool (and blended margaritas, there are many activities available... snorkeling and eco tours of the jungle, spas and museums. The casa is 5 to 10 minutes walk from downtown so we can walk to the beach, to dinner, or to shop, though cabs are plentiful and affordable.

The price for the trip is $1250 for nine nights, ground only. All activities are extra, though I'm happy to help making arrangements for snorkeling, spas, jungle tours, etc.

We need to book this quickly, or we risk losing out. I do have a backup casa in mind with similar amenity and a few nice perks, but I hope we get this one!

If you RSVP please send me a message to make arrangements!
name: Escape to Tropical Puerto Vallarta, 9 Nights for $1250.00

description:
Join us for an awesome day to discover the township of Montville! We will start the day off by taking a walk thought Kondalilla National Park & than explorer the many unique/divine shops that Montville has to offer.

If you are going to attend this event I recommend that you do the following;

• Follow the comments to this event!

• Organize your own Transportation!

If anyone is willing to help out with transport, then please feel free to offer lifts in the comments below. If anyone needs a lift please feel free to ask in the comments below as well

Montville is a small town in the Sunshine Coast hinterland, on the Blackall Range in Queensland, Australia, around 400 metres above sea level. At the 2011 census, Montville and the surrounding area had a population of 886.

The Main Street Montville is home to over 100 boutique retail outlets, many housed in historic and unique buildings. Popular attractions include galleries, restaurants, wineries, cheese factories and craft and clothing shops. Find Out More…

Early settlement: The first white settlers arrived in the area in 1887 and the town was later named by Henry Smith. Read More…

Kondalilla Falls: The Picnic Creek circuit down the escarpment, past rock pools and a lookout with views of Kondalilla Falls. Walk through rainforest to the base of the waterfall and continue back up the ridge. Look for emergent bunya pines with their distinctive symmetrical dome shapes, dense stands of pica been palms and intriguing shapes of pink ash. What goes down must come back up! There are over 100 stair steps on the Kondalilla Falls circuit so you need to be reasonably fit. Find Out More…



http://youtu.be/PU2wtCCCR4w
name: Montville **Day Trip**

description:
Being-Knowing-Feeling

“Your expectation of something unique and dramatic, of some wonderful explosion, is merely hindering and delaying your Self Realization. You are not to expect an explosion, for the explosion has already happened - at the moment when you were born, when you realized yourself as Being-Knowing-Feeling. There is only one mistake you are making: you take the inner for the outer and the outer for the inner. What is in you, you take to be outside you and what is outside, you take to be in you. The mind and feelings are external, but you take them to be intimate. You believe the world to be objective, while it is entirely a projection of your psyche. That is the basic confusion and no new explosion will set it right! You have to think yourself out of it. There is no other way.”


~Nisargadatta Maharaj, I Am That: Talks with Sri Nisargadatta Maharaj

> What are your ways and means of thinking outside of this basic confusion?

description:
"What are the essential elements to discerning what is truly wise?

From our previous meetup, one essential element proposed was the positive result.

Purpose:  Explore the ability and the certainty to repeatedly produces "positive results?

Join us for food, drinks, and discussion.
Bring your collective wisdom.
--Greet old friends and meet new ones.

Wisdom - http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/wisdom/  
Wisdom: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wisdom

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otZRL-rhMaY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otZRL-rhMaY

Agenda 
6:45 - Arrive early if you wish to order food or drinks from the atrium's food court.

7:00 - Introductions

7:15   - Exploration

8:45  - Final Comments

(Note - Arrive early if you wish to buy food or drinks from their food court which closes a 7:30 pm.) 

Suggestions

A. Listen to understand and suspend judgment. 

B. Make one point at a time and allow others to respond.  Speak from personal experience.

C. Listen for the underlying assumptions.  Look for new insights.

Note – Meetup nor the participants neither screens participants, nor supervises or controls meetings, and we have no involvement with any of the individuals who participate. Therefore, we suggest that participants exercise good judgment when attending.


About the Moderator:  Yen is a parent, manager, and a former educator & examiner from the private and public sector.  Specifically, Yen is a graduate of the U.S. Air Force Academy.  He is a physics major who worked on a very small SDI project before becoming a Navigator in aviation and operations management in the US Air Force.   Yen planned, trained, executed, and evaluated military operations protecting first responders and the President after 9/11 to ensure continuation of the government during crisis.  Currently, Yen is around $[masked] dollar.  :D
name: How can you tell what's wise? Positive Results? #MeetupMonday

description:
Ticket Link:  http://uncorkeddenver-foppiano-warwick.eventbrite.com

What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)  We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)   Ticket Link:  http://uncorkeddenver-foppiano-warwick.eventbrite.com

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

ASSUMPTION OF RISK - WAIVER AGREEMENT http://www.meetup.com/denverwine/pages/ASSUMPTION_OF_RISK_-_WAIVER_AGREEMENT
name: 90+ Pt Sonoma Patio Wine Party: Louis Foppiano@Warwick-Pl­­ayboy Twist!

description:
"What are the essential elements to discerning what is truly wise?

From our previous meetup, one essential element proposed was the positive result.

Purpose:  Explore the ability and the certainty to repeatedly produces "positive results?

Join us for food, drinks, and discussion.
Bring your collective wisdom.
--Greet old friends and meet new ones.

Wisdom - http://plato.stanford.edu/entries/wisdom/  
Wisdom: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wisdom

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otZRL-rhMaY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=otZRL-rhMaY

Agenda 
6:45 - Arrive early if you wish to order food or drinks from the atrium's food court.

7:00 - Introductions

7:15   - Exploration

8:45  - Final Comments

(Note - Arrive early if you wish to buy food or drinks from their food court which closes a 7:30 pm.) 

Suggestions

A. Listen to understand and suspend judgment. 

B. Make one point at a time and allow others to respond.  Speak from personal experience.

C. Listen for the underlying assumptions.  Look for new insights.

Note – Meetup nor the participants neither screens participants, nor supervises or controls meetings, and we have no involvement with any of the individuals who participate. Therefore, we suggest that participants exercise good judgment when attending.


About the Moderator:  Yen is a parent, manager, and a former educator & examiner from the private and public sector.  Specifically, Yen is a graduate of the U.S. Air Force Academy.  He is a physics major who worked on a very small SDI project before becoming a Navigator in aviation and operations management with the US Air Force.   Yen planned, trained, executed, and evaluated military operations protecting first responders and the President after 9/11 to ensure continuation of the government during crisis.  Currently, Yen is around $[masked] dollar.  :D

description:
Let's face it -- doughnuts are delicious in any form. Behold the wonder of pillowy, glazed and powdered doughnuts. So please join us in this class for some sinful indulgence as we mix, fry, fill and dunk donuts of all kinds. 

In this doughnut class, you learn the fundamentals to create yeast doughs and batter with a variety of toppings and glazes. Each student takes home their sweet and delicious goodies.

And oh yeah, since it's difficult to do this kind of work without drooling, you also get to eat a doughnut or two... or three... while you're learning. Sort of like having your cake and eating it too! Icing on the cake so to speak. OK OK, I couldn't resist. I'll stop with the puns now. LOL 

Cost

The cost of this class is $55 including all taxes.

Payment is required at the time you RSVP. Payment can be made with any major credit card or Paypal. A Paypal account is not required. Please contact me if you prefer to use Interac Email Money Transfer instead.

Start Time

Please try to arrive by 6:45 PM so that the class can start promptly at 7:00 PM. Repeating the intructions for late arrivals slows down the class and isn't fair to those who arrived on time.

Location

Our class will be held at the Le Dolci Cake Decorating Studio. It is located at the corner of Dundas St. W & Montrose in the Dundas W & Ossington area. To reach the Le Dolci website, click here.

I look forward to seeing you there!

- Sash
name: Baking Class -- Making Doughnuts

description:
This is for members who have attended a meet-up at the vihara. There won't be a pre-meet-up at Panera.

As with all Buddhist teachings traditionally there is never a charge for attending a meetup but people are encouraged to contribute dana to cover organizer fees and donate to causes that support or teach Buddhist practice or values as decided by the meet-up membership.

 RSVP is requested. As long as at least three members have RSVPed, you can message the organizer about joining the meet-up by noon Thursday. On the day of the meetup but please check the website for last minute changes! Knowing how many to expect can help the host set up enough seats for everyone.

This special "floating" meet-up is an offering to interested members to remember Ruth Denison, my first teacher, who died on February 26 at age 93 years. She had just celebrated her 93rd birthday. A student and dhamma heir of  Burmese lay meditation master, U Ba Khin, Ruth taught more like S. N. Goenka than all the other guiding teachers at IMS and IMW (Spirit Rock).
name: Meetup to honor Ruth Denison

description:
One of the benefits of practical philosophy is to give us a deeper understanding of one of the most misunderstood and challenging ideas in many eastern philosophies; non-attachment. Many philosophical and spiritual traditions identify the lack of detachment with the continuous worries and restlessness produced by desire and personal ambitions. This event will provide the opportunity for a thoughtful and engaging discussion on how non-attachment can be put into practice in our modern lives. This will be event #22 for our group in Vancouver. 


Please remember to view at least one of the videos on our Food for Thought page prior to the event:

Click here to view the Food for Thought page for this event


As per usual, our discussion facilitators will be provided with thought-provoking questions to fuel the discussions (available soon). Our members take turns facilitating these discussions. As the coordinator for all of our groups around the world, I'm the one who coordinates the facilitators for events prior to the event taking place (with one facilitator for every table of 6 people). I also facilitate events which take place in Vancouver.


If you want to attend this event then RSVP 'Yes' via this web page and follow the instructions to pay the small fee online. Cash payment is not accepted at the door. Click here to read why this is the case.


Why is there a small fee? Click here to read the reasons why there is a small fee to attend our events.



For more information on Philosophy Dinners please visit ourFAQs page and our home page:

philosophydinners.org


Sincerely, 
Glen Brauer 
Founder, Facilitator and Event Coordinator 
http://philosophydinners.org/ 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/philosophydinners

Click here to sign up for this event taking place on Sun March 15
name: Non-attachment (appetizers & discussion)

description:
Puppy training begins the moment you bring your new puppy home. I want to teach new puppy parents how they can influence and shape the behavior of their growing puppy in a positive and fun atmosphere. Whether or not you are enrolled in formal training, you are still teaching your puppy through your behavior in everyday life. By not consciously teaching or not setting limits for your puppy, you are setting up conditioning that may lead to future behavior problems. Puppy preschool is designed to teach parents to better understand their puppy’s needs, establish effective communication, curb behavior problems, and to show parents how to properly socialize their new puppy.

My puppy preschool program places a heavy emphasis on setting limits that your puppy can understand and on proper socialization to assist your puppy in the transition into your home and lifestyle. It is the first 4 months of a puppy’s life that is most critical. It is in this period that most puppies develop up to 90 percent of their attitudes toward people, other animals, and their environment. My program also addresses your individual puppy allowing you the one-on-one opportunity to ask questions that apply specifically to your puppy.

We cover the following topics in class: Problem-solving ideas for house training, chewing, play biting, proper dog play, greeting a stranger and more.


Puppy Age Requirements - 5 months and under.  Bring treats and a favorite toy or ball. 

Bring treats and a favorite non noisy making or tugging toy.

Vaccinations as recommended by your veterinarian at least 7 days prior to class
and/or at least one Distemper and one Parvo. (the D & P in DHLLP).
Had it's first veterinarian health check 7 days prior to class.

Cost: For $15.00, payable in cash or check before class.

PLEASE WEAR COMFORTABLE CLOTHES AND ATHLETIC SHOES AS WE TYPICALLY WALK ABOUT ON UNEVEN GROUND.  :)
name: Puppy Preschool - 5 months and under

description:
An Afterwork drink for working professionals is a refreshing opportunity to see who is out there. It's nice to have this chance to go out, have fun and meet people, It's a wonderful way to network and socialise.

After a busy day at work, let's Meet, Mingle, Network, Party, Dance, and have some fun with other working professionals. Let us make some new personal and professional connections.

“Camels or working professionals cannot go for a week without a drink”

So if you are looking to destress, socialise and rejuvenate, here is what is happening in my event on Friday You will always find the busiest and most happening crowd on a Friday Nite in my event

Registration fees (payable in cash only) at the regn table@venue

LADIES: SS$10/- per pax for a glass of wine(Red/White) or soft drink

GENTLEMEN: S$15/- per pax for a glass of wine(Red/White) or soft drink

Ladies safety is my top priority.

Hence, ladies, please feel free to contact me if anyone breaks this rule

======

Venue:  MITZO RESTAURANT & BAR,

Level 4 Grand Park Orchard,
270 Orchard Road Singapore[masked]
T [masked]

The best seats in the house are arguably those at the Cocktail Atelier. With a 3 metre long jellyfish tank as backdrop, and illumination from the glittering bar top, the space is truly a vision to behold. This coveted space seats up to 6 and allows one to watch our cocktail craftsmen in action as they whip up delectable concoctions.

The 82-seat restaurant at the Grand Park Orchard hotel, which opened in Dec 2014, offers contemporary Cantonese restaurant as well as artisan cocktails. The restaurant is headed by chef Nicky Ng, former executive chef of modern Chinese restaurant Hakkasan in New York, while behind the bar is Jacek Piasecki, who runs Sling In, a top bar in Helsinki.

Chill out, wind down, or warm up to a night out.

Register for event at the registration counter of the venue and receive a drink coupon (redeemable at the bar counter) and a name tag. Please wear the name tag always during the event with a name (real or not). The Bar and/or Organiser reserve the right to ask any person, not having a name tag to leave without assigning any reasons thereof

Dress code:
Smart casual attire . No flip-flops or slippers allowed

I will be there to meet and greet personally everyone of you

Francis

Assistant Organiser

https://www.facebook.com/francis.organiser

Please like my face book page with more than 5,600 likes 
https://www.facebook.com/singapore.friendsclub

PS: Please read updated FAQ below before coming to my event to have answers to your doubts/worries and to avoid any misunderstanding

FAQ (Frequently Asked Questions)

Question: Hello! I would like to go to this event. But I am very new to the group. Is it okay to go this event by myself? Thanks!

Yes, most of the newbies come by themselves. But after attending my event; they go back with a big circle of new friends.

If you are attending the event for the first time, it is only natural you get a bit nervous. Do not worry, meet me or Guest Host and inform that you want to be introduced .We will be very much pleased to help you.

How to identify me? I am an Indian with a name tag “FRANCIS ORGANISER"

Question: Hmm..i was there outside but too shy to go inside by myself. Prolly just go somewhere in the area. Next time hopefully. More guts

Hi, sorry to hear that you outside my meetup but too shy to come inside. Being newbie, I can understand your fear and anxiety. Few years back, I was also a shy newbie like you.

Next time, please go to registration counter at the venue and request staff to meet organiser. The staff will inform me. I will come, personally welcome you and introduce to others.

Question: We register when we come that night at Venue?

Yes, you have to register again at the venue.

Members who do not register at the event, arguing that they have already RSVPed in the Meetup website, will be asked to leave the venue

Question: This is my first time joining such event. How do I register again at the venue?

Hi , welcome to my event. When you reach the venue, you will see Registration Table, with a signage “Francis Meetup Event” on the table. Please tell the staff that you are coming for Francis Meetup Event. Pay in cash, registration fees and get a drink coupon and a blank name tag.

Question: Can I bring my friend who is not in the group?

Sure, you can bring your friend, who is not in the group. Please register for your friend also at the registration table

Question: we are very new to this group :) who do we look for when we get there?

You can always look for me (Francis Organiser) when you reach venue. C u in the event

Question:I'm newbie and do not know anybody. How to start a conversation?

My group members are very friendly. So don't be shy and say "hello" or address them by names in their name tags  You never know where the conversation might lead to! friendship or may be relationship.

Question:What is the best time to make more friends?

Please come between 7-8pm. During the period, members will go around, mingle, make new friends and form small groups based on work, hobby, interest, etc

Question:How to identify the venue of this Meetup?

Most of the time, we will have our own signage. Hence please look for signage with words “FRANCIS MEETUP EVENT” at Registration Counter and at the entrance of the venue

Question: hello! am new and haven't exactly tried such meetups so cld I ask how do we recognise each other?

It is very easy to recognize other members since all my members will have name tags. Most of my events are private events. Hence you can mingle with others freely

Question: Is it mandatory for everyone to wear nametag? Im not comfortable doing thar in a public event

If you are not comfortable to write your real name in name tag, you can have any other name or blank name tag. If you are not having name tag, other members will think that you are not from Meetup group and you may not able to mingle with others in the event

Question:My work will end late ... Can I get there by 8pm 

Yes, but my only worry is that if you come late, you may lose the golden opportunity to meet most of the interesting members.

Question:I will be bringing guests with me.. I hope it’s not too late to inform.

Sure, please bring your friends, colleagues and business associates who  want to go to a party that is really happening.

description:
I am going to bring you something different on March 18th.  I am offering an opportunity to join with our Reiki community without having to be stressed out driving across town. 

This Reiki Share will be a full live video class. 

Topic of discussion will be a deeper look at The Reiki Precepts. 

• What did Usui Sensi mean by:

"The Secret of Inviting Happiness through Many Blessings
The Spiritual Medicine for All Illness"?

• How can I integrate the Precepts into my daily life and why is this important? 

•We will close with a Reiki Blessing and Reiju.  

To join us in this Live Video Share, send me an e-mail RSVP no later than 6:00 pm to my  e-mail address:  [masked]  When I get your RSVP I will send you a live link to your e-mail so you can join the meeting.  I will open the video feed at 7:15 and we will begin our class at 7:30. Sign in early, so you to make sure the connection works for you.  The Zoom Meeting format works with  PC, Mac, iOS or Android. Or join by phone:  +1 (415)[masked] or +1 (646)[masked] US Toll  Meeting ID:[masked]

I’m excited to bring this Live Video format to our community so that we can easily connect from where ever you are.  Pay Pal $10.00 donation to help pay for Zoom and Meet Up costs  is appreciated.  Join us!



Up coming dates for Reiki Share


  (1st Wednesday most months,  W2nd Wed some months.... so check the calendar.)
name: Reiki Share

Here's a link to it's description - http://www.dgcoursereview.com/course.php?id=3873&mode=ci

Thanks!

What: Foppiano Portfolio Wine Tasting with Highly rated wines (90+) from the esteemed Northern California winemaker Louis Foppiano on the beautfiul patio at the Warwick (yeah...the place with the Playboy Twist!)  We will be sampling wines from Louis Foppiano's Sonoma Vineyard

We will be on the patio weather permitting.  If there is cold, snow rain/wind we will be INSIDE Randolph's

Where: Warwick Hotel in a private patito wine and food pairing at Randolphs in the place famous for the Playboy Club. 1776 Grant Street Denver, CO 80203 www.warwickdenver.com FREE VALET PARKING

Crowd: Young/Mid Professionals  (Most of our crowd is 30's to 50's but everyone is welcome to our winemaker events.

When: Tuesday April 7, 2015  Please be prompt as we will be serving each wine and appetizer paired

Dress: Dressy Casual/Dress to Impress

Cost: $ 29.99 includes tax and tip (Wine Party Only)

Dress: Business/Dressy Casual to Business/Dress to Impress

Wines and Food Pairing  TBA

Accolades/ratings of wines  http://www.foppiano.com/in-the-news

Founded in 1896 by Giovanni Foppiano, Foppiano Vineyards is one of Sonoma County's oldest continually-operated, family-owned wineries. Our family has supplied northern California with wine for over a century, surviving Prohibition in the 1920s by selling home winemaking kits.

Louis Foppiano is 4th generation and grew up in the winemaking business.  Over the years, Louis has worked in just about every position at the winery: driving the tractor in the vineyards; working the bottling line, crush pad and fermenting tanks; and, later after graduating from college, representing the winery around the world through sales and marketing.

Like the three generations before him, Louis Foppiano has set the simple goal of creating honest, consistent, high quality wines, which are meant to be enjoyed at the table with family and friends. Under his direction, Foppiano Vineyards has enjoyed great success, increased prosperity, and critical acclaim.

description:
Whose up for a tropical getaway? I've found a home in old Puerto Vallarta, poised on the hill overlooking the famous Playa Los Muertos (of Night of the Iguana fame). We can have the place for nine nights, Friday April 10 through Sunday Apriel 19... airport pick up, drop off is included, along with maid service, breakfast fixings and food staples.

The casa is traditional in design, with painted tile and stucco. It features a private garden, large patio, pool and a balcony for optimal sunset viewing. The home backs up to the jungle and is reached by funicular from street level. It has four bedrooms and 3.5 baths. The large master has an en suite bath, available for an extra $250.

The kitchen is great, and will be stocked with wine, water, breakfast fixings and other food staples. We'll have the maid come in every other day or so.

This vacation is all about convenience and lazy, sunny days... It's going to be a pretty unstructured trip. Though I'm thinking of primarily of the beach and pool (and blended margaritas, there are many activities available... snorkeling and eco tours of the jungle, spas and museums. The casa is 5 to 10 minutes walk from downtown so we can walk to the beach, to dinner, or to shop, though cabs are plentiful and affordable.

The price for the trip is $1550 for nine nights, ground only. All activities are extra, though I'm happy to help making arrangements for snorkeling, spas, jungle tours, etc.

We need to book this quickly, or we risk losing out. I do have a backup casa in mind with similar amenity and a few nice perks, but I hope we get this one!

If you RSVP please send me a message to make arrangements!
name: Escape to Tropical Puerto Vallarta, 9 Nights for $1550.00

description:
Let's face it -- doughnuts are delicious in any form. Behold the wonder of pillowy, glazed and powdered doughnuts. So please join us in this class for some sinful indulgence as we mix, fry, fill and dunk donuts of all kinds. 

In this doughnut class, you learn the fundamentals to create yeast doughs and batter with a variety of toppings and glazes. Each student takes home their sweet and delicious goodies.

And oh yeah, since it's difficult to do this kind of work without drooling, you also get to eat a doughnut or two... or three... while you're learning. Sort of like having your cake and eating it too! Icing on the cake so to speak. OK OK, I couldn't resist. I'll stop with the puns now. LOL 

Cost

The cost of this class is $55 including all taxes.

Payment is required at the time you RSVP. Payment can be made with any major credit card or Paypal. A Paypal account is not required. Please contact me if you prefer to use Interac Email Money Transfer instead.

Start Time

Please try to arrive by 6:45 PM so that the class can start promptly at 7:00 PM. Repeating the intructions for late arrivals slows down the class and isn't fair to those who arrived on time.

Location

Our class will be held at the Le Dolci Cake Decorating Studio. It is located at the corner of Dundas St. W & Montrose in the Dundas W & Ossington area. To reach the Le Dolci website, click here.

I look forward to seeing you there!

- Sash
name: Baking Class -- Making Doughnuts

description:
You are invited to join us for a
Native American Gratitude Ritual

Sunday 15th March @4 - 6 pm

Lead by Ian Peric, this Native American Gratitude Ceremony, mostly performed at a New Moon, uses the same core practice made popular by ‘The Secret’. 

Along with Sacred Prayer we use Song, Intention Setting and Meditation to feel the Gratitude for receiving the things we are manifesting. We use this ceremony to give us a platform to realise, cultivate and hold strong feelings of Gratitude, while aligning our vibe with what we are calling in. 


Fee: $30

 Concession: $20 

($10 reserves your space).


You are invited to bring a plate to share at the completion of the ritual.
Ian Peric, Shaman and Author of “13 Weeks to Awakening’, is currently sharing some of his knowledge with us at Oracle Wisdom. 

ORACLE WISDOM is a New Age shop located in McKinnon.                        Opens from 11 am -5.30 daily  

[masked] or[masked]

IF YOU HAVE NOT RESERVED YOUR SPACE IN TIME, - JUST text me to check if we have room AND arrive by 3.50 PM

See our page on FB.
name: NATIVE AMERICAN GRATITUDE CEREMONY

description:
Networking Events Club is pleased to invite you to our Executive Networking Night. On Friday, March 27th, 2015, this event will feature corporate professionals, Consular, Bankers,  professors,  Multinational companies and startups from Greater China (and beyond) will gather at the Just on the Bund from 7-10:00 pm. for an extraordinary evening of networking and business/social chit-chat. This promises to be a special night and one you do not want to miss.

There is a 200RMB admission fee to attend the event.

170RMB if you’re on our wechat ID: networkingevents

We will have free flow on sparkling wine, beer and COCKTAILS (vodka-whisky-rum-gin + soft drinks). 

Free flow is from 7pm-10pm

There will be free flow Canapes/Finger Food

Dress Code: Smart, Elegant

There will be a cash bar after 10pm with discounted price for NEC members, please see the Networking Events Club member’s deal for more detail.

RSVP is mandatory to get entrance to this event. You must confirm your RSVP by wechat. networkingevents

About Networking Events Club.

Networking Events Club (NEC) mission is to bring together all the networking groups in town to socialize, share ideas, contacts and most importantly, business referrals. Benefits of NEC membership include increased exposure to many people and businesses, tools to network more effectively, opportunities to participate in many networking events and Good deals from our partner’s store.

At each of our events,we say, no one stand alone. We welcome everyone, regardless of race, gender, sexual orientation, or belief, to come to our events to participate,socialize or just observe and make new friends

About the Venue for the event on the 27th of March:

Just on the Bund

Just On The Bund is a brand new cosmopolitan club of Shanghai’s bund nightlife. Perched on the 23rd top floor above bund, JUST provides a spectacular view of the region, from stretches of the bund, gorgeous landscape over the Huangpu River, and the bustling Lujiazui city life. Just on the Bund is a place to be if you want to party and Networking Events Club is proud to build partnership with Just on the Bund. This Partnership will give discount to all our wechat followers and members. Please see members deal for JUST ON THE BUND.
name: 3Hrs Free flow on drinks ,Expats & Local Executive Networking Night

description:
Single & mingle social boat party at tattershall castle :)

Join us for this fun mixer at the luxurious Tattershall Castle in embankment, Come after work or join us a little later to make new friends and maybe meet that someone special... 

** Purchase your ticket in advance before attending this event ** Michelle will be checking names of the list as you arrive, this will be a joint single event with 4 different single meetups....

Ticket £6.00 each: http://www.fatsoma.com/single-mingle-social-boat-party-at-tattershall-castle-2/116759

Please pay £6.00 organizer meetup fee in advance only....

Meetup Price: £6 payable in ADVANCE ONLY.. 

Please note that it is free entry to the bar, the £6,00 goes towards paying for the reserved area/meetup fees and the organizer fees...

When you arrive your name will be checked off the list, then you will be directed to the VIP area which is reserved for everyone to mingle & meet other meetup members, this area is only for members who have pre paid in advance...

When you arrive from 6.30pm, you will be directed downstairs to the main bar and you will see signs around the bar that says MEETUP, please make your way downstairs to the lounge area, where I have reserved the vip lounge room for all the meetup members to relax and chill and chat.... 


As your host I will be on hand to introduce guests and make everyone welcome... 

After 11pm you are welcome to move into the the main club area where DJ keeping everyone dancing (that is a seperate price £5 for club entry) or you can relax and chat in the room or on the roof garden balcony area :)

At this point the group should be merry and ready to mingle and dance the night away in style.....

Guests & Friends: You are welcome to bring your friends with you to this event, please tell your friends they must also pay for there ticket in advance too.. 

*********

The Tattershall Castle was built by W. Gray & Co. in 1934 and was a vital passenger link across the Humber estuary ferrying passengers across the stretch of treacherous water between Hull and New Holland.... 

https://www.facebook.com/groups/londonsinglesclub/ 

** Purchase your ticket in advance before attending this event ** Michelle will be checking names of the list as you arrive, this will be a joint single event with 4 different single meetups....

You will get the chance to meet lots of new people from outside meetup, mingle, and chat with other single people....

All ages welcome :)

me :)
name: Single & mingle social boat party at tattershall castle :)

description:
Join us for a Saturday Night Out at The Famous Three Kings pub - directly next to West Kensington Tube Station. There'll be a live DJ performing just for our Meetup group and playing a wide variety of music ( a mix of 80's 90's 2000's and modern chart hits that everyone knows). 

This is one of the biggest and most famous pubs in London. We've managed to privately reserve both the very large 'back-hall' and 'side-bar' just for our group. The live DJ will start at approximately 9:30pm. However, as there are two sections to our reserved area, the DJ will only be playing in one section (the back hall).  The other reserved section, the 'side-bar', will only have low-volume music so it's more suitable for conversation.

Our 250+ capacity privately reserved areas will be separate from the venue's additional sports bar (which incidentally was recently awarded the title of 'Best Sports Bar in Great Britain'). But there'll be no sport showing in our area :-)

The venue closes at 1am.  

We highly recommend new members arrive as close to the start as possible, ideally by 8.15pm. At this time it's much easier to introduce new members to the group, before most members start arriving. The event hosts (Martyn + Terry ) will be in our reserved area waiting to greet new members. In the unlikely event that we don't see you first, please ask members or staff for the event hosts as it's important that members are welcomed to the group. (we'll be holding white attendance sheets and wearing Meetup badges).

Please scroll down to view a photograph of just a part of our reserved area in the 'back hall'. There's also a photograph of the pub and the adjoining West Kensington Tube Station. Turn right out of West Kensington Tube Station (there is only one exit) to reach the pub which is located in the next building along.

In the meantime, if you have any queries then please do not hesitate to contact us. Click on my photo (Martyn) and just choose the option to 'message'. 

kind regards 
Martyn and Terry
name: Saturday Night Out in Kensington +Live DJ (Next to West Kensington Tube Station)
